loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia lives in Lahore. She is 40 years old and a mother of 4. Her children go to school. Her husband has a machine shop in the nearby market where he mends, repairs and manufactures different nuts, screws, spare parts, etc. He has been in this business for many years now and has become an expert. He also has a few workers whom he teaches this skill. He does this through his lathe machine. Due to constant usage his lathe machine has worn out and he needs to buy a new machine. For this purpose Rafia has requested a loan to help her husband with the purchase of a lathe machine. He wants to keep his family happy and fulfill all their wishes.

loans.use: to help her husbnad buy a lathe machine.

loans.name: Ricardina Luzmarina

texts.es: Ricardina es una mujer trabajadora de 64 años de edad que vive en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que ella cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en: Ricardina is a hardworking woman of 64 who lives in the rural town of Puquina, which is located in Moquegua. She works as a farm laborer and she also raises organic cattle, paying a lot of attention to their care and the feed she gives them, which is made up of organic alfalfa she grows. She is requesting this micro loan to buy two organic cows; she expects their milk to sell at a better price because it is organic. In the future she hopes to improve her living conditions and to stay in good health, which is why she's betting on organic.

loans.use: To buy two organic cows to sell the milk they produce and thereby increase her income.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 53 years old. She is married with 6 children. She has had a retail shop business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase retail goods such as rice, cooking oil and maize flour for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her retail business, make more income and be able to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods such as rice, cooking oil and maize flour to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en: Kastriot has been living with his sister since his parents passed away. Last year he started working as a bus driver for a monthly pay of $237 and his sister has been taking care of securing their staple food; she's got some chickens and she plant veggies and all these are for their consumption.

loans.use: to make some basic renovations to the home where he and his sister live

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells juices, flour, bread, cooking fat, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour and other items. His business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice,  flour and other items

loans.name: Trop

texts.en:
From Kang Meas District, Kampong Cham Province, Trop, 43, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around 2.5 USD a day to support her family's daily needs. She is a lovely mother of four.

To expand her farming business, Trop would like to get cows to help her plow her farmland, yet she can’t afford them. Due to her shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to get cows to help her plow her farmland.

loans.name: María Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia, de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de veinte años, pero el matrimonio no duro mucho tiempo; en esa relación tuvo tres hijos, todos son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en el extranjero y una hija ya está casada pero vive cerca de su casa.

Olimpia, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio debido su avanzada edad, pero anteriormente trabajaba en la agricultura, pero ahora solo se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus animales de corral, pero a pesar de eso siempre tiene el hábito de cosechar sus propios granos básicos, esto lo logra por medio de personas que busca para que trabajen y ella les paga. 	

Olimpia, necesita el préstamo para comprar 10 quintales de sulfato y 10 quintales de fórmula para que su cultivo germine y logre una buena cosecha para comercializarla y dejar para el gasto de ella.

Sus sueños son, poder seguir dirigiendo sus trabajos y que sus hijos siempre la apoyen económicamente.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 70-years old. She went to school until the 6th grade. She got married when she was twenty-years old but the marriage did not last very long. From that relationship she had three children. They are all adults, two of them live overseas and one daughter is already married but lives near her house.

Olimpia does not have any type of business due to her old age, but she previously worked in agriculture. Now she only works taking care of the house and her barnyard animals. Despite that, she has always had the habit of harvesting her own basic grains. She does this through people who are looking for work and she pays them.

Olimpia needs the loan to buy 10 quintals of sulphate and 10 quintals of formula so that her crops germinate and she has a good harvest to market and for her to spend. Her dreams are to be able to continue directing her work and that her children always support her economically.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of sulphate and 10 quintals of formula so that her crops germinate and she has a good harvest to market.

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
Chanthea, 36 years old, is a farmer in a rice field who lives in Srei Santhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of two children. Her husband is also a farmer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 10 a day.

During this time, Chanthea is facing financial issues in her family. She needs some money to build a new house to improve her housing because her current house has started to fall into decay but yet she can’t afford it. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help her. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to build a new house to improve her housing.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She sells kerosene and has been in the business for two years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy more stock of kerosene to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family. She will use the profits to educate her children as well as reinvest in the business to boost it. Her future hopes and dreams are to open more kerosene shops in other places.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kerosene to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Meludina

texts.en:
Meludina is a hardworking 46-year-old married woman who earns a living by engaging in a fruit and vegetable vending business, which she has used to manage the economy of her house. She has six children. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells rice. For the last four years, she has had a stall situated inside the market in her town, catering to locals and town dwellers in her place.

Meludina wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase assorted vegetables like squash, bottle gourd, eggplant and green leafy vegetables. These will improve and contribute more stocks to be displayed, thus, attracting more buyers to come. In the long run, she could now provide her family with proper diets and better shelter to live in.

In the future, she is hopeful that she will become successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase assorted vegetables like squash, bottle gourd, eggplant and green leafy vegetables.

loans.name: Vidardina

texts.es:
Doña Vidardina es una mujer  comerciante con más de 60 años  soltera, Sus ingresos proviene de su negocio  que es la abarrotería    actividad  que  realiza   en su casa de habitación,  vive en Choluteca Honduras, sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, ya que su negocio es uno de los más visitados en su comunidad. 
 Daña Vidardina nos está solicitando el crédito para invertir en la compra de más productos granos básicos, manteca, refrescos, pollo, carne, churros, queso, mantequilla,  etc. y así  surtir más su negocio ya que en este momento no cuenta con suficiente mercadería. Y sus ventas han incrementado un poco más. Está muy contenta de poder trabajar con Prisma

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y con el tiempo a ser supermercado

Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
Vidardina is a merchant with more than 60 years as a single woman. Her income comes from her grocery store business, a job that she does in her house. She lives in Choluteca, Honduras. Her main customers are the neighbors of the area because her business is one of the most visited in her community.

Vidardina is asking for the loan to buy more products such as basic grains, butter, soft drinks, chicken, meat, churros, cheese, butter, etc., and thus supply her business more because at the moment she does not have enough merchandise. Her sales have increased a little bit more. She is very happy to be working with Prisma.

Her dream is to grow her business and with time turn it into a supermarket.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2015

loans.use: to buy more products such as basic grains, butter, soft drinks, chicken, meat, churros, cheese, and butter.

loans.name: Jenabudha Group

texts.en:
Jenabudha Group started in the year 2015 at M.Rampur village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are four active self-dependent women, with the intention of developing their existing business as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Pramila is one of them who taken a great role for her development and group members’ livelihood improvement. She is standing second from left in the photo. She is about 34 years old and living with her small family, her husband and two children.

Pramila’s husband has engaged in the cloth business for the last ten years. Pramila is also helping him to promote the business. Through the concerned business, the family earns a monthly income of 9,800 INR.

In Pramila’s opinion, this small income makes it very difficult to maintain the family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible, so she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail a loan for the expansion of her business. It will be the fourth cycle loan for the group. The past record of repayment is very good, with 100% on time repayment.

Pramila planned to purchase a huge quantity of dress materials, sarees and other cloth during the season. As the festival season is coming Pramila hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to provide better education to her children.

The other three members of the group are also smart at their professional and also actively engaged with differ professional like bicycle store, cloth business and boiler / chicken shop.

loans.use: to purchase huge quantity of dress materials, sarees, and other cloth.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities including noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, powdered milk, seasonings, toiletries and soft drinks.

She is a 57-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for many years now. She also sells gasoline, as supplemental income. She is married and has three grown children.

Due to the high demands for commodities and other necessities, Nicanora decided to access a loan to boost her businesses.

She has requested a loan to purchase 10 containers of gasoline and assorted soft drinks. These will definitely fill her store and cater to the needs of her customers. Slowly her income will augment.

In the future, she is hopeful that she will become productive in handling her business to become prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase 10 containers of gasoline and assorted soft drinks

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Shahida has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years and she contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better service to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Shahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her parlor business.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin is a 48-year-old married homemaker of three children. She resides in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Her husband is 43 years old and he is a car driver at a company. One of her children works in a factory and another two children are attending school. Together, they can can make an income of $15 daily.

She wants to buy piglets to fatten and sell but she does not have enough money, so she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With this loan, she will have enough finances to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve her living standards. In the future, Savin would like to expand her farming business, build a new house and support her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he left school at an early age to help his parents in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Mohammad has been working in agriculture for eleven years. He has professional skills which he gained from his parents. Although he is working hard to develop his business, his income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses. Thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to paint and finish building his own house. This loan is very important to Mohammad for it will be the first step toward building his own family and an independent life.

loans.use: to paint and finish building his own house

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
As a farmer from Srei Santhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Ly, 52 years old, is working very hard in the rice field near her house. She is a hardworking mother of three children, one of whom is married. She can earn approximately 5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than twenty years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Ly is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

So she hopes that this requirement will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Mlimani A Group

texts.en:
Avelina, who is in her early 30s, is married with two schooling children. She has been running a business selling fresh bananas for four years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Avelina's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her raw banana stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay her kids' school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the raw bananas to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of expanding her business.

Avelina will share this loan with her loan group Mlimani A, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the raw bananas to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells newspapers. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of newspapers. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of newspapers

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Tabita is in her early 30s and is married with one small child. She has been running a pharmacy shop for three years now. She works from 7630 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tabita's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the medicine in the pharmacy and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to repay the loan, to take care of her family, to reinvest in her business and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving medicines in her pharmacy. She dreams of expanding her pharmacy.

Tabita will share this loan with her loan group Mlimani, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving medicines in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary. She is twenty-eight years old, married and the mother of one. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She owns a boutique shop as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to run the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more clothing stock for the shop so that she can increase her sales and in return increase her profits. This will assist her in catering for her family’s upkeep.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes that will enable her to expand the business, leading to more profits.

loans.name: Kamathatha Mworoto Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Esther. She is fifty-four years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does maize and bean farming to earn a living. She gained knowledge through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise start up and development. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming. This will improve her income and hence she will be in a position to pay school fees for her children and continue supporting her family needs.

Esther is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
The lady in the picture is Naomi. She is seventy-five years old and married with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She is in the farming business, where she farms maize and beans and keeps poultry. She gained knowledge through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise start up and development. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost her harvest. This will improve her income; hence she will be in a position to pay school fees for her children and continue supporting her family needs.

Naomi is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost her harvest.

loans.name: Safije

texts.en:
The photograph is of Safije and her husband, Engjellush or "Angel" in English, who is missing one arm and an eye. "My husband had an accident at work very long ago that left him without an arm and an eye, but this did not prevent him from working. He helps me out a lot, of course with limitations, regardless of his physical condition. Without him, I wouldn't take on so much," said Safije in the interview. In the background of the photograph is their house where they now want to build a toilet with this loan. They are in their late 40s and are the married parents of two.

Safije and Engjellush have been doing rural activities for about ten years. They have orange orchards from which they sell about 250 kg a year at a price of $.6/kg and they also have grapevines from which they sell about 350 kg of grapes a year at a price of $.6 kg.Ten years ago they added some greenhouses as well where they produce five quintal of tomatoes and cucumbers for $.4/kg.

loans.use: to improve sanitation by building a toilet to manage sewage. Her husband had an accident at work that left him without an arm and an eye.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 47 years old, a widow and has three children. She is selling grocery items for income. She wants to continue improving her business and is in need of additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

She will invest additional revenue in educational expenses. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, meat and fish to sell. This will help increase her sales and profits as well. She hopes to pay back her loan in full and achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy feed, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, meat and fish to sell.

loans.name: Freedom Chanika Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, who is in his mid 30s, is married with one small child. He has been running a general store for eight years now. He works from 7:30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamisi's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the store and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing fine with his loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay the loan, to reinvest in his business and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in his general store. He dreams of going out of the country to buy rice and resell it at a wholesale price.

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group Freedom Chanika, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in his general store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros, aged 49, is married and they're blessed with four children. She sells pork barbecue, and some chicken snacks in their village, She's been in this business for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 200 a day. Due to inadequate capital in her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase food ingredients for her food vending business. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with four children. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include food and utilities.

She sells charcoal at the market and has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.

Her major business challenges include high transportation costs. Her goal is to increase her capital so as to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Felana

texts.fr:
Le prêt précédent s’est bien passé pour Felana. Avec ses activités d’élevage porcin et de vente de poissons séchés, elle a pu gagner beaucoup de bénéfices avec lesquels, elle a commencé la construction de sa maison.  Pour ce prêt, elle compte augmenter le stock de poissons séchés à vendre et le nombre de porcs à engraisser. Elle va aussi utiliser une partie du prêt pour cultiver de la pomme de terre. Elle n’a pas de problèmes à trouver des clients car elle est déjà connue dans le village.
Les bénéfices vont servir à la finition de la maison.
texts.en:
The previous loan worked well for Felana. With her work raising pigs and selling dried fish, she was able to earn enough to start building her house.

For this loan, she plans to increase her stock of dried fish to resell and the number of pigs she is raising. She is going to also use a part of the loan to farm potatoes.

She does not have trouble finding customers, because she is already known in the village.

Earnings will serve to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, some kilograms of dried fish to resell, and potato seeds to farm.

loans.name: Jahada

texts.en:
Jahada is a single mother of two children and both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Jahada operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Zaliya

texts.en:
Zaliya is married, with six children who are all in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Zaliya has a food stall and has been in this business for 9 years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, green bananas and sweet potatoes.

Her major business challenges include perishability and seasonality of food. She would like to start farming to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, green bananas and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
46 ans, Elise est mariée à un employé de bureau retraité. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont l'ainé est déjà marié, le second en quête de travail et les deux derniers sont encore scolarisés
Le revenu familial est constitué par la pension trimestriel de son époux et le revenu généré par son activité de production de paniers en raphia.
Elle dispose 16 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine car avant 2012 elle travaillait déjà dans ce domaine mais entant que salariée. Depuis lors, elle décidait de vole de ses propres ailes et commencer son propre affaire.
Elle a  beaucoup de clients  et certains d'entre eux sont des étrangers. elle voudrait développer et améliorer son activité (quantité, qualité, et modèles).
texts.en:
Elise is 46 years old and married to a retired office worker. She is the mother of four children. The eldest child is already married, the second eldest is looking for work, and the two youngest are still in school.

The family's income is made up of her husband's pension and any earnings made from Elise's work selling raphia baskets. She has 16 years' experience with this work, because before 2012 she was already doing this work but as an employee [in a company].

Since then she decide to fly with her own wings and start her own business. She has many customers, including some foreign customers.

Elise would like to develop and improve her business (quantity, quality, and diversity of products).

loans.use: to buy rabanes, rahias, fabric, and baskets.

loans.name: Adjele  Akpevi

texts.fr: Adjele est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Baguida avec ses trois enfants et son mari. Adjele est âgée de 35 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Adjele est une revendeuse de pagnes et divers qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Adjele sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes et des cartons de biscuits en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Adjele is an energetic, married woman who lives in Baguida with her three children and husband. She is 35 years old and works hard to earn a good financial situation. She resells pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and other goods, which she procures twice a month from the market and resells in a small kiosk in front of her home.

To attain her goals, Adjele is seeking this loan to order lengths of pagnes and cartons of cookies, with the hopes of meeting her customers' needs.

She hopes to earn absolute financial independence and to help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful cloth] and two cartons of cookies.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Akoua est âgée de 48 ans et habite à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte bandée « kom » faite à base du maïs. Akoua s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akoua sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs, des kilogrammes de poissons et des litres d’huile afin de bien revendre puis gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de sa famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Akoua is a married woman who has four children under her care. She is 48 years old and lives in Baguida, where she works making “pâte bandée” [a kind of polenta] called “ kom.”

Akoua procures the necessary ingredients to make this kom three times a month from the market, and makes her resales in front of her home.

Akoua is seeking this loan to order corn, fish, and oil so she can sell and earn more.

Earnings will be used to help her husband with their family's needs and to improve their children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one sac of corn, 10 kilograms of fish, and 10 liters of oil.

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: Affi est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans résidante à Baguida. Mère de cinq enfants, Affi est une marchande des produits alimentaires qu’elle achète et revend à la devanture de son domicile. Affi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et le sac d’oignons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Affi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Affi is 34 years old, married, and lives in Baguida. She is the mother of five chldren.

Affi works by selling food products in front of her home. She procures her stock four times a month at a market. She is seeking this loan to order trays of fresh tomatoes and a sac of onions.

With the profits she makes, Affi plans to improve the look of where she sells her products and help her husband take care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy three trays of fresh tomatoes and one sac of onions.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una extraordinaria mujer de 34 años de edad, es casada con una familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 6 y 8 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosa es una mujer muy amable y sincera tiene varios años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pulseras típicas, a ella le encanta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comunidad  de su hogar y esto le permite cuidar mejor de sus hijos, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la carpintería.
Rosa en estos momentos necesita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales  y abastecer mejor su negocio de carpintería y a si elaborara los mejores muebles.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer aún más su negocio  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is an extraordinary woman of 34 who is married and has two children aged 6 and 8. This beautiful family lives in a community of Solola. 

Rosa is a very kind and honest woman and she has made traditional bracelets for several years. She loves this occupation as she can conduct it from her home community and this allows her to better take care of her children, but in order to improve her income she does carpentry work. 

At this moment Rosa needs a loan to buy materials to further supply her carpentry business and in this way make the best furniture. Her big dream is to further strengthen her business and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Abla est une femme âgée de 29 ans résidant à Baguida. Abla est une marchande de produits d’alimentaires, des céréales et divers qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander le sac de maïs et des bols du haricot en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Abla is 29 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in Baguida and works selling food products, cereals, and other diverse goods, which she procures three times a month at a market and resells in a kiosk in front of her home.

Abla is seeking this loan to make an order for a sac of corn and bowls of beans, which will increase her stock and maximize her profits.

Earnings will help her husband to cover their children's eduction and their family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sac of corn and 14 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec cinq enfants à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Abla vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des unités de pains, des paniers de tomates fraîches et le sac de maïs, Abla demande ce crédit pour financer son achat afin de mieux revendre puis avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is 38 years old, married, and lives in Baguida with five children under her care. To encourage [her children's] development, Abla works selling general food goods. She makes a living thanks to this work.

Abla procures her stock twice a month at a market. She is seeking this loan to finance the purchase of bread, fresh tomatoes, and corn.

With improved sales and profits, she will be able to help her husband support their children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 80 units of bread, one sac of corn, and four trays of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Rony 14131 Group

texts.en:
Suzan is the featured borrower for Rony 14131 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Suzan is a 39-year-old married mother of four. Five years ago, she started selling cosmetics to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Suzan is the first lady on the left.
With respect to the other school members, Chadia is the second lady on the left, Mirai is the second lady on the right, and Rana is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members . She sales charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her challenge is high transportation costs. Her goals and aspirations are to build more rental houses. She lives in rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sope Ramatoulaye" Beg Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit dénommé « Sope Ramatoulaye » rassemble cinq femmes qui s’activent toute dans le commerce et qui appartiennent au même réseau de femmes de la zone. Elles viennent pour la première fois solliciter un crédit afin de renforcer leurs activités commerciales. 
La présidente, madame Awa, âgée de 30 ans, s’active dans la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de famille. Elle aura besoin de cette argent pour acheter des denrées alimentaires dont elle a besoin pour préparer les repas qu’elle propose à sa clientèle ; de la viande, du poisson, des épices, de l’oignon, de la pomme de terre…  L’achat en gros est plus économique que le détail, ce qui l’a plus motivé à solliciter ce crédit.
Avec le bénéfice de ses ventes, elle appuie dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Son  ambition future  et d’agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en:
The group named "Sope Ramatoulaye" is made up of five women who all work in commerce and belong to the same network in the area. They are seeking a loan for the first time as a way to increase their business.

The president, Awa, is 30 years old and has run a restaurant for ten years. She is married and the mother of a family.

Awa needs this loan to buy food (meat, fish, spices, onions, potatoes, etc.), which she will use to prepare the meals that she offers to her customers. Purchasing ingredients at wholesale is more economical than buying at retail, and it this reason that motivated her to seek a loan.

With the earnings from her sales, she supports her family's everyday expenses.

Awa's goal for the future is to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food to prepare meals for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. she works seven days a week. She has been in this business for three years.

She has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,100,000 to buy hair relaxers, weaves, braids and shampoo. Her major challenge is power shortages. Her is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, weaves, braids and shampoo.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for 17 years. She earns a monthly income of fourteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice, maize flour etc. for the shop.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and reinvest the rest in the business to boost it. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable business and grow it into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice, maize flour etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 58, married to a housewife, and has 5 children. He has cement sales project and he is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy building materials, such as bricks and sand to meet the increasing demands of his village customers

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks and sand. .

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme célibataire âgée de 53 ans qui vit avec un seul enfant à charge. Akouvi est une revendeuse de piment résidant à Agoè. Akouvi achète ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de piment vert en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider son enfant dans l'organisation de son éducation scolaire et à son épanouissement.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 53 years old, single, and takes care of one child. She lives in Agoe and works selling peppers.

Akouvi buys her stock four times a month from a market and makes her resales in front of her home.

She is seeking this loan to order sacs of green peppers, with the goal of reselling them and earning enough to help her child with their education and development.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of green peppers.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and married with one child.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 48 years old with 3 children ages 24, 8 and 7 years old.
Her husband works as a driver with minimum salary which barely support their needs.

Sofia sell and deliver home products like detergent powder, dish washing soap and fabric conditioner to help provide their day to day expenses.
She also sell peanut butter and other salable items to generate income for their family.

Sofia is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 5,000 to buy 20 kilos of detergent powder, 10 bottles of dish-washing soap and 20 bottles of  fabric conditioner to sell to her customers.

The loan will provide Sofia an additional capital she can roll to generate an income. Sofia works hard roaming her community and selling her products to provide for her children needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 kilos of detergent powder, 10 bottles of dish-washing soap and 20 bottles of  fabric conditioner to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronia earns a living by making and selling native roof made of nipa (palm) leaves. It is usually suitable used as roof for native huts mostly in the Philippines.

She is a 44-year-old married woman and has five children. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 5. Her husband has an income that could help support the needs of his family.

She has been weaving nipa (palm) for a long time now. She caters mostly to town settlers in her place. She needs funds to boost her business.

Veronica wants to buy nipa (palm) and oway ( a kind of palm used to tie). These are vital tools that would help improve the economy of her household.

In the future, She would like to continue expand her livelihood to become successful and also improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa (palm) and  oway  ( a kind of palm used to tie)

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis le 23 Janvier 2003, vient d’entamer son vingt quatrième cycle et les femmes sont solidaires entre elles et vivent dans le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à droite avec une main levée et en médaillon) est  l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe). Elle est mariée et mère 03 garçons et 04 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaire pour le revendre en détail dans son quartier.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter 05 cartons de fruits divers oranges, mangues, mandarines bananes et d’autres condiments.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la gestion de la  dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
This group was created on 23 January 2003, and they have just started their 24th loan cycle. These women all live in the same village and share a sense of solidarity. They work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Binta, who is seated on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. She works selling fruits and other condiments, which she buys from the weekly markets and resells at retail in her neighborhood.

With this new loan, she is wishes to buy condiments and five boxes of various fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, mandarins, and bananas.

Earnings will allow her to help cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments and five boxes of various fruits, such as oranges, mangoes, mandarins, and bananas.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Bernard is 33 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer and has been in the farming business for 7 years. This is his 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans well. He will use the loan to buy organic manure and farm chemicals for use in his farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to boost his farming business and improve his family's standard of living. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming by growing more cash crops and become a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and farm chemicals for use in his farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a married woman having four children. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making artificial jewelry and has been for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Ghazala is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them.

In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes get increase in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Ysai

texts.es:
Ysai con 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ysai se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas como peón agrícola, contando con herramientas propias, una de ellas es su moto lineal en la cuál le permite desplazarse hacia sus labores diarias como peón-jornalero; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de infraestructura donde guarda sus herramientas y de su moto lineal, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Ysai es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido tres crédito de S/.1000,00; S/.5000,00 y S/.2000,00 los cuáles han sido cancelados de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
Ysai is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and son in the district of Oyotun, province of Chiclayo in Peru, in a rural area. The people of this area mainly work in agriculture, commerce and cattle farming. 

He makes a living delivering services as a farm laborer with his own tools, one being his motorcycle which allows him to move around in his daily jobs as a day laborer. With over 10 years of experience in the business, which is located in his own home, he requests a loan for the maintenance of the building where he keeps his tools and motorcycle. This investment will allow him to keep his equipment and tools in better conditions which will have a great impact on his business. 

The client expects to improve the productivity of his services and so be able to meet the different needs of the customers in the area. 

Ysai is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had three loans of S/.1000,00; S/.5000,00 and S/.2000,00 which he repaid on time. Since becoming a member with us his business and his quality of life have improved.

loans.use: to maintain the building where he keeps his tools and motorcycle

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor   Henry  creció con sus padres con muy buenos principios cristianos, estudió en la escuela de la comunidad pero solo estudio hasta sexto grado, él es un pequeño comerciante,  es casado y tiene 2 hijos, tiene su casa propia en donde tiene una pulperia de abarroteria y productos de enseres que abastece a la pequeña comunidad donde habita, el señor Henry es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y no tiene problema con nadie en su comunidad. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a salido adelante en su comunidad, pero en ese lugar no hay energía eléctrica, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema de refrigeración solar, este sistema solar será de gran beneficio para los miembros del hogar y la comunidad por que así podrá ofrecer productos que necesitan refrigeración como carnes, bebidas heladas, entre otras cosas, el señor Henry  estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para poder comprar el sistema de refrigeración .
texts.en:
Henry was raised by parents with very good Christian principles. He studied at the community school but only up to sixth grade. He is a small business owner, married, and has two children. He has his own house where he runs a store where he sells groceries and home products to the small community where he lives.

Henry is a very hard-working, responsible person who has no problems with anyone in his community. Through much effort and dedication he has gotten ahead in the community although there is no electricity there. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy a solar powered refrigeration system which will benefit the members of hise household and the community, since he will be able to sell refrigerated products such as meats, cold drinks and other products.

Henry would be very grateful for this opportunity of a loan to buy the refrigeration system.

loans.use: to buy a solar powered refrigeration system.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Lili tiene 52 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Ella implemento una pequeña ferretería en su vivienda hace años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ladrillos cemento y pinturas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lili es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Lili is 52 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two dependent children. Several years ago she started a small hardware shop in her home. She will use the loan to buy bricks, cement and paints.

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan. Lili is the second from the right in a light blue top.

loans.use: to buy cement and paints.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Salvador Group

texts.es: Dúo Dios Salvador Este dúo está integrado por Mayda ella es originaria de la aldea El Arado de Sumpango,  ella es casada y madre de familia, doña Mayda es propietaria de una carnicería y una abarrotería(tienda de productos comestibles)  desde hace más de 10 años, ella tiene 5 hijos y todos estudian, además los fines de semana  se dedica a vender granizadas de frutas, es muy trabajadora y luchadora  pero ahora necesita de capital para poder invertir en su negocio de productos comestibles ya que es la abarrotería más grande que hay en esa comunidad por lo que desea además de vender carne de res  vender pollo, y carne de marrano, por lo que dice que para poder cumplir su sueño necesita de capital, es el segundo crédito que solicita con kiva y ha pagado muy bien y no duda en seguir siendo responsable en cada pago
texts.en:
One of the members of the Duo Dios Salvador team is Mayda who is from the village of El Arado de Sumpago. She is married and has a family. Mayda owns a butcher shop and grocery store and has been in business for ten years. She has five children who all attend school. On the weekends she sells fruit smoothies.

She is a very hard-working, determined person but is in need of capital to invest in her food business. Since it is the largest grocery store in the community she wants to sell beef, chicken and pork. To be able to realize her dream she needs the loan, which is the second Kiva loan. She has a good credit record and promises to continue being responsible with regard to loan payments.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Disnarda Xiomara

texts.es:
Disnarda es una mujer honrada y trabajadora, que luego de quedar viuda, comenzó a trabajar duro para sacar a sus tres hijos adelante. Actualmente tiene una tienda en su casa de habitación donde oferta cremas, perfumes, maquillaje, shamppo, entre otros artículos.  Su sobrina, quien es su principal apoyo, no deja que esta ejemplar mujer detenga su crecimiento como comerciante.
En estos momentos, el negocio de Disnarda está en un punto clave, dado que sus clientes están demandando más productos y de mejor calidad, por eso ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito que le permita comprar maquillaje y cremas de marca, con esto aprovechara la temporada del año y aumentara sus ganancias. En un futuro desea poder mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda y poder ofertar accesorios, ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Disnarda is an honest and hard-working woman who, after becoming a widow, began to work hard to get her three children ahead. Currently she has a store in her house where she sells creams, perfumes, makeup, shampoo and other things. Her niece, who is her primary support, doesn't allow this model woman stop her growth as a saleswoman.

At this time, Disnarda's business is at a key point, given that her customers are demanding more and better-quality products. Because of this, she is asking for a loan from Kiva with MiCrédito which allows her to purchase brand name makeup and creams, with this she will take advantage of the season of the year and increase her earnings. In the future she wants to improve the infrastructure of her store and be able to sell accessories, clothing, and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase brand name makeup and creams.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 18 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Maria para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de artesanías en una de las zonas más frecuentadas por turistas, con este negocio tiene 5 años de realizarlo. Maria con el afán de mejorar sus servicios hacia los clientes ha decidido solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de artesanías como: pulseras, chalinas, cuadros. Esto con el fin de llamar la atención de más clientes. Ella espera fortalecer mejor su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year-old woman, married, with a lovely family of three children between the ages of 2 and 18. They live in a community of Sololá.

Maria, to generate her income and get her family ahead, works selling crafts in one of the areas frequented by tourists, she had been doing this business for 5 years. Maria, with the desire to improve her customer service, has decided to ask for a loan which she will invest in more craft products such as bracelets, scarfs, and paintings. This is with the end of attracting more customers. She hopes to strengthen her business more to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase craft products such as bracelets, scarves and paintings.

loans.name: Josefa Esmeralda

texts.es: Josefa de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace mas de un año y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir los cuartos pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Josefa, 31, lives in her own house with her life partner. She sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and has been in business for a year. Through her work she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She wants to improve her house by finishing construction of the bedrooms but she does not earn enough to carry out the project. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy the construction materials she needs to upgrade her home.

loans.use: to buy the construction materials she needs.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la venta de antojitos y en los trabajos de agricultura, comprara abono, insecticidas y herbicidas para sembrar granos básicos, otra parte será de utilidad para adquirir materiales como aceite, harina, verduras, etc., con los que preparara la venta de antojitos, espera tener buenos resultados como en el crédito anterior.
Ella utilizo el préstamo anterior en su negocio, con ello ha mantenido su fuente de ingresos en el mercado, sus ingresos son estables y su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan to invest in her snack business, as well as in her agriculture business. She will buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides to plant basic grains. The other part of the loan will be used to buy goods such as oil, flour, vegetables, etc. to make and sell snack foods. She hopes to have the same good results as with the previous loan.

She used the previous loan in her business and has maintained her souce of income in the market. Her income is stable and her family is in optimum conditions.

loans.use: to buy goods such as oil, flour, vegetables, etc. to prepare and sell snacks.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado debido a la pobreza extrema y la falta de escuelas en la zona donde vivía, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, sus hijos mayores trabajan y los menores están estudiando.
 
Ernesto, se dedica a la venta de dulces de maní y agua de coco desde hace 20 años y con estos ingresos ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles lo necesario, su lugar de trabajo es en las estaciones de buses donde la afluencia de personas es bastante y esto le da la oportunidad de vender más; también es albañil y trabaja de eso cuando las ventas de dulces no están del todo bien y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d. 

Ernesto, necesita el préstamo para comprar dulces para la venta, porque al comprar grandes cantidades lo compra a un precio más bajo y evita viajar muchas veces a la ciudad donde compra el producto.

Los sueños de Ernesto, son poder  seguir trabajando y darles a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 53 years old, went to school up to the second grade due to the extreme poverty and lack of schools in the zone where he lived. He is married, his wife takes care of the household tasks, his older children work and the younger ones go to school.

Ernesto has worked selling peanut candies and coconut water for 20 years and with this income he has managed to get his children ahead and give them what they need. His workplace is in the bus stations where there is quite a flow of people and this gives him the opportunity to sell more. He is also a bricklayer and works in this when the candy sales are not very good and his work schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.

Ernesto needs the loan to purchase more candies to sell, because when he purchases large quantities, he purchases them at a lower price and avoids travelling many times to the city where he purchases his product.

Ernesto's dream is to be able to continue working and give his children the necessary support for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase candies to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro Eugenio

texts.es: Alejandro es un hombre de 53 años que vive junto a su pareja y sus seis hijos en la localidad rural de Cora Cora, que está ubicada en Ayacucho. Él se ha dedicado a labores agrícolas por más de 26 años, actualmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder preparar su terreno agrícola, abonándolo con materia orgánica, eliminando la maleza, etc., para así aumentar el rendimiento de su próximo cultivo. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y brindarles estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Alejandro is a 53-year-old man who lives with his partner and six children in the rural place of Cora Cora, which is located in Ayacucho. He has worked in agriculture for over 26 years, currently he works as a farm laborer and also works raising organic cattle, always putting a lot of attention into the care and the feed that he offers them, which is made up of organic alfalfa that he grows. He asks for the microloan to be able to prepare his farmland, fertilizing it with organic material, getting rid of the weeds, etc., so in this way to increase the production of his next crop. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions and offer them economic stability.

loans.use: to prepare his farmland to increase the production of the next crop.

loans.name: Dora Eleticia

texts.es:
Dora, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que viven en casa.

Dora, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace 4 años, su madre le enseño este oficio y decidió poner en práctica, el lugar donde vende está a orilla de calle y ya tiene bastantes clientes y emplea a su hermana para que le ayuda todos los días; su horario de venta es de 2:00 p.m. a 9:00 p.m. Hace poco tiempo, con ayuda de un crédito que se le otorgo reparo el techo y encerró con lámina todo el lugar, para cubrirse del sol y de la lluvia.    

Dora, necesita el préstamo para comprar 20 quintales de maíz para hacer las pupusas y para realizarle una mejora a su vivienda. 

Los sueños de Dora, es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y tener mejores ingresos y darles una mejor estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora, 30 years old, studied up to the sixth grade in the community school. She is partnered, her partner works in agriculture, and they have two children who live in the house.

Dora has had a business selling pupusas for 4 years. Her mother taught her this trade and she decided to put it into practice. The place where she sells them is on the edge of the street and she has many customers and employs her sister to help her every day. Her sales times are from 2:00 pm to 9:00 pm. A little while ago, with the help of a loan that was granted to her, she repaired the roof and enclosed the whole place with metal sheeting to protect it from the sun and rain.

Dora needs the loan to purchase 20 quintals of corn to make the pupusas and to make improvements on her house.

Dora's dream is to be able to always grow in her sales and have better income and give her children better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase 20 quintals of corn to make pupusas and to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Jose Widmarck

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad y solo ellos viven en casa. 

José, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace más de 15 años, también tiene ganado de repasto, aprendió este trabajo porque sus padres a eso se dedicaron siempre; pero también tiene conocimientos de electricidad por lo cual hace trabajo de instalaciones de energía y las parcelas están a 30 minutos de su casa y viaja en una motocicleta y su pareja le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas y el horario de trabajo de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 terneros para repasto. 

El sueño de José, es poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y también crecer en la ganadería.
texts.en:
José, 41 years old, went to school up to the fourth grade. He is partnered, his partner takes care of the domestic tasks. He has 1 child, 2 years old, and they live alone in the house.

José has worked growing basic grains for over 15 years, he also has stocker cattle. He learned this work because his parents also always worked at it, but he also has knowledge of electricity, so he works installing electricity and the plots are 30 minutes from his house and he travels on a motorcycle and his partner helps him with the farmwork and the work schedule is from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.

José needs the loan to purchase 2 stocker calves.

José's dream is to be able to provide an education for his children and also to grow in raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase two stocker calves.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 47 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de tortillas actividad que realiza en su vivienda, desde hace 10 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que logro comprar su vivienda hace 10 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio en el cual vivir. Ana desea invertir en su negocio, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayor y materiales para reparar el lugar donde realiza sus ventas.
texts.en: Ana is a 47-year-old woman who works selling tortillas, work that she has done in her house for 10 years, so she has many customers who ask for her products.  She is a hard-working woman who managed to purchase her house 10 years ago, for which she feels very happy to be able to have her own place in which to live. Ana wants to invest in her business, since it is her only source of income, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in corn in bulk and materials to repair the place where she sells.

loans.use: to invest in corn in bulk and materials to repair the place where she sells.

loans.name: Ana Odilia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, ella solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She has had a cornmeal mill located in her home for 10 years. She has many customers, especially the women who make tortillas since they go there to grind the corn. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to cover home household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase what she needs for the mill such as bands, discs, blades, etc. to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase bands, discs, blades, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Unión Y Confianza Group

texts.es: Dúo Unión y Confianza La señora Olga Noemí es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a vender juguetes, ropa, gorras, en el mercado de Tecpan, debido a que no cuenta con suficiente recurso económico para invertir en mercadería y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año solicita este crédito para la compr de ropa juguetes para vender.
texts.en: The Unión y Confianza duo. Olga Neomí is from the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala, she is 32 years old, married, has 4 children, and works selling toys, clothing and hats in the Tecpan market. Due to not having sufficient economic resources to invest in merchandise and take advantage of the end of the year holidays, she asks for this loan to purchase clothing and toys to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and toys to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen es habitante de San Jacinto, un municipio de Bolívar reconocido como el centro artesanal del departamento, sus habitantes mantienen las tradiciones de sus ancestros y las continúan de generación en generación, por eso aquí abundan telares con los que se abastecen de artesanías a gran parte de las regiones de Colombia. Carmen de 30 años es una artesana especialista en la elaboración de hamacas, mochilas, bolsos, cojines para carros y todo lo que le encarguen, esta mujer con la magia de sus manos tiene convencidos a sus clientes que son personas y almacenes del municipio a quienes les entrega modelos exclusivos.  Con esta actividad Carmen ha logrado aportar a la economía de su hogar y en compañía de su cónyuge pretenden ofrecer una excelente educación a su hijo de dos años de edad.  Ella realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar volúmenes de hilos y accesorios, para aumentar la producción de su microempresa y  darles empleo a artesanos del municipio.  Carmen a futuro desea aperturar un almacén de artesanías y su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia al adquirir una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in San Jacinto, a municipality of Bolívar known as the artisanal center of the department. Its inhabitants keep their ancestors' traditions and they continue them from generation to generation. For this, there are many looms with which they stock the crafts in a large part of the regions of Colombia.

Carmen, 30 years old, is an artisan who specializes in making hammocks, suitcases, bags, car cushions and everything that is ordered. This woman, with the magic of her hands, has convinced her customers, who are people and stores in the municipality to whom she delivers her exclusive models. With this work, Carmen has managed to contribute to her household economy and, with her spouse, she plans to offer an excellent education to their 2-year-old son.

She requested the loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase volumes of thread and accessories to increase the production of her micro-business and provide work to artisans in the municipality. Carmen, in the future, wants to open a craft store and her goal is to improve her family's quality of life by getting their own house.

loans.use: to purchase volumes of thread and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora de cincuenta y dos años de edad, después de la muerte de su esposo ella trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su negocio desde hace más cuarenta años ha sido vender cosméticos, bisutería, cremas y otros artículos de manera ambulante. Gracias a su buena estrategia de ahorro e inversión, ella ha logrado crecer como comerciante.
Esta temporada del año es crucial para María, dado que las necesidades de su clientela aumentan de forma notable, por eso, ella ha solicitado a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, un préstamo que le permita abastecerse de nuevos productos y comprar maquillaje, perfumes y accesorios. En un futuro ella planea poder tener su propia boutique.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman, fifty-two years old, who after the death of her husband worked very hard to get her children ahead. Her business for over forty years has been selling cosmetics, costume jewelry, creams, and other items as a street vendor. Thanks to her good savings and investment strategy, she has managed to grow as a saleswoman.

This season of the year is crucial for María, given that her customers' needs increase noticeably. For this, she has asked Kiva and MiCrédito for a loan which will allow her to stock up on new products and purchase makeup, perfumes and accessories. In the future, she plans to be able to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase makeup, perfumes, and accessories.

loans.name: Saraswati Group

texts.en:
“Saraswati” is a self-help group formed in August, 2015, by ten active women of Litiguda of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Litiguda is a remotely located rural village. The main purpose of forming this SHG is to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses for future growth.

Suchitra is one of the members of this group, standing fourth from right with raised hand in the photo. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her 6-year-old son.

Suchitra hails from a Schedule Tribe poor family. She has been running a computer, photocopy and photograph center for last six years in a rented cabin in the nearest town. Her husband manages the business. She has engaged a boy for the smooth management of her business. For the amicable behavior and in-time quality service, customers become attracted to her center. From this business she earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR.

From the present income she is hardly managing her family and business expenses. She feels that, in future, when her child will grow and go for better education, she may face financial difficulties. So, anticipating the future need of her family, she wants to expand her business.

As per the plan of Suchitra, from the present loan she will purchase a video camera for outdoor shooting and engage another employee for DTP (desktop publishing) work and managing the business. She expects a good return from this investment.

The future dream of Suchitra is to give better schooling to her child and construct a business cabin of her own in that town to establish her business permanently.

The other nine members of the group are doing business like general store, vegetable cultivation, betel shop, spices business, computer and screen printing centre, animal trading and puffed rice.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a video camera for outdoor shooting.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, viejo fuera del país y por eso abandonó sus estudios, está casado y su esposa tiene una pupusería, tienen dos hijos, el mayor estudia bachillerato y el menor estudia sexto grado. 

Carlos, tiene una tienda donde vende todo tipo de variedades, accesorios para el hogar, artículos para regalos, entre otros, tiene 10 años de tener el negocio y fue la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, lo que lo llevo a colocarla, el negocio lo tiene en la casa y el horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio con más productos, porque se acerca la época de fin de año y son los meses donde más vende y al comprar por mayor obtiene descuentos en la mercadería.

Los sueños de Carlos, son seguir trabajando y darle a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para sus necesidades y puedan preparase académicamente.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55 years old and attended school up to ninth grade. He had to drop out of school because he traveled outside the country. He is married and his wife has a pupusería (where she sells pupusas, a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). They have two children; the eldest is in high school and the youngest in sixth grade.

Carlos has a store where he sells a variety of articles such as home accessories and gifts. He opened the store 10 years ago due to the need of generating income for his family. The store operates from his house, from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

Carlos needs the loan to stock his business with more products because the end of the year is coming and this is the high sales season, Buying wholesales he will obtain discounts in the merchandise.

Carlos dreams are to keep working and to give his children the support they need so they can prepare themselves academically.
