loans.use: stock his business with more products because the end of the year is coming and this is the high sales season.

loans.name: Dúo Fuentes Del Cielo Group

texts.es: Dúo Fuentes del Cielo La señora Gabina de 58 años de edad, casada, y tiene un hijo que mantener, es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, ella se dedica a la artesanía, elaborando güipiles y fajas, y aprovechando la época de fin de año para poder vender su producto solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos para vender.
texts.en: Gabina, from the group Dúo Fuentes del Cielo, is 58 years old. She is married and has a son she needs to support. She was born in Tecpan Guatemala. She does craft work making traditional tunics, blouses and sashes. To take advantage of the high sales of the end of the year season, she is requesting this loan to  buy raw materials for the manufacture and sale of traditional knitted items.

loans.use: buy raw materials for the manufacture and sale of traditional knitted items.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en: Zulaykho was born in 1963 year. She is married and has 5 children. Zulaykho lives with her family in the North Tajikistan. She lives in a village and that’s why she has been busy with farming business. She grows variety of vegetables as carrots, potatoes, cabbage and etc. Zulaykho has own sowing land and she works hard in this land every day. She is going to make new sowing and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy and hopes to get good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new season.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat was born in 1987 and is married with 2 children. Her children are schoolboys. Saodat has been busy with animal husbandry more than 5 years. She mainly feeds cows. Saodat’s husband helps her with this. She also has an orchard where she grows feeds for cows.

Saodat little by little with the passing of the time developed her business. She is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds. With this aim she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy cows for increasing working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows for increased working capital.

loans.name: Dúo Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: Dúo Los Cerritos La señora Marta Hidina, es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, soltera de 51 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, ya que se dedica a la artesanía elaborando fajas, tejidos de crochet y otras manualidades, que es su fuente de trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pero debido a la situación económica muy difícil, esta luchando para salir adelante con su negocio, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en:
Los Cerritos duo
Marta Hidina is from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is single, 51 years old, the mother of three children, an enterprising woman, who has great desire to improve herself. She works in the arts, making sashes, crocheting articles, and other crafts, which is her source of work to get her children ahead. However, due to the very difficult economic situation, she is struggling to get ahead with her business. She is asking for this loan to purchase the raw material to make traditional woven products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make traditional woven products.

loans.name: Gremilda

texts.es:
Gremilda con 66 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar, junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Gremilda cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Gremilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros y cerdos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 08 años aproximadamente, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio y en el mercado. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales,alimentación y otros gastos diversos de mototaxi.

Gremilda no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, en Edpyme Alternativa es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Gremilda, 66 years old, is partnered, lives in the family home with her partner, in the district of Lagunas, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. Gremilda has many good personal and work references from the people in the area. The inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, sales, and raising animals.


Gremilda works raising and selling animals such as mutton and pigs, with approximately 8 years of experience in the field. Her business is located in her own house and in the market. She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of animals, feed, and other diverse expenses for the motorcycle taxi.

Gremilda does not have credit experience, her first loan is with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing animals, feed, and other diverse expenses for the motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Lavdush

texts.en: Lavdush wants to pay the university fees of his son and this is the reason why he is requesting this loan. Lavdush's monthly income is $235 and his wife works in a pastry shop for an income of $117/month in addition to a retirement pension of his mother in an amount of $75. Their family lives in the city of Korca.

loans.use: to pay for the university fees of his son

loans.name: Sukuramani's Group

texts.en:
Sukuramani is standing to the right in the photograph and hails from a village of Mayurbhanj district, Odisha, India.

She is a divorcee who has two grown sons, employed in rural labour-based jobs that fetch them tiny incomes. They are both old enough for marriage, and are likely to therefore take on more responsibilities. In such a scenario, Sukuramani must continue her activity that fetches her a very small income. She works really hard in order to earn her living.

Sukuramani has taken up a manageable activity: dairy farming. She has a cow, and she sells milk.

Sukuramani, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new cow. She is hopeful that if she manages to procure another cow, she can expand her milk-selling activity.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 53-year-old lady from a village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She resides with her two sons, who are married, and her husband, who is a carpenter by profession.

Sabitri does not have access to a closed toilet in her home, so she walks a long distance to an isolated field in order to relieve herself. She is vulnerable to crimes, exploitation and molestation.

She is therefore requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a hygienic and well equipped toilet. Access to a toilet will give her a sense of security and promote and safeguard her family's health.

Sabitri is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and well equipped toilet.

loans.name: Sin Ku Village Group 2

texts.en:
Sin Ku’s previous loan from Proximity Designs helped 25 group members expand their livestock business. Like his fellow members, featured borrower Tin used funds to expand her duck business and is now able to cover all monthly expenses without taking on high-interest rate loans from local moneylenders. 

This relisted loan will support Sin Ku Group 1 purchase more ducks and buy high-quality feed. The group is so grateful for all the help from Kiva lenders, and they are excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to help 25 villagers buy ducks and high-quality feed,

loans.name: Maa Dwarsani Group

texts.en:
In August, 2015, 11 active ladies from a rural village called Pandrapathar of Nuapada district in Odisha, India, formed a self-help group named Maa Dwarsani with an objective to expand their existing business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Nilandri, the energetic lady of 41 years standing second from left with raised hand, is one of them. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband, as well as two sons and two daughters, all of whom are studying in local college and school.

For last five years, Nilandri has been running a ready-made garments selling business. She herself sells ready-made garments in her house and her husband sells in three nearby weekly markets. She purchases ready-made garments from a wholesale market 200 kilometers away. From this business her family earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR.

The present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses of her family. So Nilandri wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. Looking to the coming festive seasons (October to January), from the present loan of 16,000 INR she is planning to purchase quality fancy garments in bulk for selling. Nilandri hopes that this will generate a handsome amount of extra income.

Nilandri has a dream to save enough to have a permanent cabin for her business in the nearby town, construct a good house and provide better education for her children.

The other ten members of the group are doing cultivation and other micro enterprises like general store, vegetable vending, fish selling, etc.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing quality fancy garments in bulk for selling.

loans.name: Floribeth

texts.es:
Floribeth  tiene la edad de 48 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, los cuales son lo más importante para ella, se dedica a la producción de hortaliza organiza la cual le vende a sus vecinos y a algunos negocios cercanos, con el crédito quiere comprar los materiales necesarios para la construcción de un invernadero para la producción de abono orgánico, con el fin de utilizarlo en su hortaliza, los materiales que va a comprar son madera, plástico, clavos, y otros materiales.

Con esto piensa dar un mejor mantenimiento a su plantación y obtener una mejor cosecha, de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos  y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Floribeth is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their three children who are the most important for her. She works producing organic vegetables which she sells to her neighbors and some nearby businesses. With the loan, she wants to purchase the materials needed to build a greenhouse to produce organic compost, with the end of using it on her vegetables. The materials that she will purchase are wood, plastic, nails and other materials.

With this, she plans to give her plants better care and get a better harvest, in this way to be able to increase her income and, so, to help her husband with the household expenses. This is her first loan that she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans from the state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a greenhouse to make organic compost.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina runs a sari-sari store. She sells basic house hold commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and variety of canned goods.
She is 40-year old married woman with three children. All of them are still attending school.
She lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol. For the past ten years, she has been serving mostly locals and in the community where she lives.

She needs additional capital to boost the stocks on her store. Due to high demands of basic goods, she decided to avail the loan cater by Kivas field partner CEVI.

Josefina wants to buy stocks like rice, tahop (hog feed), canned goods and fertilizers . With these, it could help maintain the inventory or merchandise and attract potential customers to shop.

She is determined that she could make it to be more productive to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks like rice, tahop (hog feed), canned goods and fertilizers

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Dancille is the second person on the right side and is the president of DUTERIMBERE Group. She has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2000 to develop her business, and is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

Dancille is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She has owned and operated an agriculture business selling vegetables and fruits for the past 15 years, an enterprise that requires her to work from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day, and still manage her household.

Dancille has requested a Koramuhinzi loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more vegetables and fruits to sell. The Koramuhinzi loan product is a pre-harvest loan where the borrower will not be required to pay off the principle until after the harvest. This loan will allow Dancille and her family to maintain their current standard of living until proceeds from the harvest arrive. With the pre-harvest funds, Dancille will be able to pay her children's school fees and provide family support until her crops are ready to sell. She intends to use the profits from her harvest to save for the future and she will be able to build her own house.


The other members of DUTERIMBERE Group have the same business, requiring an influx of funding to continue the success and expansion of their businesses.

loans.use: to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Dilia Teresa

texts.es: Dilia de 34 años es una microempresaria habitante en el municipio de San Jacinto que aprendió de sus suegros la preparación de Bollos de Mazorca y Almojábanas, con esta receta típica de la región emprendió su propio negocio en el que diariamente elabora sus productos y los comercializa a sus vecinos que han perdido la tradición de elaborarlas en su casa. Ella realiza sus compras a campesinos de Maria Labaja, cuando no hay cosecha de Maíz en las cercanías de su vivienda, y empiezan a trabajar en la producción  de estos alimentos a primera hora de la mañana. Su proceso productivo consiste en seleccionar las tusas de las mazorcas, pilar el maíz para posteriormente moler su grano y cocerlo, a la masa obtenida, se le adiciona sal y azúcar, y se envuelven en las tusas de la mazorcas para cocinarlo y después de unos minutos quedan listos los deliciosos Bollos de Maíz, las almojábanas de Maíz se hacen con la misma masa pero se le agrega queso y bicarbonato y pasan al horno de leña, después de unos minutos están listas para su consumo. Dilia realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprar maíz al por mayor. Ella es madre de siete hijos menores de edad a quienes desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida con el fruto de su trabajo en compañía con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Dilia, 34 years old, is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in the municipality of San Jacinto and who learned from her in-laws to prepare corn buns and almojábana pastries. With this traditional recipe from the region, she opened her own business in which she makes her products daily and sells them to her neighbors who have lost the tradition of making them at home. She makes her purchases from rural people from Maria Labaja when there aren't corn harvests near her house, and they begin to work at producing these products at the first hour of the morning.

Her production process consists of selecting the corn, shucking the corn to later grind its grain and cook it. She adds salt and sugar to the dough she gets, and wraps it in the corn husks to cook it and after some minutes the delicious corn buns are ready. The corn almojábanas are made with the same dough, but she adds cheese and bicarbonate of soda and then puts them in the wood stove. After a few minutes they are ready to eat.

Dilia applied for a loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase corn in bulk. She is the mother of seven children who are minors, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life with the fruits of her labor with her spouse.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk.

loans.name: Subasini

texts.en:
Subasini is a rural woman of a small village of Kandhamal district in Odisha, India. She lives there with her husband and their only daughter, who is pursuing her education in primary school.

Subasini’s husband is engaged in a fish-vending business and Subasini cuts fish in the local market to earn their livelihood. Their monthly income is barely enough to meet all the household needs along with education expenses of their daughter. As a result, over the years they have been using a common toilet, which is very unhygienic and also far from their home. So they have been facing lot of discomfort. Walking to deserted areas to relive themselves at odd hours of the day makes them feel unsafe.

Due to lack of capital, Subasini is unable to build a toilet of her own and thus she applied for a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.

Subasini will use the loan money to purchase necessary materials like bricks, sand, plastic sheet etc. for building a toilet of her own. She thanks her generous lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials like bricks, sand, plastic sheet etc. for building a toilet of her own.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
44 year old Saeeda wanted to provide better education to her community and build a competitive, high quality school. 17 years ago, she opened a school in her urban community to help the children of the area, as well as providing her family with a enterprise of which they could be proud to provide.

To help her 412 students improve their experience at the school, Saeeda has borrowed PKR 150,000 in order to build additional rooms to expand the school area. By increasing the school's facilities, Saeeda hopes to stabilize attendance and improve the standard of education. She would also like to invite teachers and managerial trainers to help her improve the management of the school and staff.

loans.use: to build additional rooms to expend and improve her school. .

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 46-year-old married mother who has been working in selling clothes from her house for 7 years because she believes that she has to help with her family's income and at the same time take care of her family members. Two years ago, she got employed in an international feeding company, where she is responsible for the warehouse.

Khadija is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car necessary for her clothes selling business development. Her clients are increasing slightly; that's why the car is a necessity to expand her working zone.

Khadija also sells scarves, because most of the people in her village use them. She hopes to increase her products more and more to start selling children and men clothes.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for her clothes selling business development.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old. She married and blessed with two children. Her business is selling shoes and a beauty salon-cum barber shop. She has been in the business for 11 years.

She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy shaving machines for the barber shop.

She will use the profits from expanded business to reinvest into the business to boost it as well as educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open branches in different places.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines for the barber shop. .

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Maria de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 25 años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 58 years old and lives with her family in a house she owns. For the last 25 years she has operated a store from her house. She has lots of clients due to her competitive prices and her courtesy when conducting sales. She is requesting a loan again to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc. to be able to generate more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Donnys Group

texts.es: Dúo Donnys Sigue siendo integrado por doña Lucia ella sigue siendo la representante de este dúo denominado Donnys, doña Lucia sigue ofreciendo a su clientela 3 tiempos de tortilla,( mañana, medio dia y noche) doña Lucia manifiesta sentirse muy satisfecha ya que esta actividad es su único medio de ingreso y aprecia bastante a las señoritas que laboran en su negocio, llevando de la misma manera ellas el sustento en sus familias, doña Lucia desea comprar maíz por varios quintales ya que según su promedio utiliza entre uno y dos quintales de maíz diario y ofrece sus servicios de domingo a domingo,espera que la puedan seguir apoyando con su negocio.
texts.en: The group loan partnership "Duo Donnys" continues to be led by Lucia.  She is the representative for the team.  Lucia continues to offer her customers three times of day for buying tortillas (morning, noon and night).  Lucia is satisfied with her work.  It is her only source of income and she is thankful to the women who work in her business.  Her workers are able to provide for their families through these jobs. Lucia wants to buy corn in large bulk quantities (quintales - 100 pounds) since on average she is using between one and two quintales (100-200 pounds) of corn every day.  She offers her services every day of the week. She hopes that Kiva lenders will be able to continue supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk in order to make tortillas.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David con 27 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su esposa e hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana. David cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

David se dedica a la actividad de servicio de obrero en construcción civil en Cayaltí y anexos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 03 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas de construcción como martillo,esmeril, y otros.De esta manera hará crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

David es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado 01 crédito de S/.1000.00 el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
David is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son. They live in an urban district called Cayaltí, in the Province of Chiclayo, and the Department of Lambayeque in Perú. David has many good personal and work references from people living in the zone. The inhabitants of his town work mostly in agriculture, business and livestock.

David works as a civil construction worker in Cayaltí and the surrounding area. He has more than three years of experience in this field. He is asking for a loan in order to buy construction tools such as a hammer, a grinding tool, and other items. In this way he will be able to grow his business and be able to improve his quality of life. David is a recurring borrower with Kiva's field partner Edpyme Alternativa. He has received one previous loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) which he repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy construction tools such as a hammer, a grinding machine, and other items.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta repaid her first Kiva loan and she has an idea already for her second loan with Kiva lenders. Greta with her husband lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. She used to do farming and now also with the help of her husband she is busy with her cattle care and land cultivation. On her farm she has cows, calves, sheep, piglets and chickens. Her husband greatly helps her with potato cultivation which he used to take and sell at the city’s wholesale market but now he sells them right from her farm since it is already hard for him to transfer it.

Greta sells also her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, meat and eggs. Now her second Kiva loan of 550.000 Armenian drams Greta asks as her farm cattle has a lack of fodder and she will buy a lot of it since with coming of winter the need will be greatest.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her cattle, since with the coming of winter it  be will needed more and more

loans.name: Mirna Rosibel

texts.es:
Mirna, estudió hasta noveno grado, porque las condiciones económicas familiares no eran las suficientes para que ella continuara estudiando, es madre soltera y cuida de su hijo con apoyo de su familia.

Mirna, se dedica a la venta de ropa para poder obtener ingresos, ella siempre quiso tener un negocio propio y poder trabajar y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hijo.

Mirna, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa como: pantalones para hombre y mujer, faldas, camisas, calcetines y ropa interior y con esto podrá tener mercadería para la venta y el trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en la comunidad donde vive y en zonas cercanas.

Mirna, sueña con tener un negocio grande y quiere que su hijo estudie y pueda estudiar una carrera en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mirna went to school up to the ninth grade because the family economic condition was not enough for her to continue her education. She is a single mother and cares for her son with the support of her family.

Mirna works selling clothing to get income. she has always wanted to have her own business and be able to work and improve her son's living conditions.

Mirna needs the loan to purchase clothing such as men's and women's pants, skirts, shirts, socks and underwear, and with this she will be able to have merchandise to sell and she does the work as a street vendor in the community where she lives and in the nearby areas.

Mirna dreams of having a large business and she wants her son to go to school and be able to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as men's and women's pants, skirts, shirts, socks and underwear.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Currently Anila has 3 dairy cows and sells roughly 40 liters/day at a price of .40/liter during the milk production months of the cows. She also sells three calves for $470/each. In the land that she owns, she plants only feed for the animals such as fodder, wheat, beets and vetch. 
Anila now needs to prepare the soil for some of the planting and this is why she is seeking your financial help again.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Mary sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for seven years. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the seasonality of charcoal.

Mary has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She would like to buy a van in the future. Her monthly expenses include rent for a market stall and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 22 years old single lady, who has been working as a tutor for three years. She provides her teaching services from her parents house to cover her education expenses and living needs.
Lana is well known in her region, she is very smart and enjoys educating others, that's why she chose teaching to be her university major.

To continue her studies, Lana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her Teaching Diploma University tuition fees.
Her dream is to graduate and continue teaching with her degree.

loans.use: to pay for her Teaching Diploma University tuition fees.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta earns a living by providing medicines for the mango tree to bear fruit. They are the one who take care of mango until the harvest time.  She is married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 3. Her husband's occupation is a security guard. 
She has been engaged in that kind of business for a quite long period of time now.

Julieta wants to buy mango  fertilizer and sprayer tank. These are essential tools that would definitely make improvements to continue her livelihood.

In the future,She is looking forward to continue expand her livelihood to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy mango  fertilizer and sprayer tank

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita is a hardworking woman who engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her town. To have additional earnings, she also engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweeds. She is a married woman and has five children ages 7-20 years old.
Her husband is a fisherman. His catch would be double purpose. First is for source of income and second could be for family consumption.

She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw , foam (for fish storage) and pay for boat repair. These are essential elements that would prosper her sources of income.

With the resources available, she is doing her best to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw , foam (for fish storage) and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, a 33-year old woman who earns a living raising hogs,  which she has used to manage the economy of her house. She has her own property where she lives with her 4 children  and life partner, and she is happy to have her family. Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is 1 year old.

She  wants to continue improve  quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to invest to invest in pigs, feed and medicine to continue improving his business. He used the previous loan to stock his shop and wants to continue doing so.

With her previous loan, Letecia has successfully paid back, and now she is requesting a new loan to further expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to invest in pigs, feed and medicine

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is 33 years old and lives in Dairalla. She is second wife of a man who did not complete his education ‎because of the financial situation for his family, so he could not find a good work with a good salary. He is appearing in the photo instead of Suhair, because she is conservative woman. Fom here Suhair decided to help her husband in the household expenses and be a productive woman to be ‎able to provide a good education for her children.‎
‎
She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock and she wants to expand her work, therefore she ‎requested a loan to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.
‎
Suhair has been raising livestock for three years now, she started with very low quantity of goats and day ‎after day she started expand her business and start to make a sheep`s product and sell it to the markets to ‎increase her incomes.‎
She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.‎

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her sheep business.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José es un hombre muy trabajador que lucha todos los días para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, gracias a su crédito pudo comprar la semilla de papa y abono químico, afortunadamente esto lo ayudo para obtener una buena cosecha y una gran ganancia le dejo. José nuevamente tiene la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, cal, arena y block, porque necesita brindarle a su familia un mejor hogar. Y con ello mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a very hard working man who struggles everyday so that his family will lack for nothing. Thanks to his other loan he was able to buy seed potatoes and chemical fertilizer. Fortunately, this allowed him to bring in a good harvest and gave him a big profit.

Now José needs to request a new loan to buy construction materials, such as cement, lime, sand and blocks, because he needs to give his family a better home and with it improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, lime, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with five children. Four of her children attend school. She also takes care of additional family members .

Stella operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for six years.

Stella has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes. Her goal is to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business.

Stella resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old. She married and blessed with two children. Her business is selling motor vehicle spare parts. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her savings as well as educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 46 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He does farming and livestock keeping. He has been in the farming business for 15 years and it has been profitable. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy pesticide for his mango crops and hopes this enable him to harvest more mangoes for sell and make more profits to support his family.

He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family’s standard of living. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for his mango crops and hopes this enable him to harvest more mangoes and make more profits to support his family.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 24 years old. He is married but they don’t have children yet. His business is selling electronics and farming. He has been in the business for three years. He earns a monthly income of fourteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy mobile phones and accessories for sale. He will use the profits from expanded business to service his loan and increase his savings.

His hopes and dreams are to have a big business and save more.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en: Paata is 41 years old. He lives in Tsalenjikha district with his mother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees. In addition, they have bee-hives with bee-colonies and produce honey to sell. Paata wants to open a dental clinic and needs money. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 6000 GEL. With the received credit he will open a dental clinic and will generate stable income.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic

loans.name: Rusudani

texts.en:
Rusudani is 57 years old widow, from Tkibuli district. She lives alone and earns a living with small trading business with clothing. She was unable to start any stable job, as the high unemployment rate in the region. For increasing her business income and more effectively meet the daily costs, Rusudani decided to make another source of income.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Rusudani to get a loan of 900 USD. She will purchase all necessary tools and have money for working capitals to open a bakery locally. Rusudani thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the bakery is opened, the she will have a stable income which enables Rusudani to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.

With support of the Start Up program her income will significantly increase and Rusudani will make better living condition for herself.

loans.use: to increase her business income and open a bakery.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en: Bukurije, an Egyptian Albanian married mother needs your financial help again to make basic repairs to the family home. She's been photographed in the front of the house where she cooks and washes. She is very poor.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to her home. She is very poor.

loans.name: Rita Irene

texts.es:
La señora Rita  una mujer luchadora de 49 años casada, junto a su esposo se dedican a las labores del campo tienen  tres hijos uno de ellos está en la universidad por una beca que se ganó en él no gastan en estudios, su hermano está en el colegio y su hermana tuvo que dejar la universidad ya que anteriormente pasaron por momentos difíciles y no les alcanzó para que ella continúe sus estudios, son una familia muy unida ejemplo para otras ya que a pesar de los momentos duros que han tenido que pasar siguen juntos luchando por salir adelante.
Ellos viven en el Recinto 10 de agosto el mismo que tiene un clima cálido húmedo está lleno de gente muy unida aquí tienen una finca en la cual se dedican a las labores de campo, actualmente sus ingresos provienen de la plantación de cacao, producción de leche y crianza de cerdos a esta actividad le dedican todo el día ya que son labores que necesitan mucho cuidado y tiempo.
Doña Rita solicita este crédito para invertir en un su finca en la producción de cerdos comprando balanceado e insumos, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y mejorara su nivel de vida, la señora Rita agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en: Mrs. Rita is a hard working 49-year old woman. She is married and, along with her husband, they work in the field. They have three children, one of them in college supported by a scholarship he won so they don't spend money in his studies. His brother is in school, and his sister had to leave college because they did not have enough funds to help her continue her studies. They are a very united family, an example for others, given that in spite of hard times,  they continue the fight together to get ahead. They live in Recinto 10 de agosto, which has a warm, humid climate and it is full of friendly, united people. They own a farm where they work in the field. Currently their earnings come from a cacao  crop, milk production, and raising pigs. They work in this chore all day because the animals need a lot of time and attention. Mrs Rita is asking for a loan to invest in her farm in pig production by buying animal feed and inputs. With this investment they will improve their earnings and their quality of life. Mrs. Rita is grateful to Kiva for their support and the opportunities offered.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and inputs, to increase production and improve her children's and her quality of life.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is 63 years old and is a widower. Guillermo is retired but he needs to work that is why he works at a printing shop. Guillermo loves his son a lot and he will do anything to help him

This time Guillermo needs a loan to pay for extra classes for his son who is studying mechanics. Guillermo is the only support for his son, so he hopes you can help him again

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for his son to continue to study Mechanics.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members .

Faridah sells charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She works seven days week.

Faridah has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to build a house in the future.

Faridah decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house with access to electricity, however, she does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members .

Esther sells roasted maize at the market and has been in this business for 15 years. She works six days a week on a retail basis.

Esther has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh maize. She would like to buy a plot of land.

Esther decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and has access to electricity. The family does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy fresh maize

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
Odilia, who is in her early 50's, is a divorcee with seven kids who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for twenty years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Odilia's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing her "mama lishe" stock and has paid back all of her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of starting a catering business. Odilia will share this loan with her loan group Tufaidi which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for repay a loan .

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 39-year-old married mother of four. She has been working as a hair dresser from her house and in Mouneh production and sales since 1999. She supports her husband in covering her family's increasing living needs.

Iman's husband runs two businesses to make sure he can cover his family's living needs. He works as a houses painter, and at the same time he distributes and sells chicken eggs in the nearby villages.

Iman wants to support her husband more She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car for her husband's chicken egg distribution and sales business.
She hopes to stay capable of supporting her family members in a well managed way.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband's chicken egg distribution and sales business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members .

Monica sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week.

Monica has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She aspires to become a wholesaler. She also hopes to buy iron sheets to roof her rental houses.

Monica decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Edwin Farly

texts.es:
Edwin Farly con 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Edwin Farly se desempeña como mototaxista, con más de 10 años de experiencia en este servicio, sus servicios los brinda dentro la zona geográfica de Oyotún. Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de su mototaxi, dicha inversión le servirá para poder brindar un mejor servicio, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa en tener en mejores condiciones su mototaxi para poder seguir satisfaciendo de la mejor manera la demanda de dicho servicio en la zona.

Edwin Farly es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 6 créditos de S/.1500,00; S/.1200,00; S/.1500,00;S/.1500,00;S/. 1500,00 y S/.1500,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida también.
texts.en:
Edwin Farly is 32 years old and lives with his common law wife and their children in a rural zone of the Oyotún district of Chiclayo, in the state of Lambayeque, Perú. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in farming, trade and raising livestock.

Edwin Farly works as a mototaxi driver, and has more than 10 years of experience in this service industry. He offers his services within the geographic area of Oyotún.

He is applying for a loan for the upkeep on his mototaxi. This investment will allow him to offer better service and greatly affects his business. This way, he plans to keep his mototaxi in improved condition so he can continue to better satisfy the demand for this service in the area.

Edwin Farly is a recurring member for Edpyme Alternativa. He has had 6 loans: five for 1,500 Peruvian soles and one for 1,200 Peruvian soles, which he paid off in a timely fashion. Ever since he became our member, his business has improved and his quality of life has, too.

loans.use: with the upkeep on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old. She is single and doesn’t have children. Her business is a boutique. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy clothing for sale.She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her savings as well as improve her standard of living.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and open branches in several places.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale

loans.name: Regino

texts.en:
Regino is 58 years old. He learned agricultural  from his father. He is married, has 4 children, and he lives in Tambogrande, Piura.

Regino grows organic mangoes and he needs a loan of $1700 to buy tools and fertilize his fields to increase the organic mango production. With the additional income he will build the second floor of his family’s house.

loans.use: for buying tools and manure for the organic mango production

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es: Carmen es una artesana que aprendió esta labor en el seno de su hogar materno; ella observaba cómo su madre entrelazaba hilo en el telar para grandes trabajos y con las agujas de tejer con gran agilidad elaboraba mochilas, bolsos, capelladas de sandalias, chalecos en hermosos colores y diseños, así que Carmen tomó hilo y empezó a realizar sus propias creaciones que la llevaron a ser hoy en día una joven microempresaria que elabora una variada gama de productos y es muy reconocida en el municipio de san Jacinto de donde es oriunda.  Con esta actividad Carmen ha logrado aportar a la economía de su hogar en compañía de su cónyuge, ella es madre de dos pequeños hijos y distribuye su tiempo en sus distintos roles. Ella realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas hilos, broches, agujas de tejer, pedrería y demás accesorios, esta inversión le permitirá diversificar su oferta de productos y realizar hamacas con hilo fino.
texts.en:
Carmen makes a living as a craftswoman; she learned this profession at her mother's home. She observed how her mother weaved yarn in the loom for big projects and how she quickly produced backpacks, handbags, upper outsoles, vests with beautiful colours and designs using the kitting needles. This is how Carmen took the thread and started to make her own creations. Today those have led her to become a young micro-entrepreneur who produces a wide variety of products. She is very well-known in her village San Jacinto, where she originally comes from.

Carmen has managed to contribute to her household expenses with this activity together with her partner. She is a mother with two young children and allocates her time among her different roles. She requested a loan, her first kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy craft materials, yarn, knitting needles, beads and other accessories. This investment will allow her to diversify her product offering and to make hammocks with fine thread.

loans.use: to buy craft materials; yarn, fasteners, knitting needles, beads and other accessories.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is single with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for one year.

Florence has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Florence aspires to own a permanent business premise. She also hopes to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity, however, they do not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is married with five children. Four of her children attend school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Sylivia has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, and cassavas.

Sylivia would like to buy a plot of land in the future. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, and cassavas.

loans.name: Miladis

texts.es: Miladis es una joven tendera de 30 años de edad, residenciada en San Jacinto un municipio de Bolívar, y con el apoyo de su cónyuge emprendió su negocio, una excelente oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales para su hogar, así como continuar velando por el cuidado de sus dos pequeños hijos y las labores en el hogar. Esta polifuncional mujer en su tienda de víveres oferta los productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar y adicionalmente elabora y vende pasteles de arroz y artesanías de su propia invención que ayudan a incrementar sus ingresos.  Ella desea aumentar sus inventarios y para ello está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar víveres; aceite, arroz, verduras, carnes y continuar con sus actividades sin imprevistos. Su meta de negocio abrir un restaurante porque le gusta la cocina y ampliar su tienda, en lo personal desea adquirir casa propia.
texts.en:
Miladis is a young store keeper. She is 30 years old and lives in San Jacinto a town of Bolívar. With her husband's help she started her own business, which gave her an excellent opportunity to generate additional income for her home, and also to keep taking care of her two small children and the domestic chores.

In her grocery store, this multi-functional woman offers basic needs products and, in addition to that, she makes and sells rice cakes and original crafts that help increase her income.

She wants to increase her inventory, therefore, she is requesting a loan, her first credikiva with the help of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy provisions such as oil, rice, vegetables and meat to continue with her business without surprises. Her business goals are to open a restaurant because she likes to cook, and also to expand her store. In a personal level, she wants to buy a house.

loans.use: buy provisions such as oil, rice, vegetables and meat to continue with her business without surprises.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members .

Victo operates a food stall at the market and has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week.

Victo has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, greens, onions, cabbages, mangoes, and oranges. She would like to improve her capital base so as to stock more fruits and vegetables.

Victo decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and has access to electricity. However, the family does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, greens, onions, cabbages, mangoes, and oranges.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Lydia operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week.

Lydia has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, oranges, carrots, mangoes, and onions. She would like to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oranges, carrots, mangoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mariela Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre aun no  tienen  hijos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Mariela es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para ganar algo por su cuenta y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo, su formas de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale tres o cuatro veces por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella lleva más de 3 años con este negocio con el cual se gana sus recursos esperando de a poco ir mejorando su situación económica para cuando le toque tener sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y zapatos.  Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Las Viviendas Urban Credit Group meets every 2 weeks in the canton of Jaramijó. This area is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the inhabitants here are workers employed in labor related to the sea.

Mariela lives in this place. She is 19 years old and is in a common law relationship. She doesn't have children yet. Her husband is a driver.

Mariela is a very hard-working woman who does what's needed to earn money on her own to contribute towards the household expenses. She works in trade, selling clothes and shoes from a catalog. Her method of sale is door to door. She goes out three or four times a week, offering her merchandise. She then leaves them on credit and collects once a week. She has been in this business for more than 3 years and earns these resources in the hope of improving her financial situation little by little, for when she has her children.

She will use this loan to buy clothing and shoes. She has had 2 cycles in the credit group, and she likes it because of the assistance the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is widowed with four children, and they all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market seven days a week. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

She generates additional income through poultry farming. She sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation costs. She would like to start farming.

She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 27 years old, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Joel, a driver and they have two Elementary children. Majority of Filipino families struggle to make ends meet. Her husband's salary as a driver is not enough to raise a family so Elizabeth thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income.

She has been running her store for three years already and is doing quite well. She buys essential food items such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages and toiletries from wholesalers and then sells them at retail prices. To help her expand operations of her store she is requesting a PHP 19000 loan to buy more quantities of grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. to sell at her small store. She is thanking you in advance for your valued help.

Evangeline believes that her store will continue to progress and hopes to save enough to send her children to College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 27 years old and is a single mother of 2 kids, the oldest is 8 years old and the other one is 2 years old. Patricia lives with her parents. She is a seamstress and makes jackets and coats.

Patricia needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine so she hopes you can help her Patricia likes her job and she is ready to work harder.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a weaver from Peru who specializes in alpaca apparel and throws. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Nestor has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

Nestor hails from Peru's Puno region renowned for quality alpaca and sheep wool. When he first began to weave, he worked on the rustic looms he built along with other family members. They sold their wares at local markets until they were able to acquire modern machinery, which in turn allowed them to develop newer designs.

"Many thanks for your support through this microcredit. With this purchase of wool, we will have enough material to last a full year."

Use the link below to view Nestor's alpaca apparel and throws on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3463

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn Jade is 19 years old and is 2nd of three children in the family. Her mother Evelyn a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Juvelyn Jade is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Human Resource Management and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Evelyn Jade is borrowing PHP 14000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Juvelyn for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Juvelyn Jade plans to to have a stable job and build her own business so she could help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for a BSc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old, married with three children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling spare parts.

Virginia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza 15 years ago started her own business. She started her business alone and at first it was very difficult for her to develop business but thanks to her strategy and hardwork, she developed her business.

Firuza has a store in a local market and she manages the business alone. Firuza periodically renews the assortment of her goods. The business struggle is big in a local market. Firuza is going to buy women clothes for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria operates her two stalls. She offers rice grains and frozen foods.She has been in this kind of business since 1990. The couple has been doing their best to generate better income.

Victoria would like to improve her rice retailing business that's why she's requesting for additional capital of PHP50,000.She will use this amount of loan in buying sacks of rice grain and frozen foods to sell. Victoria knows that through her requested loan, she could further improve her business and generate better income that will be use for future emergency purposes.

loans.use: to be use in buying sacks of rice grain and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is thankful that she has twice received financial assistance which really helped sustain her food business. Her earnings helped cover her family's daily needs.

She hopes that she can again borrow funds in the amount of PHP 30000 which she will use to buy flour, eggs, sugar and coconut to make native delicacies such as "puto"(rice cake). She has carved a name for making delicious rice cake and has earned regular and loyal customers. She trusts that you will continue to support her livelihood to provide income for their daily sustenance.

Mercedes dreams of opening a bakeshop some day and acquire a delivery van for her native delicacies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partner/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar and coconut milk to make and sell native delicacies.

loans.name: Beenish

texts.en:
Beenish is 24 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 2 children. Beenish is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is need purchase a new sewing machine for tailoring purposes , but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase it. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the sewing machine and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Beenish is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Thama Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Stephen; he is forty two years old, married and has four children. He is a member of Thama self help group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern in 2015. His economic activity is maize and beans farming.

He is taking a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will boost his farming activities. He anticipates better produce that will increase his income level enabling him to provide for his family.
Stephen is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will boost his farming activities.

loans.name: Sameoun's Group

texts.en: Sameoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sameoun works as factory laborer and he also does extra work as construction worker and driver to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Reim's Group

texts.en: Reim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Reim works as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in Ciudad, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes.

Leonidas needs US$ 700 as a loan for buying tools and fertlizer for his fields to increase the organic mango production. With the additional income, he will send his children to school to learn English and improve their education.

loans.use: for buying tools and manure for his organic mango production.

loans.name: Paduanas De Buena Fe Group

texts.en:
In the municipality of San Antonio Aguas Calientes, the department of Sacatepéquez, Southwest Guatemala, a small town close to Antigua Guatemala, live the 7 group members of “Paduanas de Buena Fe” trust bank. Residents of a place known for its textiles and traditional cloths, many of these women are weavers, crafting güipiles, traditional blouses, napkins, table cloths, and other typical indigenous products. Some clients raise chickens, as well, and others sell snacks, such as tostadas, chuchitos, which are little meat-pies, tamales, ice-cream, and other delicious foods. 

Pati s a 25-year-old woman and member of the Paduanas de Buena Fe trust bank who was able to complete her secondary school education, with a degree as a preschool teacher. Now, she is a mother, teacher, and business woman, providing a quality life to her little 2-year-old daughter, and family. In the mornings Pati teaches at a local preschool, and in the afternoons, she runs her business weaving traditional cloth, creating beautiful fajas, belts, napkins, güipiles, traditional blouses, and selling them to order, meeting the demand of her customers. With her new loan, this motivated woman plans to buy threads and other materials for her production of traditional cloths, and also invest in several employees to expand the capacity and ability of her business. Pati dreams of growing her business until she has her own store to showcase and sell her product. With 2 years in Friendship Bridge, she has the confidence and tools she needs to accomplish her goal, Thank you Kiva and Friendship Bridge!!

loans.use: to buy threads and other materials for her production of traditional cloths

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en:
Muharram is a careful mother of 3 children. She loves her children and always tries for their well-being. Muharram has been busy with sewing more than 20 years. She has a great experience in this filed. Muharram sews variety of women clothes. She has repeat clients because she tries to offer high quality service.

Muharram now is going to buy fabrics and thread for increasing working capital and in this way to develop business. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and etc. for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 24 years old young man, from Kutaisi city. He lives with his mother, who is a cleaner and father, who is a private worker. The family has really poor living condition, as having no source of significant income to satisfy even basic needs.

Giorgi wants to make his own income and start private business. According to above mentioned situation, he lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Giorgi to get a loan of 450 USD.

With the loan amount Giorgi plans to purchase a camera and start working as a photographer. He will work on a private orders and will take photos of weddings and other epochal moments. Giorgi will get the chance to make stable source of income and somehow increase his family's living condition.
This credit will be a great support for the family. Giorgi is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a camera and start working as a photographer.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivian is 46 years old and has four children who are in school.

Vivian has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, spices, etc..

Vivian has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, spices, etc.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede and Bardhe both in the photograph and parents of four, wanted to make some basic repairs to the family home and to the fence that is almost collapsing after recent erosion caused from heavy rains in their regioun.
In addition to the poultry activity, they've added two goats and one sow and a pig.

loans.use: to  make some basic repairs to the family home and to the fence that have suffered an erosion from rains

loans.name: Limhour's Group

texts.en: Limhour’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Limhour makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sin Ku Village Group 1

texts.en:
Proximity's initial loan helped Sin Ku Group 1 purchase ducks and pay for better inputs, such as duck shelters. With increased net income, featured borrower Mar’s family will be able to not only repay the current loan, but also expand her livestock business. 

With another loan, the group has aimed to expand their duck business. All the group leaders and members are very thankful to Kiva's lending community for providing them the opportunity to build financial security for their families.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and higher quality inputs

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina  is 44 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Rubina  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is 35 years old, married woman and a mother of 2 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Muqadas hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband is a carpenter. Out of his skill they have a business together, making furniture which they started last year. Roseminda is asking a loan to buy more materials like plywood, nails and hard wood. Her loan will ensure that they can always continue making furniture and accept orders.

Roseminda's income will pay for electricity, food for the family and pay for school fees of her youngest child who is eight years old. Roseminda and her family lives in Jagna, Bohol.

loans.use: to  buy hard wood, nails and plywood

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a mother of four children, and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Jenifer operates a beauty salon and she has been in this business for six years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include power shortages.

Jenifer has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, weaves, oils, relaxers and treatments.

Her future plan is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, oils, relaxers and treatments.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She also has additional family members.

Fatuma lives in a rented house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

Fatuma operates a beauty salon from the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages.

Fatuma has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, chairs, and treatments. She would like to buy more hair dryers in the future to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, chairs and treatments.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 38 years old. He is married with five children. The oldest is fifteen and the youngest is only a two-month-old baby.

Danilo has been in the business of raising hogs for four years barely earning PHP4000 per month. He plans to use his loan to buy piglets to raise.  Since he has fattened hogs now, he will be able to sell some and have more to raise, thus maximizing his income and time to raise and fatten new ones. 
In the future, Danilo plans to make his business bigger and more sustainable and build a concrete barn for his animals.

loans.use: to  buy more piglets

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, 41 years old divorced woman, lives in Tbilisi with her son, daughter-in-law and their infant. The family members are involved in private activities, in order to satisfy even basic needs and tackle with the financial difficulties.

Ekaterine's son works as a taxi driver and the borrower has just started trading business with fruits and vegetables. Now, she needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to continue running her business in a sustainable way.

Ekaterine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan will greatly assist Ekaterine and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to have money for working capital for her newly started business.

loans.name: Gemna

texts.en: Gemna is a 28-year-old woman from Ronda, Cebu. She is a doting mother to her three children aged one to six. She is looking after her three children while also attending to her Sari-sari store business. It entails a lot of work to care for her kids while also managing her store's inventory. But Gemna persevere and she is even asking a loan to buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap. It is her dream to make renovations and expansion on the merchandise that she sell to increase her customer base. In the future, she hope to see her children successful in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
