Sabita is 29 years old. She belongs to a village in a place in Kandhamal district of Odisha, India. She needs a loan of 15,000 INR for the construction of a toilet at her place. With a family of seven, it is important for Sabita to provide safe sanitation for her family.

When there is no safe sanitation option, there are high chances of catching diseases, and women are more prone to these diseases. Having a toilet in their home would make their life easier and safer. This would not only save Sabita's time, but would also give her family a safe sanitation option.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to construct a toilet at her place.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, aged 47, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nelson, a farmer and still has a child in High School. They live in an agricultural country where most of the population live in the rural areas and farming is the main source of livelihood.

Her family may be poor but they are happy as long as the family is intact and loving. Angelina is blessed with a small pineapple farm where her husband and some laborers toils and tills the land for ten years already. She hopes she could borrow an amount of Php 12000 to pay for fertilizers for a productive harvest and to pay wages for her laborers. She is thanking you in advance for your financial assistance.

Angelina dreams for her child to get a College Education to allow her child a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers for a productive harvest on her farm and wages for her laborers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for several years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of used clothes.

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation of used clothes. Her plan is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed, and none of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for a few months, and she works seven days a week. Her main business challenges are transportation costs.

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.

She would like to buy a delivery van in the future to cut transportation costs. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of her niece. Sarah resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Sarah sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and she has been in this business for several years. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used bales of clothes.

Sarah has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes.

She aspires to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for six years. She generates additional income by making paper bags.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of materials for making clothes.

She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.

She would like to buy another electric sewing machine. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rolls of materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 41 years old and a married woman, shown in the photo with her husband. 

After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. 

Samina is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymom works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: It is not easy to tell Wilma's age. She move fast and have three small businesses as her source of income. She raise hogs, buy and sell coconut wine and farms rice. Wilma is asking a loan to buy more coconut wine and fertilizer for her farm. It is her dream to see her business become prosperous so she can support herself until old age. Wilma is 63 years old and lives in Badian, Cebu.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine and fertilizer

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is 61 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 7 children. Kaneez has also been doing her business of clothing selling for the past 8 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Kaneez needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as humble. 

She operates a retail business where she sells mobile phones and their accessories. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phones and phone accessories. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a taxi. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to service and maintain his taxi. His business goal is to own another taxi within five years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to service and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Vicuñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de chinelas, tejido y venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por una visita que realizo la señora a la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada y con un capital con el que contaba decidió emprender su propio negocio hace veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración. Lo comercializara en  su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución y el compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The Vicuñas Credit Association is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan-American Regional Office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a Board of Directors, of which Dionicia is the President. The businesses that the association's members carry out vary. These include: clothing sales, food sales, flip-flop sales, fabric, and blanket sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses, of which Dionicia is a member. She says that they joined Pro Mujer after a visit from a woman from the institution. Currently, she has a food sales business. She tells us that she learned this business from her sister-in-law. With capital that she was counting on, she decided to start her own business 20 years ago. The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (to buy potatoes and chuños, artisanal freeze-dried potatoes, on wholesale) that she will obtain from vendors in El Alto city and, later, for manufacturing. She will sell the goods in her stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training, the health services that the institution provides, and sharing with her friends.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chuños, artisanal freeze-dried potatoes, on wholesale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She operates a food stall at the market, selling bunches of green bananas on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas.

She aspires to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business.

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 8 years. Zenaida earns additional income from vehicle rental.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Saindri

texts.en:
Saindri is a 30-year-old lady from Kandhamal district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and her two daughters and son. Saindri's husband is a farmer by profession. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses.

They have hardly any savings. Therefore, Saindri was never able to build a toilet in her house, for which she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances and isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe, as she understands the importance of having a toilet at home.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it. The loan amount will subsequently result in enhancing cleanliness, health, and hygiene.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is a 35-year-old married woman hailing from a village that comes under Kandhamal district of Odisha, India. She is seeking a loan of 15,000 INR to construct a toilet in her home. Babita lives in a home with no access to a toilet, thereby forcing the family members to go outdoors to relieve themselves. They have to travel long distances at odd hours of the night.

Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle. Plus, having a toilet will save them money every month, which they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation.

This loan will give them access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life, and thus they will enjoy good health.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 60-year-old widow who has two children. 

She, along with her son, deals in a business selling birds. She feeds and cares for the birds and her son sells them in the market. They earn enough through their business to meet the day-to-day expenses of their family. 

Currently, Zeenat requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase a variety of birds in order to expand their business and ultimately their sales. 

She is positive about her future earnings and dreams of providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of birds in order to expand their business and ultimately their sales.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua est une femme mariée avec un seul enfant à charge. Akoua est âgée de 32 ans et vit à Agoè où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice du haricot. Akouvi s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers aussi. Akoua sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols du haricot en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leur enfant.
texts.en:
Akoua is a married woman with one child in her care. She is 32 years old and lives in Agoè, where she carries out her activity serving beans. She gets the necessary supplies she needs to make her dishes twice a month at the market and sells them in front of her house and walking around the various neighborhoods.

Akoua is requesting this loan to order bowls of beans with a view to selling them at a good price and making more profit, so she can help out her husband to provide for the family's needs and to improve their child's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 34 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María es una mujer de 52 años de edad que vive con sus dos hijas de 22 y 20 años y un varón de 25 años de edad que le apoyan económicamente, ya que ella los ha sacado adelante como madre soltera. María se dedica a prestar sus servicios en un rancho de playa en el cual hace el mantenimiento y cuida por las noches. María se ha esforzado mucho junto a sus hijos para mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, pero no ha logrado instalar energía eléctrica, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cable eléctrico, toma corriente, caja térmica, entre otros materiales necesarios para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52 year old woman. She lives with her two daughters,who are 22 and 20, and her son, who is 25. They support her now as she took care of them as a single mother.

Maria works in maintenance and as a nighttime caretaker at a beach property. Maria and her children have worked very hard to improve their house little by little but have not been able to install electricity. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in electrical wiring, outlets, a fuse box, and other items needed to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to invest in electrical wiring, outlets, a fuse box and other items needed to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Aissatou Rella's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis Janvier 2003, vient d’entamer son vingt quatrième cycle de crédit. ces 5 femmes sont solidaires et vivent dans le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou Rella (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissu. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 30 coupons de tissus teintés dans la sous région,  le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer la dépense quotidienne et de participer à la gestion de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in January 2003 and has just requested their twenty-fourth loan. The five women members support one another and live in the same village. They all work as small traders.

Aissatou Rella (sitting on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is married and mother to two boys and two girls. She sells fabric and will use her loan to buy thirty lots of dyed fabric remnants in another region and then resell them in her neighbourhood.

Aissatou Rella's profits will provide more for her family's day-to-day expenses and allow her to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 30 lots of dyed fabric remnants in another region, for resale in her neighbourhood.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 46 years old and married with five children.

He earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. He has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Efren is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adjo  Adelle

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans résidante à Agoè. Mère de trois enfants, Adjo est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à domicile. Adjo désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Adjo compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is a married woman aged 43, living in Agoè. The mother of three children, Adjo sells foodstuffs and stocks up four times a month at the market. She sells her goods under a shed roof at her home.

Adjo wants to have this loan to order some sacks of rice. With the profit she will earn from making good sales, Adjo hopes to improve her sales offerings and help her family to flourish. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice.

loans.name: Alia

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Alia est une femme divorcée âgée de 46 ans résidant à Agoè. Alia  prépare et vend de la boisson locale appelé « Tchoukoudou » faite à base du mil. Alia s’approvisionne du nécessaire trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de mil, Alia  demande ce prêt pour financer son achat ; ce qui lui permet d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises, éviter les ruptures ; de fidéliser ses clients et avoir plus de bénéfices pour participer aux charges de sa famille puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Alia is a divorcée, who is 46 years old and mother to three children; she lives in Agoè. She prepares and sells a local drink called "Tchoukoudou", which is made from millet and she gets the necessary supplies three times a month at the market.

Alia is requesting this loan to finance the purchase of bowls of millet; this will enable her to build up her stock and avoid it running out. It will also enable her to maintain a loyal customer base and make more profits so she can contribute to the family's expenses and help out with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 57 bowls of millet.

loans.name: Usharani

texts.en:
Usharani hails from a humble background of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four, and has two daughters in her care. She is a grocer by profession and works hard in order to support her family financially. However, her income is sufficient to meet the basic needs, but she could not build a toilet due to the limited income source.

Absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk far to a field in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice feasible anymore. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a hygienic toilet. The loan will subsequently result in increased safety and hygiene, and thus prevent her from getting deadly infectious diseases.

Usharani is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Mariano Carmen

texts.es: Mariano es un hombre de 66 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Chucarapi, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar un torete orgánico, que criará junto a sus dos vacas hasta que alcance el peso adecuado y pueda venderlo, espera que su carne sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Mariano is a 66 year old man. He lives together with his wife in the rural town of Chucarapi, which is located in Arequipa. He works raising cattle, always paying much attention in the care and food that he provides them.

He is requesting a micro-loan to be able to buy a young organic bull. He will raise it together with his two cows until it reaches the weight needed to sell it. He hopes that the meat will sell at a higher price being organic. In the future he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family and continue to have good health, which is the reason he is betting on organic.

loans.use: to buy a young organic bull to sell when it has put on enough weigh to increase his income.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans et qui vit à Agoè. Mère de deux enfants, Akouvi se bat énormément dans son commerce de petits poissons fumés pour subvenir  à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Akouvi demande ce prêt pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés en vue de mieux revendre et avoir un stock important puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari à mieux prendre en charge les enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 50-year old married woman who lives in Agoè. She is mother to two children and struggles a great deal in her business selling small smoked fish to provide for her own needs as well as those of her children.

Akouvi is requesting this loan so she can order baskets of small smoked fish with a view to selling them on at a better price and having a more significant stock to maximise her profit. She will thereby be able to help her husband provide for a better education for their children and help them thrive.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of small smoked fish.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene una linda familia con la que vive, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carlos para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 5 años, gracias a los años que lleva ejerciendo  esta actividad la gente ha empezado a conocerlo y su clientela ha incrementado.
Su gran anhelo ahora es poder realizar la construcción de su casa para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor hogar, pero su gran dificultad es no contar con suficiente dinero y a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como: cemento, cal, arena y block.Su más grande sueño es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single man with great life aspirations. He has a lovely family that he lives with. They live in the community of Sololá. To obtain income and help his family get ahead, Carlos has made a living in carpentry for the past 5 years. Thanks to the years that he has spent in this line of work, people have started to know him and his client base has grown.

His big dream right now is to be able to complete the construction of his house, in order to give his family a better home. However, his biggest challenge is that he does not have enough money. Due to this need, he is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand, and blocks. His biggest dream is to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, lime, sand, and blocks.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 47 ans, Ameyo vit à Agoè et est mère de cinq enfants. Ameyo se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons fumés pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Ameyo demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de poissons congelés en vue de mieux revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Ameyo is 47, she is married, and lives in Agoè with her five children. Ameyo works energetically at her business selling smoked fish to provide for herself and her children. Ameyo requests this loan to order cartons of frozen fish so that she can sell at a good price, maximize her profits, and also have a large reserve stock. This will enable her to help pay for her children's education and help them to thrive.

loans.use: to buy 06 cartons of frozen fish.

loans.name: Clara Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Clara, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo realiza masajes terapéuticos.
Doña Clara con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y así ayudarse y ayudar a su marido a afrontar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo e interiores, ella varia sus ventas de acuerdo a la ocasión razón por lo cual siempre sus ventas son buenas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi  todos los días a realizar sus recorridos, no tiene horario fijos para salir, aunque prefiere salir  en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, lleva 2 años con este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y  ropa de niños. Lleva  3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella surte más su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un local.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" communal bank gets together every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches. The majority of inhabitants here are very hard-working and work in things related to the ocean.

Clara lives here. She is 67 years old and married and from this relationship has five adult children, one of whom still lives in their house. Her husband does therapeutic massages.

Clara with the goal of having her own income and helping her husband tackle the household expenses works selling clothing of all types and underwear. She varies her sales depending on the occasion and this is the reason her sales are always good. Her form of sales is door-to-door and she goes out almost every day to make her rounds. She has no set timetable but prefers to go out in the morning as it is easier to make her rounds. She has carried out this business for two years which allows her to help her husband as he doesn't make much with his work.

She will use this loan to buy shirts, pants, underwear and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it as with the loans she can stock her business more. Her dream is to have store.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, underwear and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nalini

texts.en:
Nalini is a 42-year-old woman who is very hardworking and patient. She hails from a village of Kandhamal district of Odisha, India. She is a hardworking woman who, due to her friendliness, has many customers who visit her business of selling vegetables.

One factor that concerns her is that she does not have access to a hygienic latrine at her home. Therefore, Nalini is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to install a toilet in her home so that she would no longer have to depend on an open field for defecation.

She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true, and she can enjoy a healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to install a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Marie Michelle's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Janvier 2004, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Elles entretiennent de très bonnes relations et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marie Michelle (debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits de divers citron, balaie qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires et d’eau fraiche.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 05 bidons de 20 litre de citron, 17 balaie et 03 paquets de 50 sachets de ¼ de litre  pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’assister son mari dans la dépense quotidienne, et participer à la scolarité et habillements de ses enfants
texts.en:
Created in January 2004, this group is made up of very active women. They are mutually very supportive and get on very well with one another. All the women work as small traders.

Marie Michelle (standing on the far right in the photo) is the group representative. She is married and mother to two boys and one girl. She buys various products such as lemon juice, brooms and fresh water at the weekly market and then sells them. Her loan will buy five twenty-litre drums of lemon juice, seventeen brooms and three boxes of fifty quarter-litre bags of water.

Marie Michelle's profits will help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and pay for school fees and clothing for their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 x 20 litre drums of lemon juice, 17 brooms and 3 boxes of 50 x 1/4 litre sachets of fresh water.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is a very industrious and enterprising lady. She is a native of a small village in Kandhamal district, Odisha, India.

She is one of the victims of the rural Indian sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet at her home and in the immediate vicinity, she has to travel a long distance in order to relieve herself. Being a sensible lady, she can sense the risk of infections and diseases due to open defecation and urination. She wants to improve her situation.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house. Access to a toilet will prevent her from getting infectious and communicable diseases and reduce her medical expenditures, and lead her in increased safety and hygiene.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Akpéné est une femme âgée de 53 ans résidant à Tokoin. Akpéné est une marchande de petits poissons fumés qui achète et revend ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché puis à domicile. Akpéné sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Akpéné is 53. She is married with three children and lives in Tokoin. Akpéné sells little smoked fish that she buys at the market four times each month and sells at the market and from her home. Akpéné requests this loan to order baskets of little smoked fish as she plans to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to improve her profit. This will enable her to help her husband to pay for their children’s education and their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 baskets of smoked fish.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra 9" Beg Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit « Sope  Mame Diarra 9 » regroupe cinq femmes qui appartiennent au même réseau et vivent dans le même quartier. Elles s’activent toute dans le commerce spécialement celui du poisson frais. C’est le cas de la présidente, madame Anta Salla, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle vient pour la seconde fois solliciter un crédit à l’IMCEC pour augmenter son fond de roulement. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans ce domaine d’activité : acheter du poisson frais afin de le revendre à sa clientèle ; elle est active toute la journée.
Anta Salla appuie son  époux dans les charges familiales et appuie aussi ses enfants dans leurs études. Elle désire au plus, augmenter son fond de roulement, voire acquérir une pirogue qui sera plus bénéfique pour elle.
texts.en:
The « Sope  Mame Diarra 9 » credit group is made up of five women who belong to the same network and the same neighbourhood.  They all work in trade and in particular the sale of fresh fish. This is the case of Anta Salla who is 36 and married with children. She requests a second loan from IMCEC to increase her working capital. She has over five years experience in this field: buying fresh fish and reselling it to her customers. She works all day.
Anta Salla helps her husband with the family expenses and also helps her children to pay their school fees. She fervently hopes to increase her working capital, and to purchase a dugout canoe, which would be helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be prayerful.

Josephine operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use thus KES 60,000 loan to furnish her restaurant.

Josephine hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to furnish her restaurant.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest.

Edward operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals.

Edward will use this KES 90,000 loan to add more barber shop equipment. His business goal is to open another barber shop within 5 years. He will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Samuel will use this Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a business premise within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a single woman. She describes herself to be focused. Fouzia operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Fouzia describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a car. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest. Daniel operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Daniel will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will save the anticipated profits .

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas’s previous loan with Center for Community Transformation (CCT) really helped his recycling shop. He buys large quantities of plastic varieties and resells them. Though his income is not that drastic compare to other businesses, hard work and patience are his strengths to be able to run the business and support his family.

The business that he has right now is a job without day-offs where your hands get dirty just to make a profit. Like any other business goals, Nicolas wants to have his businesses expanded, and dreams to invest for his own car for personal and business use and continue to support his children’s educational expenses and provide needs for his family.

Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the basis for business success to take place. That’s why Nicolas decided to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan this year that will be used as added capital and a revolving fund as well. He’ll buy a large quantity of scrap material, not just plastic but other varieties like metal, steel, cartons and glass.

Nicolas regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: increase working capital for his recycling business.

loans.name: Rajkishori's Group

texts.en:
Rajkishori looks at her vegetable farm and beams with pride. Four years ago she started vegetable farming with her husband's help. He is a casual laborer. Slowly, as their expertise grew, their name and popularity grew as well. They have been helped by the climate prevalent in the region, but all their success is through their hard work.

Now, she, along with her fellow group member, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR. Rajkishori will use her loan amount to take her business to the next level. She plans to buy better seeds, fertilizers and farming tools. She has heard of high yield varieties of vegetables which are more resistant to pests and require less care than the ones she grows now. Using fertilizers will increase the richness of the soil so that their plants grow faster and healthier. And using farming tools will help reduce the effort she has to make to grow and care for the vegetable plants.

The resulting increase in revenue will be used for the education of their children. She dreams for them to complete their education and get good jobs.

Rajkishori is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy better seeds, fertilizers and farming tools.

loans.name: Bidyulata

texts.en:
Bidyulata is a charming and sensible lady from a village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She is sweet, sincere, sensitive, caring, friendly, responsible, and hardworking. She carries out her business as a street vendor.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend to nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR. She will use the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce their medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Sisian town with his wife and three kids, aged 12, 9 and 3 years old. He has been involved in a retail business for already 6 years.

Artur trades fruits and vegetables in Sisian town and nearby communities. The requested loan will help him to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables to enlarge his selling variety and reach a bigger market. He hopes to receive lenders' support to enlarge his business activity and ensure that his family has normal living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amandio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade apenas 2 é que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que vivem na Matola.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011, este é o seu 7º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ampliar seu negócio de criação de frangos para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes. O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua obra de residência.
texts.en:
Amandio comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 32 years old and in a common law marriage. He has three underage children, two of whom are in school. He supports his parents who live in Matola.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his 7th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to increase turnover in his poultry farm business by purchasing chicks, feed and vitamins. That way he'll meet his customers' needs.

In the future he intends to expand his chicken farm so that he can meet his customers' needs. His biggest challenge is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins so he can meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Lourdes Jessenia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Vivienda se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen 3 hijos de 21, 16  y 7 años, los dos menores  estudian en colegio y escuela.
Doña Lourdes es una mujer que le ha tocado  trabajar duro y así  salir adelante  con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en la cual  vende ropa de todo tipo, allí ella trabaja todos los días y cuando sus hijos pueden estar en el negocio ella también sale  puerta a puerta a ofrecer sus prendas, ella está muy agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le dan para recibir estos créditos ya que es así como ella puede salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y otras prendas. Lleva casi 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus sueños es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Vivienda Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and dedicated to work related to the sea.

This is where Lourdes lives. She is 40 years old. Years ago, her husband passed away, but from that relationship she has 3 children aged 21, 16, and 7. The two younger ones study in high school and elementary school.

Lourdes is a woman who has had to work hard to get ahead and cover the expenses of her household and her children. She makes a living in commerce. She has a shop in her house where she sells all kinds of clothes. She works there every day, and when her children can be in the business she also goes door-to-door to sell her garments. She is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that they give her to receive these loans, since this is how she can get ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and other garments. She has been in the Credit Group for almost 2 years and she likes it because the loans are very important for her. Her dream is that her children never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and other garments.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Membre depuis Janvier 2004, cette brave femme a une expérience dans le programme des Bancs Villageois et a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Hélène est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires : miel, huile de palme, patte d’arachide et du pain de singe.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de 50 kg de pain de singe, 10 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme, 15 bidons de 20 litre de miel et 10 seaux de 15 kg de patte d’arachide qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier et dans la capital.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son activité et d’aider son mari retraité dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Hélène has been a member of this 'Banc Villageois' since January 2004. She is very courageous, has a lot of experience and works as a small trader. Hélène is married and mother to five children. She sells various food products such as honey, palm oil, peanut paste and baobab fruit.

Hélène's loan will buy five fifty-litre sacks of baobab fruit, ten twenty-litre bottles of palm oil, fifteen twenty-litre drums of honey and ten fifteen-kilo buckets of peanut paste from the weekly market. Her produce will then be retailed in her neighbourhood and in the capital.

Hélène's profits will help to strengthen her business and help her retired husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and pay for school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 x 50kg sacks of Baobab fruit, 10 x 20 litre bottles of palm oil, 15 x 20 litre drums of honey and 10 x 15kg buckets of peanut paste.

loans.name: Mounde's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place Juillet 2002, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’élevage.

Madame Mounde, âgée de 34 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires tels que l’huile de palme et la patte d’arachide.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 07 bouteilles de 20 litres d’huile de palme et 25 seaux de 15 kg de patte d’arachide qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans la capital.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte participer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, aux soins médicaux et habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created in July 2002, this group is made up of women with a lot of experience working with the 'Banc Villageois'. They are mutually very supportive and get on very well with one another. All the women work as small traders or raise animals.

Mounde (sitting on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised) is the group representative. She is thirty-four years old, married and mother to five children. She sells various food products such as palm oil and peanut paste. Her loan will buy seven twenty-litre bottles of palm oil and twenty-five fifteen-kilo buckets of peanut paste from the weekly market. She will then sell her produce in the capital.

Mounde's profits will help provide for the day-to-day expenses of her family and pay for healthcare and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy 7 x 20 litre bottles of palm oil and 25 x 15kg buckets of peanut paste.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be responsible. Lucy operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Lucy will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes & clothes. Her business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes & shoes to sell.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima considers her buy-and-sell business growing over the last six months, as she’s able to earn about P15, 000 every month. She is able to help her husband earn income for their family while at home. The loan that she previously applied for and approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used to buy stocks of Barley brand products to resell. She wants to thank CCT and lenders for their financial provision.

Though it’s not easy to run the business as she’s lacking fund and there are also delayed payments from customers, Felicisima is still determined to make her business progress as she has dreams for her family. She wants to get more patrons to increase revenue. She applied an amount of PHP 50, 000 that will be used to buy more stocks of Barley products and other medicines.

Felicisima believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy Barley brand products to sell.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio un hombre de 36 años vive en el recinto San Bernabé, tiene un hijo de una relación anterior, y actualmente tiene una nueva relación en unión libre por más de 5 años. 
Se dedica a la ganadería a la producción de leche y producción de cerdos lechones, el aprendió de este negocio junto a su compañera y a sus papás. En este negocio trabajan un promedio de 8 horas diarias, juntos realizan los trabajos de la finca, el ordeño de las vacas, engorde de cerdos, limpieza, etc.
Mauricio es un cliente fiel a la fundación desde hace unos años, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado voluntad para crecer como microempresario. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la ampliación de su negocio ya que desea adquirir cerdas madres para incrementar la actividad productiva, con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Mauricio agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad  brindada a él y su familia y por confiar en sus propósitos de crecimiento personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 36 years old and lives in San Bernabé Precinct. He has a son from a previous relationship and has been with his new partner in a common-law relationship for the last five years. He makes a living from livestock, producing milk and rearing suckling pigs. He learned this business with his partner and from her parents. They work on average for 8 hours a day, together they do tasks around the farm, he milks the cows, fattens the pigs, cleaning and so forth.

Mauricio has been a loyal client of "Fundación Alternativa" for several years, during which time he has demonstrated his willingness to develop as a micro entrepreneur. He will use this loan to expand his business and wants to buy sows to increase production. With this new loan he hopes to boost his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Mauricio thanks Kiva for its support and the opportunity provided to him and his family and for having confidence in his intentions for personal and professional growth.

loans.use: to buy sows and increase the production of piglets.

loans.name: Anandini's Group

texts.en:
Anandini lives in Patnagarh, a village in the state of Orissa, India, with her husband and only son. While her husband is a farmer, her son is still studying.

Anandini herself rears a cow to earn an income selling the animal's milk to locals and the village collection center. Having run this small venture from the premises of her home for the last four years, Anandini now wants to develop the operations into a proper business by purchasing an additional two cows.

Some of the challenges in the area include the lack of green fodder and quality veterinary services, but her biggest obstacle is the lack of personal funding to expand the business. She aims to add two more cows to her farm and seeks a loan of 36,000 INR along with her fellow group member from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to make the transaction.

The investment will boost her profits and bring the farm a step closer to the business model Anandini envisions. Anandini is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

The lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph is Anandini.

loans.use: to develop the operations into a proper business by purchasing two additional cows.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, body lotions and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, body lotions and clothes.

loans.name: Andrade

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade apenas 1 é que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como areia, cimento, varões e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende contrair o matrimónio e iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade.
texts.en:
Andrade comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 39 years old and in a common law marriage. He has two underage children, only one of whom is in school. He doesn't support anyone else.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, rods, etc., so that he can continue building his house.

In the future he intends to get married and start a business selling products that are households staples.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, rods, etc., so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 39 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 4 filhos menores idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu sobrinho que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011, este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: cimento, areia, pedras e mais para fazer o murro de vedação da sua residência.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos para venda. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Ananias comes from Maputo. He's 39 years old and married. He has four underage children and supports his nephew who lives with him.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, rocks, etc., so he can build a fence wall around his house.

In the future he intends to finish the construction work and start a business raising chickens for selling. His biggest challenge is providing his children with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks, etc., so he can build a fence wall around his house.

loans.name: Janaki's Group

texts.en:
Darkness looms with the setting sun in several households in remote parts of India. Janaki lives in Patnagarh, one such village in Odisha, India. Apart from power outages throughout the day, there are often several hours in the evening when the households in Patnagarh need to make do with the light from a dim kerosene lamp.

Kerosene lamps give out toxic fumes and cause eye problems. Moreover, they are fire hazards. Kerosene is an expensive fuel as well. Keeping all these problems in mind, and in order to cut down expenses on kerosene and choose a cheaper, cleaner energy source, Janaki, an intelligent lady although not literate, started her candle making business. She supplies candles to all the nearby households in her locality.

Janaki is requesting a loan of 36,000 Indian rupees along with her group member. Janaki will use her portion of the loan to purchase materials like wax and thread and to repair her candle making machine. The loan will help her in solving problems in her locality and thus promoting their safety.

Janaki is in dire need of your kind help. She is standing on the right-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wax and thread and to repair her candle making machine.

loans.name: Gina Marie

texts.en:
Gina Marie is 32 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gina Marie is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins, etc. for her business. Gina Marie has been in pig fattening  for 6 years.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rimila's Group

texts.en:
Rimila lives in Patnagarh Village in Odisha, India, with her husband and two daughters. Along with her husband, Rimila runs a poultry business from their small home. Over the last three years, this young entrepreneur has acquired the skills of animal husbandry and developed a loyal clientele. But as with most small-scale businesses, gathering the financial resources to expand her venture remains a major challenge for the 29-year-old.

She, along with her fellow group member, has applied for a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in more than four dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication. Healthy chickens imply healthy produce, and the profits made promise to enhance her current living conditions for good.

Rimila is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to invest in more than four dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation and necessary medication.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente es una más de las muchas personas que sus vidas se han visto beneficiado por los créditos de ADICLA y KIVA, él cuenta que con el préstamo pudo comprar la semillas de cebolla y sus abonos químicos para su cultivo a Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y logro venderlo a un buen precio en su mercado regional, con sus ganancias pudo hacer algunas mejoras a su casa. Vicente ha considerado que con los créditos el podrá salir adelante, por esa razón solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de semillas de papa y abono químico para  cultivar a tiempo y cosechar este fin de año.
texts.en: Vicente is one of the many people who's lives have benefited from loans from ADICLA and KIVA. He says that with the loan he was able to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops. He had a good harvest, thanks to God and he managed to sell it at a good price in the regional market. He made some improvements on his house with the profits. Vicente thinks that with the loans he will be able to get ahead. For this reason he is requesting a new loan to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizer to plant on time and harvest at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans résidante à Adidogomè. Mère de quatre enfants, Akossiwa est une marchande de miel en bouteilles qu’elle revend à domicile et en se promenant dans les quartiers environnant. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bidons de miel. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Akossiwa compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is fifty-one years old, married and lives in Adidogomé. She has four children and sells honey in bottles on foot and from her home. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and has requested this loan to buy more drums of honey.

Akossiwa will use her profits to improve her business, improve her family's living conditions and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 drums of honey.

loans.name: Wend Nazemsd Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Clarisse est une femme âgée de 34 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 6 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son accueil, son travail bien fait, elle entretient bien son salon ce qui attire ses clients.
Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des produits défrisant 25 000 CFA, et des mèches de 75 000 f cfa. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en produits et en mèches afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux bonnes dates.
texts.en:
Clarisse is a 34 year old woman, who is married with two children. She has been running her business for six years. The factors that are the secret of her success, are her warm welcome, her work well done, and the well-kept state of her salon, which encourages her clients to be faithful.

She requests the loan to buy 25 000 CFA worth of anti-frizz products, and locks of hair worth
75 000 CFA. The loan is important so that she can stock up on products and locks of hair to satisfy her clientele. She has previously received two loans which she repaid on the correct dates.

loans.use: to buy anti-frizz products worth 25 000 CFA, and locks of hair worth 75 000 CFA.

loans.name: Cintia Marlene

texts.es: Cintia de 36 años, habita en Cartagena de Indias un municipio de Bolívar con una gran riqueza natural por sus paradisiacas playas y lugares llenos de historia,  esta contadora pública apasionada por las ventas, inició su negocio cuando tuvo su primer empleó, ella  aprovecho la oportunidad de encontrar un nuevo grupo de personas a las que les ofertó una amplia gama de mercancías; prendas de vestir, calzado, perfumes y cremas e incluso adornos de temporada, contando con gran acogida. En la actualidad cuenta con seis años en esta actividad que le ha generado ingresos adicionales a los que adquiere por su trabajo como empleada en una empresa, labor que realiza  para lograr sostener su hogar monoparental a causa de la separación con su cónyuge. Ella es madre de una niña de nueve años de edad a quien educa en valores y buenas costumbres, y es su motor motivacional, es por ello que desea capitalizarse y lograr mayores ventas en este trimestre del año, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en adornos navideños, ropa de nueva colección, calzado y perfumes. Su meta a futuro es convertirse en mayorista y distribuidora de los productos que comercializa y en lo personal culminar su especialización en auditoria fiscal.
texts.en: Cintia is 36 years old and lives in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality of Bolívar with a lot of natural richness thanks to its paradisical beaches and sites full of history. She is a public accountant and is passionate about selling. She started her business when she had her first job. She made the most of the opportunity to find a new group of people who she could sell a wide range of merchandise to, including clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and even seasonal decorations, this was widely welcomed. She has now been doing this for 6 years and it has earned her additional income to that which she earns as an employee in a business where she works to be able to maintain her single parent household due to her separation from her partner. She is a mother to a 9 year old girl who she educates in values and good habits, her daughter is her motivation. This is why she wants to capitalise on the final three months of the year and increase her sales. This is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in Christmas decorations and new collection clothing, shoes and perfumes. Her future aim is to become a wholesaler and distributor of the products that she sells and to finish her training as a tax auditor.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decoatations and new collection clothes, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Betuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Matola Província de Maputo tem 26 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade dos quais 1 é que frequenta escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2010, este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir um congelador para o seu estabelecimento comercial.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e contrair matrimónio.
texts.en:
Betuel comes from Matola, province of Maputo. He's 26 years old and in a common law marriage. He has three underage children, one of whom attends school. He doesn't support anyone else.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2010. This is his 8th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase a freezer for his store.

In the future he intends to expand his business and get married.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for his store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a Kiva borrower and she has three children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of feeds. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to have more cows within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Julio Raul

texts.es: Julio es un hombre de 40 años que vive en la localidad rural de Subin, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar tres vacas orgánicas, espera vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro desea mejorar su casa para vivir cómodamente y le gustaría fundar una familia.
texts.en: Julio is 40 years old and lives in the rural area of Subin which is in Moquegua. He works as a construction worker and he also earns a living raising organic cows. He always pays a lot of attention in caring for them and in what he feeds them, which is made from the alfalfa that he grows. He is asking for a micro loan to be able to buy three organic cows. He hopes to sell their milk at a better price as it is organic. In the future he hopes to improve his home in order to live comfortably and he would like to start a family.

loans.use: to buy three organic cows in order to sell the milk that they produce and thus improve his income.

loans.name: Isac

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zandamela província de Inhambane tem 32 anos idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Inhambane.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo sapatos para venda no mercado formal vulgo shoprit, como uma forma de satisfazer os seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio como base de sustentabilidade.
texts.en:
Isac comes from Zamandela, province of Inhambane. He's 32 years old and in a common law marriage. He has two underage children and supports his parents who live in Inhambane.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2012. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to increase turnover in his business by purchasing shoes for re-selling at the formal market known as shoprite. That way he'll meet his customers' needs.

In the future he intends to finish building his house and purchase a vehicle. His biggest challenge is keeping his business as his means of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for re-selling.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open a beauty products shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old. She is married with five children. She has had a secondhand clothes selling business for 13 years. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell to her customers so as to make more income to educate her children. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and provide food for her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her clothes selling business, make more income and be able to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell to her customers so as to make more income to educate her children and provide food for her family.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 45 years old, and married.  For 7 years she has operated an agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines.  

Roselyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un emprendedor que evidencio en su comunidad la falencia de tiendas de víveres en los alrededores de su barrio, aprovechando su experiencia en esta actividad decidió convertirse en un tendero y proporcionarle a los habitantes del sector una tienda de víveres con cercanía a sus hogares que les proporcionara productos de calidad a buen precio. Él maneja un amplio horario para que sus clientes tengan la oportunidad de realizar sus compras de productos sin inconvenientes. Su cónyuge aprovecha la afluencia de clientes que llegan hasta el negocio y les exhibe artesanías que ella elabora, esta actividad genera una entrada de ingresos a la economía familiar. Está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir surtido de víveres; legumbres, arroz, aceite, carne, pollo, entre otros con la finalidad de que sus clientes encuentren todo en un mismo lugar y materiales para las artesanías que elabora su cónyuge.  Luis desea tener un stock con el que pueda responder oportunamente a la demanda y su meta a largo plazo será ampliar el local. Su meta familiar es lograr que sus dos hijos puedan ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Luis is an entrepreneur who saw in his community a lack of general stores around his neighborhood. Taking advantage of his experience in this line of work, he decided to become a shop owner and give the residents of the sector a general store that would be close to their homes and that would give them high quality products at a good price.

He works long hours so that his customers can have the opportunity to buy products without inconveniences. His spouse takes advantage of the influx of customers that come to the business and she shows them artisanal goods that she makes. This generates a source of income for the family.

He is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in various provisions: legumes, rice, oil, meat, and chicken, among other items, with the goal being that his customers find everything in one place, and to buy materials for the artisanal goods that his spouse makes. Luis wants to have a stock that allows him to respond opportunely to demand. His long-term goal is to expand his store. His goal for his family is that his two children can go to university.

loans.use: to buy legumes, rice, oil, meat, and chicken, among other items, with the goal being that his customers find everything in one place, and to buy materials for the artisanal goods that his spouse makes.

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
En el Recinto Andoas del Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado con un clima cálido húmedo y su gente es muy unida por ser un lugar pequeño vive el señor Luis Asipuela un hombre luchador, es soltero no tiene  hijos vive en la casa de sus Padres pero es independiente pero ayuda a sus Padres en lo que necesiten son muy unidos, viene de familia de bajos recursos económicos pero desde niño buscó salir adelante. 
El señor Luis se dedica a trabajar en un taller de mecánica automotriz tiene mucho conocimiento en esta rama ya que tiene varios cursos y una tecnología en esta actividad, desea actualmente emprender con su propio negocio tiene herramientas necesarias para empezar a trabajar independientemente el taller lo construirá en un terreno de sus hermano tiene mucha acogida y espera iniciar para poder traer a su propio local a muchos clientes que ya los atiende en el taller que trabaja.
Don Luis con su propio negocio mejorarán sus ingresos  económicos y podrá seguir ayudando a sus Padres, el señor Luis agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
In the warm and humid Andoas section of the Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton, a tight-knit community, lives Luis. He is a single, hard-working man who lives in his parents' house. He is very independent, but helps his parents however he can, as they are a very close family. His family has very little economic means, and ever since Luis was a child he has looked for a way to get ahead.

Luis makes a living working in an auto mechanic shop. He is very knowledgeable of this subject since he took several courses and learned the appropriate technology. He wants to start his own business, as he has the tools he needs to start working independently. He will build the shop on his brother's land. He hopes to be able to bring many of the clients he works with now over to his own shop.

With his own business, Luis will improve his income and be able to keep helping his parents. He is grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: start his own auto mechanic shop, and provide a better quality of life to his parents who have given him so much support.

loans.name: Luz Abigail

texts.es: Luz es una gran mujer, porque se esfuerza mucho con el afán de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella cuenta que gracias a su crédito pudo comprar sus materiales de construcción y su casa pudo finalizar de construirlo, con este avance ella está muy contenta más no conforme porque hay una parte de su casa que le hace falta remodelar por esa razón solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de cemento, y arena. Su gran esperanza de vida es contar con una casa digna para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en: Luz is a great woman because she puts in a lot of effort with the desire of improving her living conditions. She says that thanks to her loan she was able to buy construction materials and she could finish building her house. With this step forward she is very happy but not satisfied because there is still a part of her house that needs to be remodelled and this is why she is asking for a new loan to buy cement and sand.
