Her biggest hope in life is to have a decent house so that her children can live better.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to remodel her house.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 25 y 14 años, el menor que estudian en colegio y  es el que aun vive con ellos, allí también vive con una nieta de 4 años la cual la tiene desde que nació y que es como suya. Su marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa y zapatos  de catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana en horas que sabe que puede encontrar  a sus clientes y también vende en su casa, ella le da facilidades de pago ya que les vende a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas" meets every two weeks in Jaramijo canton. This location is famous for its beautiful beaches. The majority of people are very hardworking and make a living from fishing. María who is 42 years old lives in Jaramijo. She is married, she and her husband have two sons aged 25 and 14. The younger son is in college and lives at home with his parents. Her 4 year old grand-daughter has lived with her since her birth and is like a daughter to her.
Her husband is a fisherman. María is a tenacious woman who likes to rely on herself to get ahead.She has her own business selling clothing and shoes from a catalogue. Her business model is to sell door to door, going out three or four days a week at times when she knows she will be able to meet her customers. She also sells from her home, providing weekly credit payment terms. She has been in this business for more than five years providing an income for her family. This loan is to buy trousers, blouses and shoes. She has been part of the "Grupo De Crédito" from the very beginning and likes the group because the loans have been extremely important for her. She aspires to provide the best that she can for her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and shoes.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo con 44 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos,en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica a prestar servicio de venta y reparación de radios y tv, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 20 años en un local alquilado.Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo,para la compra de herramientas para invertir en este negocio. De esta manera espera mejorar su nivel de ventas lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en sus ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

segundo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Es su segundo préstamo.
texts.en:
Segundo is 44 years old, in a civil union and lives in his own home with his partner and his two children in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque department in Peru. The inhabitants of this area earn a living in agriculture, business and livestock.


Segundo earns a living offering his services selling and repairing radios and televisions. He has over 20 years of experience of doing this work in rented premises. He is asking for a loan for working capital in order to buy tools to invest in his business. This way he hopes to increase his sales which will have a positive effect on his income and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.


Segundo is a habitual member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to have capital to buy tools.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de plásticos, venta de comida, venta de condimento.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa con los pocos ahorros con el que contaba hace seis años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos por mayor) y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Hormiguitas Communal Bank is starting its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan-American Regional Office. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a Board of Directors, of which Felicidad is the President. The businesses that the members of the Communal Bank carry out are varied. These include: clothing sales, plastic sales, food sales, and condiment sales. The loan that they will take out will help small micro-businesses, of which Felicidad is a member.

She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a condiment sales business. She tells us that she started this business six years ago with the little savings that she had.

The loan that she will take out now will be to increase capital - to buy condiments on wholesale that she will later sell in her stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married. When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy condiments on wholesale.

loans.name: Rajurani's Group

texts.en:
Rajurani, standing on the right, is the mother of three children. She, her husband, and her children reside in Umerkote district of Odisha, India. Rajurani and her husband have a monthly income of 4,000 Indian rupees (INR). Every month she is forced to fork out around 400 INR towards her family’s medical expenses as a result of the sanitation crisis they face.

Like many Indians, Rajurani and her family still do not have access to modern sanitation and are forced to defecate in the open. Open defecation is disastrous as it is impossible to keep human feces away from crops, wells, food, and children. According to studies, hundreds of children die every year due to preventable sanitary-related diseases. Lack of sanitation facilities also means trekking at least a kilometer to relieve themselves. And women like Rajurani bear the brunt as they are mostly attacked and assaulted when they step out early in the morning or late in the evening.

In order to improve their sanitation facilities, Rajurani along with her group member have approached Kiva’s partner People's Forum seeking a loan of 45,000 INR. She intends to use the loan towards construction of a toilet at home. Your loan will help Rajurani and her family to improve the quality of their lives. She is in dire need of your help.

loans.use: to construct a toilet at home

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en: Rabab is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband with no children. Since 2013, she started to work from her home as a private teacher where she has arranged a special room where to teach students appropriately. She works in cooperation with her husband with the intention of gaining an enough income to live properly. At present, she is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a laptop as she wants to organize and systematize all documents and exercises and make her preparations easier to perform. She states that the loan will help her to enhance her work and plans to request additional Kiva loans for more improvements.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 28 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio adquirindo produtos diversos como: sumos, refrescos e diversas bebidas mais para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e contrair matrimónio. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino do seu filho até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Jaime comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 28 years old and in a common law marriage. He has an underage son and supports his two nephews who live with him.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to increase turnover in his business by purchasing assorted merchandise such as juice, refreshments and various other beverages so that he can meet his customers' needs.

In the future he intends to finish building his house and get married. His biggest challenge is providing his son with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase juice, refreshments and various other beverages so that he can meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 36 years old.

Marivic has a general store business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marivic has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
Leotina wants to extend her sincerest appreciation to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) that was used by God to help her in her business. Aside from the monetary support, lectures and seminars are part of their program, which molds her continuously to be well equipped as an entrepreneur. With the prior loan of PHP 20, 000. She was able to buy second hand computer units for the internet café and grocery items for her variety store business. The amount made a huge impact and she’s very thankful.

She’s managed those businesses for 5 years now and she wants to grow it for the number of patrons are increasing. She also wants to have savings for her family. For these reasons, Leotina is requesting an additional PHP 30, 000 this year. This amount will be used for the maintenance of all her computer units and the remaining will be used to buy computer peripherals.

On a weekly basis, Leotina regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: with the maintenance of all her computer units and to buy computer peripherals.

loans.name: Nilton

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga província de Inhambane tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos menores de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2010, este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, ferros e mais, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é melhorar as suas condições de vida e concluir o nível superior.
texts.en:
Nilton comes from Massinga, province of Inhambane. He's 36 years old and in a common law marriage. He has four underage children and doesn't support anyone else.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2010. This is his 8th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, iron, etc., so that he can continue building his house.

In the future he intends to finish building his house and buy a acquire a vehicle. His biggest challenge is improving his living conditions and finishing college.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, iron, etc., so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Rocha

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Moatize Província de Tete tem 54 anos de idade, é solteiro pai de 2 filhos maiores de idade, dos quais 1 é que frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 5 netos e 1 sobrinha que vivem em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedras para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade e garantir o ensino da sua filha até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Rocha comes from Moatize, province of Tete. He's 54 years old and single. He has two adult children, one of whom is in school. He supports his five grandchildren and a niece who live with him.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2012. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement and rocks so that he can continue building his house.

In the future he intends to start a business selling products that are household staples. He also intends to provide his daughter with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and rocks so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Isaac Manuel

texts.es: Isaac es un hombre con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 24 años de edad y está muy contento por los logros que pudo lograr con su crédito, pues gracias a ello sus materiales compro por lo que a su clientela pudo satisfacer mejor. Él nuevamente tiene la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para seguir comprando materia prima para su negocio de sastrería, con el crédito el comprara (telas, hilos, agujas). Su gran sueño es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Isaac is a man with big aspirations in life. He is 24 years old and is very happy with the successes that he has been able to have with his loan. Thanks to the loan, he was able to buy materials to satisfy his clients better.

He again needs to request a loan to continue buying raw materials for his tailor shop. With the loan, he will buy fabric, thread, and needles.

His big dream is to continue strengthening his business and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Twezimbe Kyengera Group

texts.en:
Betty, a young entrepreneur of 30 years of age, lives in a rural area with her husband and children.

She sees herself in the future as a successful industrious owner of a prominent shop in the neighbourhood, where she wants to sell what she now does but in greater quantity and variety. She loves selling clothes and secondhand shoes.

Being an independent entrepreneur allows her to work on her own terms and dedicate her time to her children and her husband. Betty is available every day from 8 am to 8 pm to sell her clothes, directly or through a social network, to friends, classmates and family. Her customer base keeps growing thanks to referrals.

She wants to sell items from the newest ranges and thus is requesting her first loan to buy clothes and shoes. The goal is to have new merchandise on offer for the end-of-year season and increase her sales.

Betty and her husband plan to buy a house and want to give a great life to their future children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Idelfonso Reynaldo

texts.es: Idelfonso es un profesor jubilado de 66 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Sahuanay, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar tres vacas orgánicas, espera poder vender la leche que produzcan a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, motivo por el cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Idelfonso is a retired teacher. He is 66 years old and lives with his wife in a rural area of Sahuanay, which is located in Moquegua. He is dedicated to raising organic cattle, and he always pays a lot of attention to the care and nutrition he offers them. He feeds them organic alfalfa that he grows.

He requests the loan to buy three organic cows. He hopes to be able to sell the milk they products at a better price because it will be organic.

In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his life conditions and to continue having good health, which is the reason he invests in organic.

loans.use: to buy three organic cows to sell their milk, so that he can earn more income and improve his life conditions.

loans.name: Leyda Cecilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive señora Leyda, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno vive con ellos y estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Leyda  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  vende productos   como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, entre otras cosas, que a pesar de que su tienda no tiene mucho tiempo la tiene bien surtida y  sus clientes consiguen de todo. Parte de este crédito es para que su marido lo utilice en sus actividades de pesca, el necesita comprar redes y otros materiales de pesca para mejorar su labor, ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos pues es así como ella pude sacar adelante su negocio y el de su marido.
 Este crédito es para comprar víveres y materiales de pesca. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jaramijo canton, which is known for it's beautiful beaches. The majority of inhabitants here are very hard-working working and work in activities related to the ocean.

Leyda lives here. She is 45 years old and married. From this relationship she has four children and one of them still lives with them and studies in high school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Leyda has a grocery store in her house where she sells products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables and meat amongst other things. In spite of not having her store for a long time, it is well-stocked and her clients can get everything.

Part of this loan is for her husband to use in his fishing business. He needs to buy nets and other material for fishing to improve his work. Leyda is very grateful to the institution and the people who help her with the loans as in this way she can get ahead with her business and her husband's.

This loan will be use to buy food and materials for fishing. She has been in the communal bank for four loan cycles and she likes it because of the support the institution provides. Her dream is to continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy food and fishing materials.

loans.name: Anjana's Group

texts.en:
Anjana is a 52-year-old married woman, standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Umerkote district, Odisha, India. Along with her group members, she is seeking a loan of 45,000 Indian rupees (INR). She will use her portion of the loan to construct a toilet in her home.

Anjana lives in a home with no access to a toilet thereby forcing the family members to go outdoors to relieve themselves. They have to travel long distances at odd hours of the night. And Anjana faces a lot of health-related issues due to her old age.

Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle. Plus, having a toilet will save them a certain amount of money every month which they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation. This loan will give them access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

Anjana is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es un gran padre de familia, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, él cuenta que gracias a los créditos que ha tenido acceso en ADICLA con su cultivo ha logrado salir adelante pues con su crédito él logro comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes  a Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional pudo vender su producto. Santos nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un crédito porque necesita cultivar unas cuerdas de zanahoria para cosecharlo al final de este año Santos comprara semillas de zanahoria y fertilizantes. Su esperanza de vida es alimentar mejor su cultivo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a father of the family, with big aspirations for life. Thanks to the loans that he has had from ADICLA, he has succeeded in going forward; with his loans, he succeeded in buying seeds and fertilizers. Thanks to God, he has gotten a good harvest and could sell his products in the regional market.

Santos again needs a loan because he needs to cultivate carrots to harvest buy by the end of the year. Santos will buy carrot seeds and fertilizers.

His hope for life is to improve his crop and improve his life conditions.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: On Time Group

texts.en:
Hashim, who is in his early 30s, is married with 2 children, one of whom is still in school while the other is still small. He has been selling new and secondhand shoes since 2000. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Hashim's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his shoe inventory and has managed to repay all of his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for its support of his group which has improved financially. He used his profits to pay school fees and repay loans, purchase a plot of land and flat screen TV, and cover his household expenses.

Hashim will use this loan to increase his inventory of new and secondhand shoes so he can meet customer demand and requirements. He dreams of expanding his business.

Hashim will share this loan with his loan group On Time which has 3 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of new and secondhand shoes and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 34-year-old, married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their four children, who are still studying. She and her husband cooperate to manage their family’s affairs and to cover their daily needs. Her husband works as a trader, and she works as a babysitter. With the requested loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l, she would like to pay her children’s educational fees. One of her greatest dreams is to save enough money to provide her children with anything that they need.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.ru: Прекрасная девушка из города Курган-Тюбе, Райхона. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Детям 8 и 6 лет. Райхона очень любит детей. Ее муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Райхона выбрала деятельность воспитательницу. Она работает в детском садике. Райхона хорошо ухаживает о детьми. Она ремонтирует свой дом. Уже осень и стало холодно для маленьких детишек. Она хочет улучшить жилищные условия детей. Райхона из-за нехватки денег была вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить нужные  стройматериалы. Райхона надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Rayhona is a wonderful young woman from the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 27 and married with two children aged 8 and 6, whom she loves very much. Her husband works in construction doing home renovations, while she chose a profession in childcare and works at a kindergarten, taking good care of the children.

Rayhona is renovating her house. It is already fall and it has become cold for her small children. She wants to improve their living conditions and, due to not having enough money, needs a loan for this. She will use the loan amount to buy the building materials she needs. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy the building materials she needs to do renovations

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with six children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for six years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, matches, milk, detergent, sanitary pads, rice, maize flour, etc. to sell.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and fully educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, matches, milk, detergent, sanitary pads, rice, maize flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Milagros has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, sanitary pads, diapers, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, toothpaste, etc.

Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Молодой воспитанный мужчина Ахлиддин. Ему 27 лет. Он младший сын в семье. У него есть один брат. Ахлиддин семейный человек. У него жена и трое детей. Детям 9, 6 и 1 лет. Жена домохозяйка, она следит за домашними делами и во дворе выращивает скота. Она на все успевает. Ахлиддин серьезный, ответственный и энергичный. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Ахлиддин 4 год продвигает свою работу. Ахлиддин обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить на операции брата. Его брат болеет, и ему скоро делают операцию. По этой причине Ахлиддин был вынужден, обратится за кредитом. Ахлиддин верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This young man is called Ahliddin. He is 27 and the youngest son in the family. He has one brother. Ahliddin is a family man - he has a wife and three children aged nine, six and one. His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of household chores and raises livestock on their property. She is very successful. Ahliddin is serious, responsible and energetic. He has been working in construction doing home renovations for four years.

Ahliddin is looking for a loan in order to pay for his brother's operation. His brother is ill and will be having an operation soon. For this reason Ahliddin needs a loan. He trusts in you and in your support.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's operation

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma and her family live in the city of Baybay in Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this business proficiently for 11 years to help her husband raise their three children, who are 19, 17 and 11 years old. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fruits to sell. She will also buy eggs. She is planning to expand her business for additional earnings.  Norma wants in the future to have a better standard of living. She wants to enhance her income and to have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has 4 children, aged 17, 14, 12, and 11 years.

Her husband works hard as a carpenter while Rosie is engaged in her direct sales business. She and her husband together earn a living to provide for the needs of their children.

Rosie is a determined woman and she wants to improve their livelihood so they can have a better income for their family. For now, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital to buy beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and personal and home care products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and personal and home care products.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина 50 лет. Она замужем и у неё четверо детей. У неё высшее образование. Она работает врачом.  Она очень  хороший и добрый человек.  Она очень стремительный и трудолюбивый человек. Она зарабатывает на жизнь честным трудом и старается для благополучия своей семьи. Так как наступают зимние холода она хочет отремонтировать и благоустроить свой дом. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Для этого Шахло обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a hardworking and cheerful woman of 50. She is married and has four children. She has a higher education and works as a doctor. She is a very good and kind person, very efficient and hardworking. She earns a living through honest labour and works for the well-being of her family.

Now that the cold winter weather is arriving, Shahlo wants to renovate and improve her home, but she doesn't have enough money. She has approached Arvand for a loan to purchase building materials for the renovations. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Dulcisima requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Dulcisima has been in this business for 40 years now.

Dulcisima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 45 years old and has 10 children. She is married, and 7 of their children are currently in school.

Susana is in the agriculture business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Susana has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Tojinosso

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Точиниссо. Она мама четверых детей. Ее муж оставил ее с детьми на произвол судьбы. Но благодаря своей выдержки, она не растерялась и нашла в себе силы жить и расти своих чад. Точиниссо сама работает и растет четверых детей и не обращает внимание на трудности. Точиниссо работает портнихой и этим бизнесом она кормит детей. 
  Скоро зима и Точиниссо хочет отремонтировать дом, и подготовится к зиме. Она понимает, как важно сохранить тепло в доме и чтобы дети не пострадали от холодов. Точиниссо собирается купить стройматериалы и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
This is Tojinosso. She is the mother of four children. Her husband left her and the children to fend for themselves. But thanks to her endurance, she didn't lose her nerve and found the strength to live and to raise her children. She works and raises her children and doesn't pay any attention to difficulties. She works as a seamstress and feeds her children thanks to this business.

It will soon be winter and Tojinisso wants to renovate her home and prepare for winter. She understands how important it is to keep her home warm so the children don't suffer from the cold. She intends to buy building materials to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials for home renovations

loans.name: Mirella Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirella, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 10 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Mirella es una mujer que le gusta generar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar y los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos que para ella es lo más importante, ella se dedica a la  venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale cuatro veces por semana en la mañana ya que a esta hora es más fresco,  deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ya son más de 8 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual financia gracias a los créditos que recibe razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución y con las ´personas que le ayudan con los créditos. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  ciertos materiales de pesca que necesita el marido. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños darles la mejor educación a su hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group "Urb. Las Viviendas" meeds ever 15 days in the sector of Jaramillo, an area known for its beautiful beaches.  Most of the inhabitants are workers dedicated to jobs related to the ocean. 

This is where Mrs. Mirella lives.  She is 35 years old, married and has 3 children, ages 17, 15, and 10.  All of her children study either at university, high school, or gradeschool.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

Mrs. Mirella is a woman who likes to earn her own income and use it to help her husband to move their household forward.  Her children's studies are of the utmost importance.  She makes a living selling all types of clothing, which she does through door-to-door sales.  She goes out four times a week in the morning, as it is the coolest, delivers on credit and collects each week.  She now has over 8 years of experience in this sector, which have been financed by the loans she has received, which is why she is very grateful to the institution and to the people who help her with the loans.    

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and certain fishing materials that her husband needs.  She has been in the Credit Group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business.  Her dream is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and fishing materials.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma was able to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, and other grocery items because Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan amount of 50,000 PHP. She wants to thank CCT and the lenders for their generosity in helping people financially to run their businesses. Without their help, she would not be able to buy bulk quantities of products to add to her business' inventory. Most of all, she wants to thank God for providing CCT and the lenders as a medium of blessing to her.

Alma is determined to succeed in her business as she has 2 children to support and other expenses that need to be paid. She spends her whole day managing her variety store and praying that God will send more patrons and bigger revenues.

Alma is currently not satisfied with the status of her business, because she wants to expand it someday. For this to take place, she needs to have an established savings account. She’s applying for another loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to buy more stock of grocery items, sacks of rice, and bottled drinks. More products will provide bigger revenues.

Alma is consistent in attending her weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members’ life-changing testimony and shares her own experience of God’s love. She also repays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and other grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 45 years old and married with seven children.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Luciana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Inhambane tem 64 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 10 filhos apenas 1 menor de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011, este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e tinta para terminar a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Rosendo comes from the town of Inhambane. He's 64 years old and married. He has ten children, ony one of whom is underage. All his children are in school and he doesn't support anyone else.

He first started working with Hluvuku in 2011. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement and paint so that he can finish building his house.

In the future he intends to start a chicken farm business and provide his children with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and paint so he can finish building his house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em gaza, tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 5 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão qua vive em sua casa.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas, para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos e abrir uma lavandaria.
texts.en:
Samuel comes from Gaza. He's 40 years old and in a common law marriage. He has five underage children, all of whom are in school. He supports his brother who lives with him.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku. With it he intends to increase turnover in his chicken farm business by purchasing chicks, feed and vitamins so that he can meet his customers' needs.

In the future he intends to expand his chicken farm and open a laundry business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sanphan Group

texts.en:
Lae’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Lae and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Lae and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2-year period filter users, like Lae’s family, have identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, está estudiando la carrera de radiología, sus padres son comprometidos con ella y siempre la ayuda en todo lo que pueden, Maria trabaja en una panadería como empleada, y por medio de su trabajo busca la manera de poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria comes from a humble and hardworking family, and is studying radiology.  Her parents are committed to her and always help her with everything they can.  Maria works as an employee in a bakery and through this job seeks a way to be able to help her family.   She is asking for the loan to be able to pay her enrollment and university fees for her degree, and in this way continue studying.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment and university fees.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah is a 23-year-old, married mother of two children who has been working for three years at her house selling homemade foods in order to improve her family’s standard of living. She is a very hard worker and is very optimistic about her future. Today, Farah is obtaining a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy more ingredients for her production of food. In that way she will able to provide her clients with good products. She expects an increase in her income and hopes that her business will grow so that she will be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her production of food

loans.name: Nadoo Group

texts.en:
Khammerng’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khammerng and his group are excited that the filters are available on a payment plan that make it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Khammerng and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2-year period, filter users, like Khammerng’s family, have identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nisso

texts.ru: Ниссо простоя женщина из не большого городка Куляб. Народ Куляба славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства и чувство юмора. Ниссо является одним их тех жителей прекрасного городка. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее муж строитель и Ниссо его опора и поддержка во всем. Она старается не отставать от мужа и так же зарабатывать, чтобы прокормить детей и поднять семейный бюджет. Ниссо в течение 5 лет дома шьет женскую одежду и берет заказы на пошив. На данный момент Ниссо не имеет возможности дальше продолжить швейную деятельность из-за неполадок со швейной машинкой. Ниссо посоветовав с мужем, решилась обратиться за кредитом для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Nisso is a simple woman from the small city of Kulob. The people of this city are known for their incomparable style of hospitality and their sense of humour. Nisso is among the residents of this wonderful city. She is 39 and married with two children. Her husband works in construction and she supports him in everything. She tries not to fall behind her husband and also earns money to feed her children and support the family budget. 

Nisso has been sewing women's clothing at home for five years and takes sewing orders. At the moment she isn't able to continue her sewing business because her sewing machine isn't working. She has discussed the matter with her husband and decided to take out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic windows, chairs, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more metal rods. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big workshop. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another workshop.

loans.use: to buy more metal rods

loans.name: Radha's Group

texts.en:
Radha is a 30-year-old humble and simple lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Umerkote, Odisha, India .Radha is a married lady and is a blessed mother of an infant. Her household income is very low and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and hand cleaner in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community. Radha is awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and hand cleaner in it

loans.name: Viengkham Group

texts.en:
Maivan is excited that their water filter is available on an affordable payment plan.

Maivan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced-out over 2 years. The water filter Maivan and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.

Maivan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Maivan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lachhanti's Group

texts.en:
Lachhanti is an enterprising lady standing to the middle in the photograph with her small son. She hails from an interior village of Umerkote, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and her son. Lachhanti is a fish vendor by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities of her small son. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend to nature's call.This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce her medical expenses

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health

loans.name: Kamaldei's Group

texts.en:
Kamaldei, 32, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a simple and hardworking lady from Umerkote, Odisha, India. She has a small family with two daughters in her care. Her husband works as a mason in the same village.

Kamaldei hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible to depend on an open field for defecation.

Kamaldei, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a latrine pan in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and a happy life.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a latrine pan in it

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lucy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lucy has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Bee Group

texts.en:
Thongdai is excited that the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

Thongdai and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced-out over 2 years. The water filter Thongdai and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.

Thongdai and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thongdai and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
A Laurinda tem 4 filhos dois qauis 3 a frequentar a escola onde dois maiores de  18 anos. Tem mais 2 pessoas na sua responsabilidade,vive na casa propria juntos com a sua familia.Vive de negocios e também atraves de pesca e pequenos trabalhos da lavandaria.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar: cerveja, refrescos,açúcar,oleo alimentar,omo e bolachas e arroz em sacos para revenda.
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua mercearia, pagar escola para os seus filhos, reforçar  e expandir  seu  negocio nos outros bairros.
Continuar a construir mais quartos de aluguer para as  pessoas necessitadas de forma a ajudar nas despesas de casa.
texts.en:
Laurinda has four children, three of whom are in school, and two of those are over 18 years of age. She has two other people under her responsibility. She lives with her family in a house that she owns. She earns a living through her business, fishing and small-scale laundry work.

With the money from the loan she'll purchase beer, refreshments, sugar, cooking oil, laundry detergent and bags of rice for re-selling.

Her biggest dream is to finish setting up her grocery store, pay for her children's school, and improve and expand her business into other neighborhoods.

She also plans to build additional rooms for renting out to people in need as a way to help her afford her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase beer, refreshments, sugar, cooking oil, laundry detergent, crackers and bags of rice for re-selling.

loans.name: Dokkham Group

texts.en:
Thamoua understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.

Thamoua knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Thamoua purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent on buying charcoal and also decreasing the time and cost spent foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Thamoua is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years. So he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo above is Hannah. She is 55 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013.

Hannah practices vegetable farming on her small farm. She is grateful for the HIH EA enterprise training which enabled her to manage her enterprise well.

Hannah is taking a Kiva loan to purchase the farm inputs that will help increase yields and thus better her income. This will enable Hannah to support her family's basic needs such as education, medicare, and clothing.

Hannah is happy for Kiva and their lenders and for their intervention. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs that will help increase yields.

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en:
Thoum is excited that the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

Thoum and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced-out over 2 years. The water filter Thoum and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.

Thoum and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thoum and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y por medio de su carrera quiere ayudar a sus seres queridos y también a las demás personas.
Ella es una persona que se sacrifica mucho por poder cumplir sus anhelos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder cumplir sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Cynthia is from the city of Curuguaty, she is studying for a nursing degree and through her degree she wants to help her loved ones and also other people.

She is a person who has sacrificed a lot to be able to achieve her desires. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the fees for her degree and in this way to achieve her desires.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Pargev

texts.en: Pargev lives in Koghb village of the Tavush region with his mother, wife and two school aged children. The borrower is engaged in the repair and maintenance service of cars (he provides repair work and welding). He learned this work in 1995, and since then has already become very professional and experienced. He works in the garage of his own house, and receives a large number of customers during the month. The requested loan will greatly help Pargev to purchase a damaged car to renovate and resell so his family will have more income to cover daily basic costs.

loans.use: to pay for a damaged car to renovate and resell so his family will have more income to cover daily basic costs.

loans.name: Gisselle

texts.es:
Giselle continua con sus estudios, y comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, comenta que por medio de este nuevo préstamo quiere volver a pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Giselle continues with her studies and says that with her previous loan, she was able to pay the fees for her program. She says that with this new loan, she wants to pay the fees for her program again and, in this way, to be able to continue with her studies.

She is grateful for the new opportunity that she gets to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Liliana Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 7 meses  de edad. El marido es guardia de seguridad. 
Doña Liliana con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante junto a su familia  se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos  por catalogo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y va cobrando cada 8 días. Lleva casi un año que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le deja sus recursos para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Urb. Las Viviendas meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo district. This place is known due to its beautiful beaches. Most of the population is very hardworking here and they make a living fishing in the sea.

In this place lives Liliana, she is 21 years old and has a domestic partnership from which she has a 7 months old child. Her husband is a security guard.

Liliana intends to earn some money on her own and be able to succeed together with her family. She makes a living trading, she sells shoes with a products catalogue. She sells door-to-door and also at her home, where her more loyal customers come. She gives credit and collects payments every 8 days. She has worked for almost a year at this job, which is allowing her to earn money to move on.

She is going to use this loan to buy all sorts of shoes. She has used twice the Credit Group and she likes it because she can finance her business better with the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her child.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Freddy Esteban

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Freddy, tiene 51 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 26 y 17 años, los menores son gemelos y estudian en  colegio. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad para darles lo mejor a su familia, el se dedica a la  compra y venta de mariscos, todos los días se desplaza hasta la playa de la localidad donde llegan los pescadores de la zona y ahí el les compra sus productos los mismos que luego entrega  a domicilio a  restaurantes, hoteles y personas de la localidad, el lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas y otros mariscos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para vender.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas loan group meets every two weeks in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for its lovely beaches. Here, the majority of the people are very hardworking and dedicated to the work of the sea.

Freddy lives in this place. He is 51 years old, married, and in this relationship has 3 children, ages 26 and 17. The younger ones are twins and are secondary school students. His wife is a saleswoman.

Freddy is a very hard-working man who does whatever job to give his family the best. He works buying and selling shellfish. Every day he goes to the beach of the locality where the fishermen from the area come, and there he buys his products which he then delivers to homes and restaurants, hotels and people in the area. He has been doing this work for over 20 years, with which he earns his living.

This loan will be used to purchase fish, shrimp, shells and other shellfish. He has been in the loan group since the beginning and he likes it for the help and benefits he gets from the group. His dream is to purchase a car to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, shells and other shellfish.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion is a 28-year-old farmer from Chirileni village, in the Ungheni region of Moldova. Ion is single. He has a small farm.

Now, Ion cares for 20 cows for milk production and 5 small cattle. He collects about 150 liters of milk every day and delivers it to a distribution point.

Ion also raises cereals on 3 hectares of land. He is a very diligent man, and he wants to expand his farm. He lives with his parents and selling milk is the main source of his family's income.

Ion will use this loan to buy 6 cows to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy cows to expand his farm.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: La señora Pastora, vive en Manco Kapac del tropico de Cochabamba, junto a sus tres hijos y su marido. Trabaja en el área agrícola junto con la ayuda de su esposo, cultivan sus productos en terreno propio, que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo durante la colonización, migrando de los lugares donde hay poco movimiento económico, actualmente produce yuca en 1 hectárea, produce palmito 3 has y cítricos 1 ha, los productos los venden a los intermediarios que vienen a comprar al lugar de cosecha, la producción es familiar y a la vez contrata personal eventual que le colabora en el mantenimiento y en la cosecha de los productos. la Señora siempre fue velando por el crecimiento económico y por el bienestar de sus hijos para que estudien, observo que la producción de palmito le genera buenos ingresos y de fácil manejo por lo cual decidió ampliar la producción es por ello que requiere un préstamo para llevar la ampliación de la producción y así a  mediano plazo sus ingresos aumentaran. Doña Pastora con este capital podrá realizar lo propuesto con su parcela de palmitos.
texts.en: Pastora lives in Manco Kapac, in the tropics of Cochabamba, with her three children and her husband. She works in an agricultural area with the help of her husband. They grow products on their own land, which they got with a lot of effort during the settlement program, migrating from the places where there was little economic activity. Currently she produces one hectare of yucca, 3 hectares of palm hearts, and 1 hectare of citrus. They sell the products to intermediaries who come to purchase at the harvesting location. The production is by the family and they also hire occasional workers who help maintaining and harvesting the products. She has always kept an eye on the economic growth and the well-being of her children so that they go to school. She saw that the production of palm hearts generated good income for her and it was easy to manage, so she decided to expand the production. For this, she needs a loan to carry out the expansion of the production so that, in the medium term, her income will increase. Pastora, with this capital, will be able to do what she has proposed with her plot of palm hearts.

loans.use: to expand her production of palm hearts and to have better products to sell and put on the market and to have more income for her family.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is 56 years old and is a married woman. She earns a living through selling “carabao” milk or native water buffalo milk. She has been doing this patiently for 2 years.

Marlina needs capital to finance the feed for their “carabao” for healthy growth and to be able to produce more milk. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy feed.

Marlina’s main goal in life is to be successful in the future. She wants to increase her earnings and have a better life for her family in the future. Additionally, her husband is a farmer and they have 5 adult children.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for exams and medical treatments for the stomach pain that bothers her and to be able to continue with her work.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen started in the taxi driving business last year. Using his own car, he provides taxi services to local people in the town and gets income for his wife and their two children.

Armen asks for this loan to pay for the installation of gas equipment in his car, which will allow it to run on natural gas, and to buy new tires for it. This will decrease operational costs and help him receive more income to support his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for installation of gas equipment in his car, as well as to purchase new tires for it. This will decrease operational costs and help him receive more income to support his family's living.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba est femme âgée de 52 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ayaba est une marchande de «  pure water » et du jus en gros et en détail qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Ayaba désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sachets d’eau «  pure water » en gros et en détail puis des sacs de sucre  en vue de bien revendre et de tirer profit afin de gagner plus de revenus et pouvoir mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a woman of 52 who lives in Tokoin. Married and the mother of two children, Ayaba sells "Pure Water" and juice wholesale and retail. She stocks up once a month at the market and resells the water in front of her house.

Ayaba wants this loan to finance her purchase of little bags of "Pure Water", wholesale and retail, as well as some sacks of sugar, to make good sales and profit. She wants to earn more income to be able to help out with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 200 little bags of Pure Water and four sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is a 44-year-old married woman who has four school-aged children. She earns a living by operating a rickshaw transportation service. She transports passengers from one place to another. Aside from that, she also grows rice. Her husband has an income that helps defray the family's daily living expenses.

Sarah Jane has requested a loan to pay for repair of her rickshaw. These repairs will improve safety and comfort and ensure that its daily operation continues. She will also use the loan for fertilizer for the farm. This will help her increase her yield and grow her profits.

Sarah Jane is determined to be successful in the years to come and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for repairs for her rickshaw.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 56-year-old, Lebanese widow and mother of four children, two of them are still studying. Her oldest children are the main source of the family's income to satisfy their life requirements. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members.

Today, she is eager to take a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees. She intends to help them and to provide them with a good education.

This is her first loan and she wants to express her thanks for it.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Javier Christian

texts.es: EL señor Christian es un joven emprendedor quien busca el apoyo para poder colocar en funcionamiento su taller de metal mecánica para lo cual él está capacitado, él no puede aperturar su negocio por falta de maquinaria impidiendo que él pueda acceder a trabajos grandes que le ayudaría a darse a conocer por el buen servicio que brinda, actualmente sus padres ya se encuentran ancianos convirtiéndose en el principal proveedor económico de la familia no pudiendo satisfacer muchas necesidades por la que incurre en el hogar y la salud de sus padres; razón por la que él tiene el sueño de tener  maquinarias y de esta forma poder mantener con una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres ancianos que tanto le colaboraron en la obtención de su carrera sintiéndose frustrado al no poder colaborar a sus padres y cumplir con sus necesidades de salud. Christian es un joven emprendedor que tiene nuevos modelos y nuevas estructuras en el servicio de metal mecánica que el brinda no puede mostrar ninguno de sus talentos ya que no cuenta con la maquinaria necesaria para poder realizar los trabajos que él tiene en mente.
texts.en: Christian is an enterprising young man who seeks support to be able to get his mechanic metal shop, for which he is trained, up and running. He can't open his business due to lack of machinery, preventing him from being able to access the big jobs that would help him to be known for the good service that he offers. Now, his parents are elderly, and he has become the primary economic provider for the family, unable to satisfy many needs which come up in the home and the health of his parents. For this reason, he has the dream of having machinery and in this way to be able to maintain a better quality of life for his elderly parents who helped him so much in getting his degree. He is feeling frustrated at not being able to help his parents and meet their health needs. Christian is an enterprising young man who has new models and new structures in the metal mechanic service that he offers. He can't demonstrate his talents at all because he doesn't have the necessary machinery to be able to do the work that he has in mind.

loans.use: to purchase machinery for his metal mechanic shop and in this way be able to offer better service and to generate income for his elderly parents.

loans.name: Adjélé  Essi  Délali

texts.fr: Adjélé est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Adjélé est une marchande de fournitures scolaire et des condiments puis s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des cartons de cahiers, des boîtes d’écritoires et le bidon de miel, Adjélé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et pouvoir mieux revendre puis réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son mari à couvrir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjélé is a married woman aged 42 who lives in Tokoin. The mother of four children, Adjélé sells school supplies and condiments. She stocks up twice a month in the market and sells outside her home to make a living.

So as to put in an order for some cartons of notebooks, boxes of writing boards, and a container of honey, Adjélé needs these funds to finance her restocking. She will then be able to make better sales and a higher profit margin and can help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 11 cartons of notebooks, eight boxes of writing boards, and one jug of honey.

loans.name: Alejandra Fabiola

texts.es: La Srta. Alejandra es soltera no tiene hijos, desde muy joven trabajo en talleres de costura, ya que sus padres se divorciaron y los ingresos económicos de su madre no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su familia, por lo que decidió trabajar para ayudar a su madre, ya que su padre les pasa una mensualidad mínima que no es suficiente. La Srta. Alejandra fue a trabajar un año a Chile, para poder generar un poco más de ingresos, con el cual logro ayudar bastante a su madre e independizarse. Cuando volvió a Bolivia decidió capacitarse en la conducción de movilidad en un centro de enseñanza, por lo que requiere el préstamo para la compra de una movilidad y así poder trabajar en el servicio de taxi en una radio móvil de pura mujeres que el centro donde se capacito está promocionando, de esta forma podrá tener un trabajo en cual pude disponer de su tiempo pues espera retomar sus estudios en la universidad en la noches, mejorando su calidad de vida, también ayudaría más a su familia.
texts.en: Alejandra is single, does not have any children, and since she was very young worked in sewing shops, since her parents were divorced and her mother's economic income was not enough to cover the expenses in the family, so she decided to work to help her mother, since her father gave them a monthly amount that was not enough. Alejandra went to work for a year in Chile to be able to generate a little more income, with which she managed to help her mother a lot and become independent. When she returned to Bolivia, she decided to get training in driving at a school, so she needs to purchase a vehicle and, so, to be able to work in a taxi service in a mobile radio operation of just women that the school where she got trained is promoting. In this way she will be able to have work in which she can have available time since she wants to take up her schooling again at the university at nights, improving her quality of life, and also she would help her family more.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi and, so, to be able to work in a taxi service and generate more income to help her family.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 24-year-old engaged Lebanese woman. She has worked as a private teacher since 2011. She chose this profession because she feels that she is helping students to get the education they need. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and has equipped it with the required materials and supplies.

Today, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help her in her work and to improve her teaching skills. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita appreciated the quick response of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) about her previous loan application of PHP 50,000 that she was able to buy business essentials like canteen equipment and grocery items. She wants to thank lenders for the financial provision and God first and foremost for the people He used for the business.

Lolita is thankful to God that she was able to establish another branch and prays that it will be as successful as the other branches that she has. She’s currently managing 11 employees and looking to hire a new cook that will be assigned to her new branch in Manila.

Christmas season is fast approaching, that’s why she decided to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan that will be used as a revolving fund and the remaining amount for buying additional canteen utensils. She’s praying that lenders would once again consider her story and she’s thanking them in advance for this.

Lolita has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, canteen equipment and construction materials to improve her food business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 55-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has nine children: seven adult and two-school-aged children. She helps her husband raise them through buying and selling vegetables. She has been doing this kind of business for 10 years.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in order to increase her sales. Virginia’s main goal in life is to increase her earnings and to have a sustainable means of living.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une veuve femme qui vit à Tokoin avec un seul enfant à charge. Agée de 61 ans, Akouavi est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des habits pour enfants à la devanture de son domicile afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines des habits pour enfants, des soutiens gorges et des collants en vue de bien revendre et pouvoir financer son commerce puis trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son enfant en lui payant les frais scolaire dès ce début de la rentrée.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a widow who lives in Tokoin and is raising an only child. Aged 61, Akouavi is a dynamic and courageous woman who sells clothing for children in front of her house, in order to make a good living.

To reach her goals, Akouavi stocks up twice a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order several dozen garments for children as well as bras and stockings that she can resell well. She wants to finance her business and have a good turnover so that she can cover her daily needs and help her child by paying the school fees immediately at the beginning of this school year.

loans.use: to buy two dozen garments, five dozen bras, and five dozen pairs of stockings.

loans.name: Khok Group

texts.en:
Seevilay and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Seevilay and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. He is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Seevilay and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease, and after totaling up the costs, they recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rambai's Group

texts.en:
Rambai is a 30-year-old lady standing in the middle of the photograph. She lives with her husband and her two daughters. Rambai's husband is a labourer by profession.
