The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have hardly any savings. Therefore, Rambai was never able to build a toilet in her house for which she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances and isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe. She understands the importance of having a toilet at home as it will promote her safety.

Therefore, Rambai and her group members are requesting a loan of 45,000 Indian rupees. Rambai will use her portion of the loan to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it. The loan will subsequently result in enhancing cleanliness, health and hygiene.

Rambai is in dire need of your kind help and is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes

loans.name: King Jesus College School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sam. He is a director of King Jesus College School, a mixed school with 600 students in the rural area of Kasese, Uganda. King Jesus College School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

King Jesus College School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sam ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kibakenge Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en: The person raising his hand is Peter. He is 57 years old and married with four children. Peter does crop farming. He grows maize, potatoes and also does dairy farming. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and financial management, he has been able to run the business well. He is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such a fertilizer. This will boost crop yield and, therefore, his income. He plans to use the profit generated from his farm to meet family needs such as school fees and reinvest some of the profit in his farm. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support, and he promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 48-year-old woman who owns a small restaurant (known as a “carenderia” to the locals) with a karaoke machine. She raised her three children through this business for 20 years. This business is their main source of income.

Now she is asking for a bigger loan to help her operate this business continuously. She needs the amount to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor and coconut wine, known as “tuba.”

Elvira dreams to expand her business in the future for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor and coconut wine, known as “tuba.”

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 39 years old, married and blessed with three children.

She has had a retail shop business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to buy retail goods such as sugar, maize flour, tea leaves and detergents for sale and thereby make more income to provide for the needs of her family.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and provide food for her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income and be financially stable as well as provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy retail goods such as sugar, maize flour, tea leaves and detergents for sale and thereby make more income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hannatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hannatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Hannatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg lives with his parents in Kapan town of Syunik region. For over six years, he has been involved in cornice production. Oleg receives orders from individuals and local furniture stores and makes high quality cornices for them. This work is main source of income for his family and Oleg works hard to develop it.

The loan will be very helpful for him to purchase materials for making cornices and selling them, so the current orders are complete.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making cornices and selling them.

loans.name: Lakhanti's Group

texts.en:
Lakhanti is 36 years old and is standing in the middle in the photograph. She belongs to a village in a place in Umerkote district of Odisha, India. She, along with her fellow group members, is seeking a loan of 45,000 INR. Lakhanti will use her portion of the loan amount for the construction of a toilet at her place. With a family of seven, which is really a big family, it is important for Lakhanti to provide safe sanitation for her family.

When there is no safe sanitation option, there are high chances of catching diseases, and women are more prone to these diseases, and they have a risk of getting bitten by insects and animals. Having a toilet in their home would make their lives easier and safer. This would not only save Lakhanti's time but also give her family a safe sanitation option.

She is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to construct a toilet at her place.

loans.name: Pakuayneua Group

texts.en:
Seenuan understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water, if it is available.

Seenuan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so that he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thahae Group

texts.en:
Hang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Hang and her group are excited that a water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. Hang and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Hang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en:
Georgi is a dentist with a higher education degree, living and working in Gyumri town. He is the proud son of his parents. Georgi lives with his grandparents, wife and their newborn daughter.

Georgi started working 8 years ago after he got his degree as a dentist. He is devoted to his job and works day and night to help the visitors with their health issues.

The requested loan is vital for Georgi to purchase materials for medical treatment and equipment needed for his work as a dentist. He hopes to receive the support and improve the quality of service provided to his visitors.

loans.use: to pay for materials for medical treatment and equipment needed for a dentist.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is involved in retail of fruits and vegetables in the open market in the Shirak region. He lives in Gyumri town with his wife and two children.

Vahagn, using his own truck, takes the gathered harvest to the market as well as to nearby villages. He works hard to have successful sale and gather income for his family's daily needs.

Vahagn asks lenders for this loan to pay for renovation of the truck to transport products to the market and a new stock of fruits and vegetables to resell.

He will be very grateful to lenders for their faith and support. He dreams of having a successful business and providing good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck to transport products to the market and a  new stock of fruits and vegetables to resell to customers and gather income for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una señora  casada, padece de miopía y astigmatismo en ambos ojo. Desde hace mas de diez utiliza anteojos. Necesita tres procedimientos quirúrgicos, por no tratarse de inmediato la retina de su ojo derecho se esta desprendiendo por lo que le urge ser operada
Teme perder la vista ya que por el momento no cuento con los recursos necesarios, desafortunadamente tampoco cuenta con algún servicio de seguridad social por lo que tiene que atenderse particularmente.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who suffers from myopia and astigmatism in both eyes.  She's been wearing glasses for more than 10 years.  She needs 3 surgical procedures, and she needs immediate treatment because the retina of her right eye is detaching.  This is why they are urging her to get the operation.

She fears losing her vision, but at this time she lacks the resources to pay for the treatment.  Unfortunately, she does not have any health insurance, and so she must cover this expense privately.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Taba's Group

texts.en:
Taba hails from a low-income household from an interior, remote and tribal village of Umerkote, Odisha, India. She is a married lady living with her two sons and three daughters. The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Taba.

Taba has struggled a lot in her life in order to sustain herself and her family. She is a lady with sheer determination and strong willpower. Lack of financial resources has never allowed her to build a hygienic toilet at her home and get access to basic sanitary facilities. This has compelled her and her family walk long distances in odd hours in order to defecate and urinate. This practice is not safe and feasible enough in the long run.

Therefore, Taba, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it. The loan amount will help her in getting access to basic sanitation facilities and thereby improve the health of her family.

Taba is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting your support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: St. Paul Kitgum School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rev. Br. Alex. He is the Head Teacher of St. Paul Kitgum Italy School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kitgum with 1100 students. St. Paul Kitgum Italy School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Paul Kitgum Italy School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alex ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is 58 years old and from the Samtredia district. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law, who is employed and gets 270 GEL monthly. Vera works at the local theater as a comptroller and gets a small income. The family finds it hard to reach financial stability and cover all of its expenses. In order to increase the income of the family, Vera decided to start a buy-and-sell business. After several unsuccessful attempts, Vera applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.
With the help of her family members, Vera will start purchasing various industrial and second-hand things at wholesale prices and will sell them in her district at increased prices. Mainly, the purchased things will be cell phones, televisions and other home-need items. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Vera is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to increase her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a buy-and-sell trading business.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 53 years old, from Rustavi city, and lives with her 5 family members. Dali had been working as a baker for 15 years, but nowadays she is unemployed and has great desire to start her own business. With the help of her family members, she had already purchased some inventory for her little canteen and she now needs financial support to purchase inventory for her bakery, such as ovens and other tools.
Dali received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. She will bake various pastry dishes and will satisfy her costumer's needs. As she has great experience as a baker, Dali will make her business profitable. The loan will greatly assist Dali, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Dali has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase needed inventory to open a bakery.

loans.name: Maisha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Fatima, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running several projects, selling cosmetics, sarongs and madilas, for ten years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her cosmetics stock, and to start selling sarongs and madilas.

She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. Fatuma used the profits to pay school fees, to repay loans, bought a plot of land, and built her own house.

loans.use: to increase stock of cosmetics, sarongs and madilas.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a teacher with 10 years of experience working in a local school in Artik town. Gayane lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Besides working in the school, Gayane provides classes to her students from her house as well. She has a separate small work room in the house, where she receives her students and provides individual training and classes.

Gayane asks for this loan to purchase a laptop. This will be very helpful for making the classes more effective. She hopes to receive lenders' support and be able to make the class materials interesting for her students.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop needed for providing individual training to students in her house

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en:
Rabeka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabeka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabeka would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Rabeka can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabeka will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Rabeka is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Juma is in his early 40s, is married, and has three children who are still in school. He has been running a genge business (food store) for ten years now. He works from 4am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Juma's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his genge stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to reinvest in his business, and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store. He dreams of building his own house.

Juma will share this loan with his loan group Embassy which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in his food store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Victoria has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land (5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest - a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market - to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Victoria can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Victoria will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/hectare.

Victoria is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives with his mother in Tsaghakavan village in the Tavush region. His mother is a teacher at a local school, and Artak himself is involved in transportation and the sale of charcoal as an cheap and alternative energy. He is doing this business using his own car which he inherited from his father. Artak asks for this loan to prepare his business for the coming winter season. He needs to pay to renovate his truck and to buy two tires for the truck so it will function well in the coming winter season.
Artak hopes for lenders' faith and support.

loans.use: to renovate his truck and purchase two tires so it will function well in the coming winter season.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a married woman. She’s 28 years old and has two children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works very hard to be capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life.

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy books for her children for the new school year. One of her greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions. Fatmeh’s husband plans to develop his work in the near future so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to buy books for her children for the new school year

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María,  tiene 29  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene  dos  hijos 5 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas de catalogo, su  forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a vender por toda la ciudad,  por lo general siempre le gusta vender la mercadería que este de temporada ya que es la que se vende más rápido y mejoran sus ganancias,  trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día. Tiene 3  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual puede ganar sus recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y zapatos. Tiene tres ciclos en el grupo de crédito, le gusta porque los  créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas Credit Group" meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo Cantón, a place known for its beautiful beaches. Here, the majority of the residents are very hardworking fishermen.

Señora María, age 29, lives here. She is common-law-married and she has two children, ages five and three, from this relationship. The eldest is studying in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña María is a housewife who sells all types of clothing and shoes by catalog, in order to earn her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells door to door around the city. Generally, she always likes to sell seasonal merchandise because it sells more quickly and her earnings improve. She works two to three hours a day, three days a week. She has been engaged in this occupation for three years, and with it, she has been able to earn her income.

This loan is to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and shoes. She has been in the credit group for three cycles, and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Myrlie

texts.en:
Myrlie raises hogs to support the needs of her family. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband earns a living by being a driver. Together with her family, Myrlie lives in Tolosa, Leyte. To augment her income, she also engages in a food vending business.

Myrlie has requested a loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional capital for food vending. In that way, her economy will boost. With the loan, she could raise and sell quality hogs at a good price. Thus, she would be able to settle her obligation and handle her finances.

In the future, Myrlie is looking forward to continuing to expand her livelihood to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Pascale

texts.en:
Pascale is a 21-year-old married woman living with her husband and mother of two children, still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family; he works as a farmer.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to be able to pay her children's educational fees. This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Ina

texts.pt:
Ina é solteira de 23 anos de idade, é estudante universitária, é empredorora de sucesso, com uma capacidade enorme  de gerir a avicultura e escola.teve uma formação na area qu ela de dedica ,e depois seguiu o que foi recomendada.para seguir com actividade,nao tem pessoas na sua responsabilidade vive ainda em casa dos seus pais,com o dinheiro dos frangos paga escola e comparticipa nas despesas de casa.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar pintos, raçao, vitaminas e vacinas.
O seu maior sonho é concluir a faculdade, procurar emprego, construir um aviario pessoal e constituir uma familia.
Os pricipais desafios, continuar a criar frangos e ser fornecedora do Distrito.
texts.en:
Ina is 23 years old and single. She's a college student and a successful entrepreneur with a great capacity for managing her poultry business and her education. She received training in her line of work and then followed the advice she was given in order to move her business forward. She doesn't have anyone under her responsibility and still lives with her parents. With the money she earns from her chicken farm she pays for school and contributes towards the household expenses.

With the money from the loan she'll purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines.

Her biggest dream is to finish college, find employment, build her own aviary and start a family.

Her main challenges are keeping her chicken farm afloat and becoming a district supplier.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.name: Prosper Dev't Group Kawuku

texts.en:
Zabinah is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance, having taken a loan previously. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is a single mother with children.

She is a businesswoman who owns a bar, and she is a hardworking lady. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital to boost her business. In a bid to increase her working capital, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000.

She and the other group members are very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to them, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying for a degree in Business Administration, and he wants to get ahead and help his family by means of his profession.

His goal is to be able to finish his degree so that he can help his loved ones just as he was helped.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his fees, and in this way, be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa é solteira de 3 filhos de idade dos quais  2 maiores de idade e um menor de idade,todos frequentam a escola. Vive na base de negocios, têm duas mercearias e uma esta arrendarr e outra é propria.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar cerveja, refrescos, carne, arroz, frangos, e ovos para revender.
O seu maior sonho é construir mais uma mercearia noutro espaço, pagar escola para os seus filhos e ter uma viatura para facilitar no seu negocio.
 Seu desafio é pagar a escola para os seus filhos continuar a fazer negocios para ajudar a familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is single. She has three children, two of whom are adults and one is underage. All her children are in school. She earns a livelihood through her business. She owns two grocery stores, one which is rented out and one that she runs herself.

With the money from the loan she'll purchase beer, refreshments, meat, rice, chicken, and eggs for re-selling.

Her biggest dream is to build another grocery store in another venue, to pay for her children's education and to get a vehicle for using in her business.

Her challenge is paying for her children's school and keeping her business afloat so she can help her family.

loans.use: to purchase beer, refreshments, meat, rice, chicken, and eggs for re-selling.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A Virginia é solteira de 2  filhos uma maior de idade e todos vão a escola,vive em casa dos seus pais ,nao tem outras pessoas na sua responsabilidade.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar bolsas, cremes, perfumes e unhas de gel.
O seu sonho e esperança é ter negocio sustentavel, ter uma casa propria, pagar escola para os seus filhos e espandir os seus negocios cosntruir um salao de cabelereiro.
Ter recursos para construir uma casa propria para os seus filhos e um salao de cabeleiro é o seu maior desafio.
texts.en:
Virginia is single. She has two children and one of them is an adult daughter. All her children are in school. She lives with her parents and doesn't have anyone else under her responsibility.

With the money from the loan she'll purchase purses, lotions, perfumes and nail extensions.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a sustainable business, become a home owner, pay for her children's school and expand her business by building a hair salon.

Her biggest challenge is getting the resources for building a house for her children as well as a hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase purses, lotions, perfumes and nail extensions.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals.

Anne will use this 100,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 56-year-old married mother of one child. Twelve years ago, she decided to rely on herself and start her own business at her house selling homemade foods, to help her family and to improve her lifestyle.

Fatmeh is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy food provisions for her business in order to be able to give a very good quality of products. She is very happy and optimistic about her future and wishes to sell all her products.

loans.use: to buy food provisions for her business.

loans.name: David Bernardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive el señor David, tiene 48 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede salir adelante, el hace varios años aprendió belleza, actividad con la cual se gana la vida. 
Don David es una persona muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo obtener sus propios ingresos que le permiten ganarse la vida, hace varios años instalo en su casa un salón de belleza, allí el  realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Además también vende productos de belleza que el utiliza en sus trabajos o recomienda para el uso,  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar cosméticos, tintes y tratamientos para el cabello. Su sueño es tener un SPA.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches. The majority of inhabitants here are hard-working and work in activities related to the sea.

David lives in this place. He is 48 years old, single and lives in his parent's house. He has been in the communal bank for more than two years and he likes it, as thanks to the loans he can get ahead. A number of years ago he learned the beauty business which is how he makes his living.

David is a hard-working person who likes to make his own income from his efforts which allows him to make a living. He installed a beauty salon in his house a number of years ago. He does a variety of work here like dying, hair cuts and painting nails amongst other things. He works every day from 8 am until 5 pm and sometimes later if his clients require his services. He also sells the beauty products he uses in his work or recommends for use, which he does while he is doing his other work.

This loan will be used to buy cosmetics, dyes and hair treatments. His dream is to own a Spa.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dye and hair treatments.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking 43-year old married woman who earns a living growing rice. She has been engaged in rice farming for many years now, serving locals and town dwellers in her place. She has three children, ages 10, 14 and 16 years old respectively. Her husband is a laborer.

She is in need of additional funds to boost her livelihood. She joined Kiva's field partner CEVI to access loan to cater to her financial need.

Vicenta would like to have a bountiful harvest that could help augment her entire family's earnings. Thus, she could be able to save half of the of the profit for future use and the other half is for expansion. To meet this goal, Vicenta has requested a loan to invest in fertilizer.

She is hopeful that she could continue to improve her livelihood and also be able to send her children to school for their respective studies.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Esther cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Esther se dedica al servicio de peluquería, con una experiencia desde hace más de 20 años en el rubro. Adicionalmente los fines de semana vende alimentos preparados.Solicita préstamo para la compra de materiales de peluquería como tintes,bolsas,guantes,tijeras,entre otros,para surtir insumos y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Así como realizar otros gastos familiares. De esta manera atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Esther con experiencia crediticia, con pagos puntuales
texts.en:
Esther, 46 years old, is in a common law marriage. She lives in her own house with her spouse and their two children in the Zaña district in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru. Esther has very good references, as many personal as professional from habitants of the area. The residents of this town work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Esther works as a hairdresser, with more than 20 years of experience in the field. Additionally, on weekends she sells prepared foods. She is seeking a loan to buy hairdressing materials like dyes, bags, gloves, scissors, and other items to stock supplies and offer a better service, as well as carry out other household expenses. In this way she will take care of the unsatisfied demand in the area and increase her list of customers, counting on new customers and additional income for her family.

Esther has credit experience, with punctual payments.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing materials like dyes, bags, gloves, scissors, and other items to stock supplies.

loans.name: Lavinia De Jesus

texts.es:
Lavinia, es una mujer que vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo, junto a su familia tienen 2 años de residir en su localidad, ella se dedica a la venta de tablilla y horchata, mientras que su compañero de vida se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos; aprendió este trabajo gracias a capacitaciones que fueron impartidas por una ONG, dirigidas específicamente a mujeres, en su negocio cuenta  con equipo que le permite empacar y elaborar viñetas con su marca, para luego poder comercializar el producto de una forma más estético.
Ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como lo es semilla de cacao, semilla de morro, arroz, canela, etc., de esa  manera poder elaborar el producto y comercializarlo para obtener ganancias para ella y su familia, Lavinia pretende realizar abundante mercadería para que su compañero de vida se dedique a comercializarlo en los alrededores.
Como toda mujer emprendedora Lavinia sueña con poder tener su propia empresa de horchata y tablilla con su propia marca registrada, para poder pagar sus deudas y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Lavinia is a woman who lives with her husband and son. The families has lived in this home for 2 years. She sells tablilla (candy) and horchata (sweet rice drink); her husband sells plastic products. She learned this work thanks to the trainings provided by the ONG, trainings specifically targeted to women. In her business she has the equipment to package and make food under her brand, to then sell her product in an aesthetically pleasing way.

She seeks a loan to be able to invest in purchasing ingredients such as cacao seed, rice, cinnamon, beans, etc. and in this way be able to make and sell her product in order to obtain income for her and her family. Lavinia wants to have an abundance of merchandise for her husband to sell in the surrounding area. As any enterprising woman, Lavinia dreams of being able to have her own business selling horchata and tablilla with her own registered trademark, and to be able to pay her debts and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cacao seed, rice, cinnamon, beans, etc. and in this way be able to make and sell her product.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a trader who sells mobile credit cards at Pokuasi in Accra. He started this business a year ago, but the clients are requesting the service of mobile money transfer in the community where he operates the mobile credit service, which is a suburban area.

He does not have enough to register for that service, so this loan will help him to register for the mobile money services and buy more mobile credit cards to resell to the residents, to meet the demand of his clients.

Jacob’s future plan is to open more merchant branches of the mobile credit card services and the mobile money transfer services in other parts of Pokuasi. Jacob describes himself as having good customer relations with his clients and also as a hardworking young man.

loans.use: to register for providing mobile money transfer services and to buy more mobile credit cards to resell

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Sauda is a single woman in her late 20s with two school-aged children. She has been a food vendor for two years and works from 6am to 4pm daily . She makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Sauda's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Sauda will share this loan with her loan group Mshikamano which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Zawadi Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Zuwena is a divorced woman with one son, he attends school. She has operated a grocery store for three years She works from 7am to 11pm daily and makes a fair profit each month.

This will be Zuwena's first loan From Tujijenge Tanzania. Zuwena will use this loan to buy soft drinks, spirits, and beer at wholesale prices.

She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer needs.

Zuwena will share this loan with her 2-member loan group Zawadi Kigogo. They hold each accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, spirits, and beer at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, who is in her early 40s, is married with one school-aged child. She has been running a grocery store for five years. She works from 8 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Naomi's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of drinks and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best-selling drinks, including spirits. She dreams of selling her products at wholesale prices.

Naomi will make sure she pays back her loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy the best-selling drinks, including spirits.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 33-year-old man. He is married to a loving wife and along with her he has been blessed with 3 kids. He has an 18-year-old son, an 8-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old boy. He lives very happily with his family, and works hard every day in order to provide for them.

Edgar works as a handy man. He does different kinds of jobs in construction, mostly electric installations, plumbing maintenance and other services. He has been in this line of work for 15 years, give or take. Edgar says that everything that he does is to move his family ahead and be able to provide them with a brighter future.

This won't be his first loan at Kiva through Kubo. He has had one previously and is almost done with it. He has been repaying his loan without trouble.

Edgar is now looking for a new loan in order to buy some electric equipment, which will allow him to perform in a better way at his work. He needs 10,000.00 MXN to buy all the stuff required. Edgar is an entrusted Kubo client, because he has been handling his loans well, and his wife also has a loan at Kubo.

loans.use: to buy machine tools for his job in construction.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Iloilo and other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines are undergoing continuous rehabilitation from the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan two years ago. Businesses are regaining their stability and entrepreneurs renew their strength.

Helen is one of those entrepreneurs who rose above the difficult situation after the typhoon. She successfully revived her variety store business. Little by little she resumed the buying and selling of usual commodities like toiletries, canned goods, snacks items, beverages, gallons of mineral water, and others. She’s a 47-year-old single woman but she is supporting a close relative’s college expenses. She doesn’t want to work for herself alone, and it’s her pledge to help others in need, especially her beloved relatives.

Now that Helen is continuing to develop her variety store business, she has applied for PHP 25,000 loan to buy additional dry goods, beverages, and load wallets for cellphone load retailing. She anticipates an increase in her sales and profit from these additional supplies. She hopes that she can continue supporting the college expenses of her close relative to pave the way for a more comfortable life in the future.

Helen is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods, beverages, and load wallets for cellphone load retailing.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José is 62 years old, married and has 4 children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangos.

Jose needs US$ 1200 as a loan to buy tools and manure for the fields and to increase the production of organic mangos. With the income, he will improve his children's education by studying computing.

loans.use: to buy tools and manure for organic mango production.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 20-year-old, married woman from Lebanon living with her husband, who represents the main income source in the family and works very hard to always be able to fulfill the family needs and to live a good lifestyle.

In order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that her target is to achieve higher positions and be able to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 47 anos de idade com 3 filhas maiores de idade mas ainda na sua reponsabilidade, cuida tambem de 1 neta. Todas as filhas estão a estudar, uma delas numa formação profissional. Ela vive na casa propria a base de nogocio de venda de produtos alimentares e bebidas num estabelecimento dentro do mercado a mais de 20 anos sendo sua única fonte de renda.  Está a repetir o credito pela quinta vez, com os anteriores investiu sempre no negocio, no sustento dos estudos das filhas e na aquisicao de bens para sua casa.
Com o actual pretende comprar mercadoria para reforcar o seu negocio tal como, bebidas alcoolicas, doces, refrescos,sumos,farinha de milho, frangos e diversos artigos para confecionar refeições.
Seu maior sonho e continuar a mobilar sua casa, desenvolver mais seu negocio e construir dependências para alugar.
Sua dificuldade consiste no facto de as vezes o negocio não lhe sair muito bem devido a concorrência, contudo, se sente feliz com a Hluvuku pois lhe tem ajudado a tornar possivel parte dos seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 47-year-old single mother. She has three daughters who are adults but still under her responsibility. She also takes care of a granddaughter. All her daughters are in school, one of them being in vocational school. She lives in a house that she owns. She earns a living from her business selling foodstuffs and beverages at a store in the market. She's been in this line of work for over 20 years and it's her only means of livelihood. This is her 5th loan. The previous loans were invested in her business, in her daughters' education and the acquisition of goods for her house.

With the current loan she intends to purchase merchandise to boost her business such as alcoholic beverages, sweets, juice, cornflour, chicken and various supplies for making meals.

Her biggest dream is to keep on furnishing her home, develop her business further and build rooms for renting out.

Her struggle is the fact that her business doesn't always do so well due to the competition. However, she's happy with Hluvuku because they have helped her to accomplish part of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic beverages, sweets, refreshments, juice, cornflour and chicken.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina, a 28-year-old, married woman, is from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband, who is an artisan and gets a fixed income. Irina had a great desire to generate her own income and rented a place where she started a trading business with clothing.

Now, she needs financial support to purchase stock of additional clothing and to have money for working capital to continue running her business.

Irina has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With the loan, Irina will satisfy all her customers' needs and make her business more profitable.

The loan will greatly assist Irina, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and develop her lovely business. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to have money for working capital for clothing sales.

loans.name: Merly Virginia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Merly, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y está en su octavo mes de embarazo. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Merly es una mujer que le gusta ganar sus propios recursos realizando una labor que le encanta, ella junto al marido se dedican a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo, su  forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ellos salen a vender por toda la ciudad y no cuentan con horarios fijos sino que salen cuando pueden, actualmente ella no sale mucho por su estado de embarazo pero si vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda,  por lo general siempre les gusta vender la mercadería que este de temporada ya que es la que se vende más rápido y mejoran sus ganancias. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad pero su marido mucho más tiempo.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior y otras prendas. Tiene cuatro ciclos en el grupo de crédito, le gusta porque los  créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda para ella. Su sueño es tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
The Urb. Las Viviendas credit group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo canton. It is known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents here are very hardworking and in fishing activities.

This is where Merly lies. She is 20 years old and in a common law marriage. She is in her eighth month of pregnancy. Her husband is a merchant.

Merly is a woman who likes to earn her own money doing work she lives. She and her husband sell all kinds of clothing door to door. They go out to sell throughout the whole city. They don't have set schedules but go out whenever they can. Right now, she doesn't go out a lot because of her pregnancy but she does sell from her home, where people go when they need some clothing. In general, she likes to sell merchandise in season because it sells the fastest and her profits improve. She has been doing this activity for a year, but her husband has been doing it for much longer.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, underwear and other items of clothing. She has been in the credit group for four cycles. She likes it because the loans are fast and they help her a lot. Her dream is to have her baby.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, underwear and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.pt:
Tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 4 filhos 2 dos quais já trabalham e vivem na vizinha africa do sul. Vive com os restantes 2 onde 1 já tem esposa e filho ainda a viver com ela. Vive a base de negocio de venda de roupas compradas na africa do sul por encomendas e num regime ambulatório. Está a repetir o credito pela segunda vez e com o primeiro investiu na compra de mercadoria e conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador por conta propria.
Pretende reforçar o seu negocio comprando- lençois, cortinas, mantas, etc.
Seu maior sonho e desenvolver mais o seu negócio e diversificar e no futuro adquirir uma viatura.
Queixa-se apenas do custo de vida e do negocio que nem sempre sai tal como ela espera.
texts.en:
Nelita is 47 years old and in a common law marriage. She has four children, two of whom are already in the workforce and live in neighboring South Africa. She lives with her other two children, one of whom has a wife and a son and they live with her. She earns a livelihood from her clothing sales business. She buys the clothing in South Africa and sells them by order and on a door-to-door basis. This is her second loan and the first loan was used for buying merchandise. She gets help from her husband who's self-employed.

She intends to boost her business by purchasing sheets, curtains, blankets, etc.

Her biggest dream is to further develop and diversify her business, and someday purchase a vehicle.

Her only complaints are the cost of living and the business that doesn't always turn out as she would have hoped.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, curtains and blankets.

loans.name: Gloria Geoconda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Urb. Las Viviendas se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo,  este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12,  y 7  años de edad, los mismos que estudian en  colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Gloria es una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente y trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días a visitar a sus clientes frecuentes a quienes les  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Parte de este crédito es para que su marido lo utilice en la pesca, el sale a pescar por dos o tres días y requiere de materiales para realizar una buena faena. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo, redes, piolas y otros materiales de pesca. Lleva 5  ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The "Urb. Las Viviendas" Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo Canton, an area known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents here are very hardworking fishermen.

Señora Gloria, age 39, lives here. She is married, and she has three children from this relationship. They are 15, 12, and 7 years old, and studying in high school and grade school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doña Gloria is a woman who has always liked feeling independent and working for the good of her family. She has a business selling all kinds of clothing door to door. She goes out almost every day to visit her frequent customers, to whom she gives credit, and she collects every 8 days.

Her husband will use part of this loan for fishing; he goes out to fish for two or three days, and he needs materials in order to achieve a good catch.

She is going to use this loan to purchase all kinds of clothing, nets, twine, and other fishing materials. She has been in the credit group for five cycles, and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide for her. Here dream is that her children may have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, nets, twine, and fishing materials.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en:
Vagharshak is engaged in the purchase and sale of housing products about 5 years. Using his friend's car, Vagharshak goes to a neighbouring country, purchase variety of products and then resells it in his local Lori region. He lives with his wife and their two school aged children, and this retail business is the only source of family's income.

He asks lenders to help him to pay for a car for delivering products so Vagharshak will be able to reach large markets. This will be great opportunity for Vagharshak's business and he hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a car for delivering products so Vagharshak will be able to reach large markets

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 54 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Wilfreda works very hard to provide for them.

Wilfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, rice, spices, home product care, and other groceries.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Wilfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, rice, spices, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Gitfy

texts.en:
Gitfy is a woman to admire: a humble but hard-working person who began her knitting threads business. With perseverance, respect, and observance of her delivery tiimes, she has established herself at her residence. She now enjoys a good volume of work and even managed to buy a machine for faster delivery of work done and create an employment opportunity.

Gitfy takes pleasure in saving; she likes to keep her accounts up to date. She is single living in her own residence within the locality of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana.
Currently she needs some financial support to buy more zips,knitting threads, buttons and materials for a faster delivery of goods for much income yield.

loans.use: to buy more zips, knitting threads, buttons and materials for a faster delivery of goods for much income yield.   .

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleak’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreyleak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer taxi driver and chef to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 37- year old married woman, she belongs to the poor family and living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories door and windows which usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld the broken accessories. Few days ago his welding plant has become out of order due to overheating and need to be repair. He wants to buy iron's raw material for manufacturing but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses.

Therefore, Fozia requested a loan from BRAC which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy more raw materials for manufacturing. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy raw material for the manufacturing of iron accessories door and windows

loans.name: Sadhana's Group

texts.en:
Sadhana is a humble and a charming lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a village of Umerkote district, Odisha, India.The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. As a concerned lady, she has always tried to build a toilet in her house but unfortunately she couldn't, due to lack of financial resources.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.The amount that she will save, she will use in renovating her house in the future to increase her safety.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savin works as factory laborer and she also does extra work as seller and teacher to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Jalafa, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children, two of them are is school and one is still young. He has been selling charcoal since 2004. He works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increase the charcoal and has managed to pay back all his loans. He is really happy with the loan which has changed her life style. He is taking his kids to fair schools and can maintain his family house hold expenses.He used the profit to pay school fees for his kids, to repay loan, bought two motorcycles, built his own house, bought a TV set, a radio and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resale at whole sale price and well as retail price. He dreams of extending his business.

Jalafa will share this loan with his loan group Mt Usambara which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resale at wholesale price and well as retail price.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, nuevamente solicita un crédito, pues tiene la necesita de invertir en la agricultura, le será de ayuda para realizar la compra de abono e insecticidas, ya que realizara la siembra de hortalizas, su finalidad es aprovechar lo que queda del invierno para tener cosechas más abundantes. 
Hoy en día  vive con las bajo las mismas condiciones económicas que se encontraba anteriormente, con la diferencia que su grupo familiar ha disminuido, pero de igual manera considera que con los créditos le están permitiendo disminuir sus deudas y darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is applying for another loan because he needs to invest in agriculture. This will help him to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his vegetable crops. His goal is to take advantage of the rest of the winter to have a more abundant harvest.

Today, Rafael is still living under the same conditions as before, but his family unit has decreased. In any case, he believes that the loans are allowing him to cancel his debt and give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer from Marmara village. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs. Rahila will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling her to delay its sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rahila no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Rahila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kakali's Group

texts.en:
Kakali is 41 years old and is a hard-working woman, standing to the lefthand side in the photograph. She always looks for alternatives that will allow her to grow financially. She is from a remote village in Umerkote, Odisha, India. She is married and blessed with one son who reads in class 10. Her husband works in a brick kiln.

For the past several years, she has worked in the field of sewing, a skill that she learned by observation and that little by little she has been perfecting, and she has been expanding her knowledge through practice.

She stiches pants, shirts, trousers, petticoats, etc., in accordance with the order of her customs in her neighbourhood.

She, along with her group member, is asking for a loan for 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new sewing machine in order to strengthen her work, since with the money she will buy a specialized sewing machine, which will make her work more rapidly and facilitate production and the acquisition of more contracts, thus generating more income.

Kakali states that her greatest challenge is competition in the market. However, this keeps her motivated to offer better service and to struggle so that her dream of having an accredited business will become a reality, and that will generate more income. In this way she will improve her quality of life.

She is motivated to open her own shop, for which she prepared a space in her home. She hopes it will be possible in the future. Kakali thanks her lenders for their financial help.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in order to strengthen her work

loans.name: Grupo Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Antonia (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía)  es una joven que todos los días se esmera para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, ella desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles típicos, pero con estos ingresos no es suficiente por esa razón también cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de verduras.
Antonia por sus años de experiencia mucha gente la busca y requiere de sus servicios y ella con el afán de mejorar su calidad de tejido ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina.
Con esta inversión ella espera mejorar su calidad de ingresos y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia, 21, lives with her parents and siblings in a community in Sololá.

Antonia, who is first from the left in the photo, works hard every day to ensure that her family lacks for nothing. For ten years, she has been making traditional blouses. However, this does not bring in sufficient earnings, so she also has a business buying and selling vegetables.

Due to Antonia's years of experience, many people search her out and ask for her services. In an effort to improve her fabric quality, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy silk and synthetic thread and embroidery floss.

With this investment, she hopes to improve the quality of her earnings and continue to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy silk and synthetic thread and embroidery floss.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a woman in her early fifties. She is happily married to a loving husband named Jose and they have been married for a long time. They have children, but their kids have found their own ways to become grown up adults, so Martha and Jose only need to provide for each other.

In order to make a living, they both work at the market. Jose has a business of his own, but often helps Martha with her business, which is a grocery store that has a vast variety of products to sell. Martha sells food, groceries and some medical supplies.

Although Martha offers a great number of products, she has been struggling to meet client demand because lately she has been lacking some products on her inventory.

She is looking to buy as many products as possible with the lowest amount of money. In order to achieve this, she is looking for promotions and special sales, and she wants to be ready to buy if the opportunity presents itself.

Therefore, she is asking for a 15,790 MXN loan, which would allow her to buy supplies when the time comes.

Here, Martha is pictured along with her husband, Jose.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Eduardo Salomon

texts.es:
Eduardo con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Eduardo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Eduardo se dedica a prestar servicio mecánico de motos, mantenimiento,soldadura y pintura, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 02 años en zona de residencia.Además cuenta con venta de repuestos para motos. Solicita préstamo para la compra de repuestos para motos. De esta manera le facilitará obtener ingresos adicionales.

Eduardo si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 40, is in a live-in relationship. He lives with his partner and his son in the district of Cayaltí, which belongs to the Chiclayo province in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. Eduardo has very good personal and professional references from inhabitants of his area. The people in this area mainly work in farming, trade, and livestock.

Eduardo provides mechanic services for motorcycles as well as maintenance, welding and paint. He has two years of experience in this field in a residential area. He also sells spare parts for motorcycles. He is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles. In this way, he will be able to earn an additional income.

Eduardo has experience with loans, and he is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Jhovanna

texts.es: La señora Jhovanna se dedica a la venta de comida rápida vendiendo hamburguesas lomitos y milanesas  es de condición humilde trabajadora y emprendedora solo curso hasta el bachillerato por razones económicas y por no tener apoyo de sus padres no pudo entrar a la universidad pero se esforzó mucho y estudio una carrera técnica se recibió como técnico en  peluquería y cosmetología  hoy requiere el préstamo para poner su  propia peluquería y ejercer su profesión ya que por escases de dinero no pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para la colocación de dicho negocio la Sra. Jhovanna es madre soltera tiene una hija pequeña no tiene el apoyo del  padre  de su hija ya que desde muy pequeña las abandonó y ella sola tuvo que salir adelante, comenta que le fue muy difícil trabajar y estudiar  al mismo tiempo, ya que su hija era muy pequeña su sueño es tener su peluquería ejercer su profesión y así tener más tiempo para apoyar a su pequeña en el estudio  ya que para el año su hija entrara a la primaria y necesitara el apoyo más de su madre ella comenta que ya tiene clientes a quienes le hace trabajos de peluquería y cosmetología a domicilio y le animan a tener su propio salón es por esta razón  se decidió a emprender un nuevo reto, solo necesita los muebles e insumos y herramientas de trabajo necesarias para poder empezar a trabajar en su propio  negocio y hacer lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Jhovanna sells fast food. She sells hamburgers, lomitos, and Wiener schnitzel. She is a humble, hardworking businesswoman. She only studied until high school because of financial reasons. Because she did not have support from her parents she could not enroll in university but she put forth great effort and studied for a technical career as a hairdresser and cosmetologist.

Today she needs a loan to open her own beauty salon to exercise her profession and she does not have enough money to buy the necessary supplies to allocate them to her salon business.

Jhovanna is a single mother. She has a young daughter. She does not have the support from the father of her daughter as he abandoned them when she was very small and only she has brought her up. She says that it was very difficult to work and study at the same time since her daughter was very young.

Her dream is to have her own hairdressing salon and thus to have more time to support her little one in her studies for the year her daughter enters primary school and needs more support from her mother. She comments that she already has customers who come to her home for hairdressing and cosmetology and they encourage her to have her own salon. This is why she decided to undertake a new challenge. She only needs the necessary furniture, supplies, and tools of the trade in order to start working in her own business and do what she most enjoys.

loans.use: to buy furniture and supplies for her beauty salon so that she can serve her customers and generate income to support her daughter

loans.name: Marta Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Marta, es madre, vive en casa propia junto a ella sus tres hijos y su abuela, todos ellos dependen económicamente de ella, se dedica a atender su negocio que consiste en una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad y además ofrece variedad de quesos, ella manifiesta que empezó con este negocio cuando perdió su empleo y se vio en la necesidad de suplir las necesidades de su grupo familiar, hizo su apertura con capital propio y posteriormente obtuvo créditos para poderlo abastecer un poco más, su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: bebidas, boquitas, azúcar, granos básicos, etc., por mayor, ya que en cantidades grandes se la dan a mejor precio por lo tanto las ganancias obtenidas son mejores.
Marta cuenta con muchos sueños, pero uno de ellos es poder obtener buenas ganancias, pagar sus deudas y poder seguir supliendo las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a mother who lives in her own house with her three children and her grandmother. All of them depend on her financially. She works in her business, a store selling basic necessities. She also offers a variety of cheese. She started this business when she lost her job and needed to cover the needs of her family. She opened the business with her own capital, and later she obtained loans to further stock it. Her work schedule is from 7:00am until 5:00pm.

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise, such as wholesale drinks, snacks, sugar, basic grains, etc. The prices are better for large quantities, so the profits are also higher.

Marta has many dreams, but one of them is to obtain good earnings to pay off her debts and continue providing her family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as wholesale drinks, snacks, sugar, basic grains, etc., since the prices are better for high quantities.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
María Matilde con 34 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera,vive junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.María Matilde cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Matilde se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como palana, bicicleta, pico y oz; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa mejorar su productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

María Matilde es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido cuatro créditos de S/.3400,00; S/.1500,00; S/.2000,00 y S/.2501,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
María Matilde, 34, is a single mother. She lives with her two children in the district of Oyotún, which belongs to the Chiclayo province in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. It is a rural area. María Matilde has very good personal and professional references. The inhabitants of this area mainly work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

María Matilde offers services as a day laborer. She has her own tools, such as a spade, a bicycle, a pickaxe, and a sickle. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. Her business is located in her home. She is applying for a loan for home repairs and to maintain her equipment and tools. This investment will help her to keep her equipment and tools in better condition, which will have a strong influence on her business. She hopes to improve her productivity in her services, thereby attending to the various needs of the area's inhabitants.

María Matilde is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had four loans of 3400, 1500, 2000, and 2501 Peruvian nuevo soles, which she paid back on time. Since she became a member, her business has improved along with her quality of life.

loans.use: with home repairs and to maintain her equipment and tools.

loans.name: Lazaro Jose

texts.en:
Lazaro is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He has 3 children whom he loves with all his heart; a son who is 18, and 2 daughters who are 15 and 16 years of age. For many years he has been working hard to provide for his family, but this year he decided to start his own business in order to improve his family's quality of life.

He’s going to start raising pigs to sell. His household finances haven’t been doing well, so he made this decision because he wants to give his family the best life he can. He expects that with his new business, he can increase his profits. He’s a very responsible man who needs a loan so he can start his business by buying some pigs that he can raise.

Lazaro is a great father and husband who always thinks of his family, because he wants them to be happy and proud of him. He dreams of improving the conditions of the house where they all live. You can be part of this story by helping Lazaro with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to start his business by buying some pigs that he can raise.

loans.name: Matai's Group

texts.en:
Matai is a humble lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Umerkote, Odisha, India. She has a joint family and resides with her husband and in-laws.

Matai is a farmer by profession and sells milk in her locality in order to sustain her livelihood.
