The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and clean toilet

loans.name: Shyambati's Group

texts.en:
Shyambati is a 48-year-old simple lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a remote village of Umerkote, Odisha, India. She has a joint family and they have access to very limited resources as her household income is very low.

They do not have an appropriate toilet facility at their home, and for this reason they face numerous problems, as they have to walk long distances to dense forests and bushes for relieving themselves. The women are more vulnerable to crimes and insects and animal bites and these unsanitary practices may cause them serious infections.

So, in order to avoid these problems, Shyambati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house and install a commode, shower, and other necessary sanitary fittings with it.

Your loan will help this family enjoy a good health and thereby promote cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet in her house and install a commode, shower, and other necessary sanitary fittings with it.

loans.name: Jayabati's Group

texts.en:
Don't be surprised if a pair of goats greet you on entering Jayabati's house. The resident of Umerkote, a village in Orissa, rears goats for a living. Her income from the home-run business has helped continue the education of her two children and manage the household which had earlier been run on the sole income of her husband, a labourer in the village.

Having run a steady business in the area, catering to local customers and shops, Jayabati wants to increase her income in the forthcoming days. She, along with her group member, has sought a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in goat kids. She will raise them and trade them when they are grown up at higher prices.

She aspires to build a new furnished house in the near future where she can lead a comfortable and happy life. Jayabati is the lady standing to the right hand side of the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase more goat kids

loans.name: Nelson Libardo

texts.en:
Nelson is 48 years old and is married to a woman who he’s loved for many years. He has a daughter with her who is 21 years old, and lives with his family in the municipality of Santa Rosa de Osos. He created his own business 14 years ago; he has a fruit and vegetable selling place, where he works 8 hours a day, every day, so he can provide a good quality of life for his family.

He’s always thinking of different ways to improve his business and make it better. The reason why he wants to invest in it is in order to improve his sales, and through that increase his clients as well. He´s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs like fruits and vegetables for his business.

Nelson has big dreams, especially regarding his family, the most important thing in his life. He wishes to fix some problems that his house has so his family can live more comfortably and safely. You can help Nelson with the loan he needs and get him closer to accomplishing his dreams.

loans.use: to buy inputs like fruits and vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Luis Hernando

texts.en:
Luis is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa de Osos. He has 2 sons who are 11 and 14 years of age, and since they were born, they have become the reason for Luis’s life. All of his life he has been a hard worker and a responsible man, something he learned from his family. In 1979 he started a bakery, in which he’s been working for more than 30 years.

This business has allowed him to provide for his family all of these years, to give them the life he wants them to have, and his children admire him for that and for how great a father he is. Now he wants to take his business to the next level by increasing his clients, which is the reason why he´s asking for a loan to buy inputs for his bakery.

Luis dreams of seeing his bakery as the most famous and visited one in his municipality, where he can create jobs for more people. He also wants to improve his house. Be part of this beautiful dream by helping Luis with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his bakery.

loans.name: Rober Raul

texts.en:
Rober, 44 years old, lives in the municipality of Cotorra. He has three beautiful daughters who are 8, 16 and 20 years of age. He loves them very much because they changed his life for good, making him a better man, something that he treasures. Now, as a responsible father, Rober is looking for ways to give them a better life, so he decided to start his own business.

In the municipality where Rober lives, there’s not a butcher shop as such, but it’s really common that people buy pigs and sell their meat, and that’s exactly what Rober is going to do, hoping he can make good profit from it. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy the meat that he needs to start selling and to start his business.

Rober has a lot of hope in this new business that he's about to begin, something that he expects will let him provide for his family and, maybe, to fix the damages that his house has right now. Support this man in the creation of his new business with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy a pig for the meat that he needs to start selling and to start his business.

loans.name: Livis Elena

texts.en:
Livis, 25 years old, lives in the municipality of Tierralta. She has four sons who are everything for her, the reasons she wants to succeed in life and to accomplish great things. Her family is going through a rough time, economically speaking, so Livis wants to start her own business, to provide for her family.

Livis decided to start a business raising pigs and she’s hoping that it will give her the right amount of profit to provide her family with a good quality of life. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have the capital to start the business so she’s asking for a little help through a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up.

Livis has many dreams, but one of them is to see her business succeed, something she’s willing to work hard to accomplish. She also would like to improve the condition of her house so everybody can live better. You can help Livis to accomplish all her dreams and to become a great entrepreneur; a loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a woman in her early 20's. She lives with her parents and has neither children nor husband. She is currently studying at a local university and managing a clothing boutique, where she sells clothes for both men and women. She has been developing this project on her own and she has been successful.

Kubo financiano looks up to her because she is very young, yet she has a profitable business and she is also a job source for other people.

Leticia has been doing so well that now she is looking to open a new store at a different location. She has made a huge investment to achieve this goal, but lately she has been running short on money so that she has not been able to invest in the new place.

She is looking for a 5,000 MXN loan that will allow her to finish with all the small details that her new establishment is missing. Her biggest short term goal is to open this new boutique, and she is really close to achieving it. Her long term goal is to own a franchise of cloth-selling shops created by her.

Leticia is pictured with a client at her store.

loans.use: To open a new boutique.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is not new to the Fresh Life franchise, he launched one Fresh Life Toilet in March this year at his restaurant and bar business.

As he says, having the facility has been very fruitful. "Generally cleanliness has reigned at this premises," he says.

Further more, Kennedy enjoys serving more customers than he ever did a while back owing to poor sanitation.

However, with many customers visiting, one Fresh Life Toilet is currently insufficient.

Kennedy's goal is to maintain consistency in serving his customers and as such he currently wants to install one extra Fresh Life Toilet.

Let us help him in acquiring the facility.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Ledenia

texts.en: Early this year, Ledenia and her husband engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They live in Concepcion, Iloilo, where most people in the community are involved in this livelihood. They work hard in doing this business to provide and support the needs of their three children, aged 15, 12 and 9 years old. They want to enhance their catch to have enough money to send their children to school. To reach this goal, they need our help. They want to take out a loan to help them buy a fishing net that will help them enhance their catch.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Iris Yomaira

texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Tierralta. She has six children, three daughters and three sons, a big family that she started when she was really young but that she loves and feels proud of because they make her happy and push her to be better every day. A big family is a huge responsibility, so Iris is taking action in order to give her family what they need to have a good life.

Iris is going to start selling clothes and accessories, but the inventory can get a little expensive, and right now she doesn’t have the money to buy them. She´s determined to work hard to make good profits from her new business, so she’s asking for a loan to buy clothes and accessories to start her business with the right amount of products.

Iris dreams big and hopes to take her business to a good level where it becomes recognized and successful. She also wants to improve her house so her family can be more comfortable. You can be part of the story of this beautiful family; a loan can change many of their lives.

loans.use: to  buy clothes and accessories to start her business with the right amount of products.

loans.name: Gulbarkhon

texts.ru:
Гулбархон молодая и жизнерадостная женщина 29 лет.  Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Гулбархон живёт в сельской местности. У неё высшее образование. Она работает учительницей в сельской школе. Но зарплата, которую она получает, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. Поэтому вместе с мужем они имеют дополнительный бизнес. Её муж помогает ей в животноводстве. У неё очень дружная семья.
Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей.  В данное время Гулбархон вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Гулбархон обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома.
texts.en:
Gulbarkhon is a young and cheerful woman of 29 years old. She is married and has four children. With her family she lives in the countryside. She has completed higher education and works as a teacher in a local village school. Her salary, though, is not enough to provide for the family, which is why her husband and she have a business on the side. Her husband helps Gulbarkhon to breed livestock. They have a very United family.

Gulbarkhon and her husband love their kids very much and they try their best to give them an education as they want their kids to become well-educated people. Currently, Gulbarkhon and her husband Want to renovate the house they live in to improve their living conditions, but their own funds are not enough. That's why Gulbarkhon turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to buy construction materials to renovate their house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
35 ans, Brigitte est mariée, et son mari est maçon tâcheron. Le couple est parent de trois adorables enfants âgés de 5 à 13 ans. Ils sont tous scolarisés. 
Elle vend des œufs de poulets depuis 2004, et elle exerce d'autres activités: élevages et cultures pour augmenter le revenu. Elle souhaite ouvrir un autre point de vente à proximité de ses clients pour diminuer les frais de déplacement en faisant les livraison mais aussi pour gagner du temps.
Son objectif est de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants les meilleures scolarisations possibles pour qu'ils réussissent dans leurs études et auront des bonnes carrières.
texts.en:
Brigitte is a thirty-five year-old married woman. Her husband is a masonry worker. Together, they have three adorable children between the ages of five and thirteen. All of them go to school.

She has been selling chicken eggs since 2004; she also farms other animals and plants to increase her revenues. She wants to open a new point of sale closer to her clients to decrease transportation fees and save time on deliveries.

Her objective is to be able to give her children the best possible schooling so that they can study successfully and have good careers.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicken eggs.

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.en:
The three women in this group live in Santiago Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. They are hardworking women ranging in age from 27 to 65 years. One has a high school education and two went to school for six years.

One woman cooks and serves lunches and dreams of having a small restaurant. Another makes and sells mid-morning snacks and wants to expand to do this daily. One sells second hand clothing and wants to increase the number of items she sells.

These women are starting their second nine-month cycle with Namaste. They were happy with their first nine-month cycle as they learned important finance and business basics, such as keeping records of their sales and expenses.

They also had a Business Advisor who helped them write a business plan and then visited with each of them every month to provide advice on growing her business.

Now, they look forward to nine additional months of more advanced learning, and each of them is eager to continue learning how to better manage her business and increase her profits.

Doña Gerardina is 57 years old, and has a sixth grade education. She is married and her children are already out on their own. Her husband is retired and helps her with her work.

Her business is cooking lunches daily that she sells in her home. Customers like her food and hospitality and her lunches are popular.

During her first nine months with Namaste she learned to control her costs and manage her money. She also added new menu items and started producing weekly menus so her customers had different choices on different days.

She will invest her loan in a mixer, a coffee machine and vegetables and meat for her lunches. Her dream is to someday have a small restaurant where she can serve food all day.

When she started with Namaste she had a monthly cash flow of 2,190 Guatemalan Quetzales. At the end of nine months her cash flow was Q. 5,030. During this second cycle she and her Business Advisor are projecting a 22% increase in sales.

loans.use: buy a mixer, a coffee machine and vegetables and meat for her lunches.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 60, is from the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has eleven children: nine adults and two school-aged children. Respectfully, her husband is a fisherman, and she helps him in this business. They have been doing this since they began their married life.

Apart from this, Lucia is focusing on her business selling dried fish, which she has been doing for six years. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. She needs an amount of 6,000 Philippine pesos as additional capital for her dried fish business. In the future, she wishes to improve her business for her children. She wants them to finish a degree.

loans.use: to invest additional capital in her dried fish business.

loans.name: Redgie

texts.en:
Redgie is a fisherman and a fish dealer. In spite of the obstacles that he encountered being a fisherman, he was still determined to rise up and to dream big for his family. Redgie successfully started dealing in fish a few months ago. He was determined to start this business, hoping for a high profit to give better lives to his children. Redgie and his wife have two young children, ages 9 and 3.

Redgie is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell. He also wishes to buy additional fishing nets. In the future, Redgie aims to be a successful fish dealer. All of this is for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-years old married woman and mother of five children. Her financially condition is not good. Her husband has been driving a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is being drive over local roads and for small distances. Its body made by polyester which is not enough strong to bear jerks over roads. Now the rickshaw body is need to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason her husband wants to buy a new body for Moto Rickshaw.

Shazia requested a loan so that her husband can buy the rickshaw body so that he could drive it smoothly.

Shazia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a loading rickshaw for her husband	.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is very thankful to Kiva for her previous loan of PHP 30,000 granted to her, which she used to buy twenty boxes each of noodles, biscuits, coffee, and canned goods, as well as bottled goods and other grocery items. Her stock has increased and she is now delivering her goods to her customers. Nora's income also increased and the revenue helped a lot for her children's school expenses. Nora is now venturing into selling rice.

Nora is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy twenty sacks of rice to sell as wholesale and retail in her store. The additional capital will enable her to expand her business to increase her income to provide comfortably for her family and for the continuing support of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell as wholesale and retail in her store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
For the past three years, Rosalie and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business, like most people in the community of Concepcion, Iloilo. Rosalie is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets in order to enhance their catch.

Rosalie is 41 years old and the mother of a 14-year-old girl. Rosalie’s main goal in life is to be a successful individual. She wants to have a better means of living and to give a good life to her daughter. With our help, this woman can possibly reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila and her husband are engaged in the fishing business, like most people in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her family live in the town of Concepcion. They have raised their children for six years with fishing as their source of livelihood. Their children are eight, six and four years old and are still needing their support.

Mila is asking for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to buy a new boat engine. Her goal in life is to increase their income to have enough money to send her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a butcher from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. This has been his source of income for nine years. He is also a father to a six-year-old son. In addition to his work as a butcher, Felix sells barbecue, mostly in the evenings.

To better perform his job as a butcher, he needs proper gear and clothing to observe a proper dress code in his work. He is asking for a loan to buy a knife, boots, rope and ingredients for barbecuing, such as meat, seasoning and cooking oil. Felix dreams of sending his son to school someday.

loans.use: to buy a knife, boots, rope and ingredients for barbecuing, such as meat, seasoning and cooking oil.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en: Relinda is a 66-year-old woman and a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. Like the other people in her community, Relinda and her family are engaged in a fishing business. Relinda's husband is a fisherman and she helps him in doing this livelihood. It has been their source of income for six years. To enhance their catch, Relinda wishes to buy new fishing nets and is asking for a larger loan to help them improve their earnings. Relinda also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business, and some of the money she is requesting is for her store.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Ryann

texts.en: Early this year, Ryann started his fishing business to earn a living. He is doing this to raise his family. He is a 34-year-old man and has two young children who are six and two years old. Ryann is asking for a loan to help him enhance his catch.  Since he just started this business, he is in need of a bigger amount of loan to buy fishing nets. In the future, Ryann wishes to improve and expand his livelihood for his family. He wants to give them better means and a comfortable ways of living. To do this, let us help this man reach his goal by giving him the amount he has requested.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Galino

texts.es:
Galino con 53 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Galino se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, menestras, etc, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de local y para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los habitantes de la zona.

Galino es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido tres créditos de S/.2000,00; S/.1500,00 y S/.4500,00 los cuáles los ha pagado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de Edpyme Alternativa su negocio mejoró notablemente y su calidad de vida de igual forma
texts.en:
Galino is 53 years old, in a civil marriage, and lives with his partner in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque deparment, Peru. He lives in a rural area where the inhabitants generally work in agriculture, business, and livestock.

Galino sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, basic household goods, etc. He has more than 10 years of experience in his business, which is located in his home. He seeks a loan to make infrastructure repairs to the locale, for working capital, and to buy more merchandise. This investment will increase his sales, greatly influencing the business. In this way he plans to have a greater stock of products in order to be able to serve the diverse needs, requirements, and likes of the inhabitants of the area.

Galino is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had three loans for S/2000.00, @/1500.00 and S/4500.00 which have been paid in a punctual manner. Since becoming a member of Edpyme Alternativa his business and quality of life have notably improved.

loans.use: to make infrastructure repairs to the locale, for working capital, and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Karla Mariela

texts.es:
Karla, de 26 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y aplicada en sus estudios, actualmente estudia en la universidad y esta muy emocionada porque pronto culminará su carrera, no tiene hijos y está soltera. 

Karla, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende productos de primera necesidad y gracias a ello ha podido pagar sus estudios y todos sus gastos. 

Karla, necesita el préstamo para bebidas, golosinas, café, pan, entre otros para su tienda. 

Los sueños de Karla, son poder invertir en su negocio para salir adelante y terminar su carrera universitaria y asi convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Karla, 26 years old, is a hardworking young woman, dedicated to her studies. She is currently studying at the university level, and very excited that she will soon have her degree. She does not have children and is single.

Karla has a store in her home where she sells basic necessities. Thanks to this, she has been able to pay for her studies and all of her expenses.

Karla needs the loan to buy drinks, candy, coffee, and bread, among other things, for her store.

Karla's dream is to invest in her business in order to get ahead, finish her university degree, and, thusly, to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candy, coffee, bread, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling avon products. Mercy is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 33 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. She has been running her own beauty saloon for the past 15 years, so she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Robina has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
on this financial assistance Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophea works as factory laborer and she also does extra work as salon maker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Viboul's Group

texts.en:
Viboul’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Viboul makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Milfe

texts.en:
Milfe, 36, is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has four children, aged 10 months and 9, 15 and 17 years old. Her husband works hard as a fisherman, while she helps him in his business. Apart from this, she sells dried fish to the community.

Milfe’s greatest dream is to improve and expand her business to have enough money for her children. She wants them to finish their studies. To achieve her goal, she is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net and boat engine as well as dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a boat engine and dried fish.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita lives in the town of Tubigon, in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a carpenter and also runs their farm, while she runs a small grocery store. She has run her small grocery store for the past four years to earn a living.

Crestita and her husband work hard to meet the needs of their family. With this, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as chocolate bars, chips, candies, bread, biscuits, laundry soap, toiletries, spices, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, noodles, canned goods and drinks. She will also buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their plants and to be able to have abundant harvests. In the future, Crestita dreams to improve her family's standard of living and have a sustainable means of living.

loans.use: to buy chocolate bars, chips, candies, bread, biscuits, laundry soap, toiletries, spices, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, noodles, canned goods and drinks for her grocery store. It also helps her to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon is a farmer living in Tbaung Khmum province. She is a widowed mother of a school-aged son. Residing in a wooden house, this breadwinner earns a living through growing wet season rice and selling fish. She has been in her farming business for 30 years. Challenge to rice growing business is drought.

This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund and she is the leader of three members group. Sinuon is going to use her loan to support her farming business by purchasing organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. For some portion left, she will use it to buy subsidiary objects such as fuel for pumping machine, organic weedicide and organic pesticide. She hopes that her rice crop will produce abundant outputs to her so that she can uplift her lifestyle and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy subsidiary items such as fuel for a pumping machine and organic weed killer to produce abundant outputs.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel and her family live in the town of Tubigon, in Bohol, Philippines, where she sells a variety of goods. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and has been proficiently running it for 11 years.

Isabel is a 60-year-old woman, and is married and has six children. Isabel’s husband is a farmer and works hard to provide for their needs. Isabel’s only wish is to improve their business and have a sustainable means of living.

To make this happen she needs additional capital to buy varieties of goods that will help her improve her sales and become profitable. She will buy sacks of rice and dry goods such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, spices, salt, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, candies, chips, biscuits, bread and mosquito repellent.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, eggs, canned goods, spices, salt, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, candies, chips, biscuits, bread and mosquito repellent.

loans.name: Julia Yayanie

texts.en:
Julia Yayanie is a sari-sari store owner and lives in a small town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has nine children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while youngest child is one-year old. Her husband provides the need of their family as a laborer.

So this is reason why Julia Yayanie works hard. She needs to help her husband in raising their big family. She wants to improve her business to give good education to their children. Thus, she needs a loan to buy varieties of goods such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, and assorted vegetables.

loans.use: to buy she needs a loan to buy varieties of goods such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, and assorted vegetables

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Living in a local area of Battambang province, Socheata is 19 years old and a single lady. She is working as a teacher to earn a living.

On the other hand, she is a university student who studying to major in Accounting. Due to having not enough capital to support her studying, she is now requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for her school fees. She hopefully to get a good-paid job after graduation and be able to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees for a BSc. in Accounting.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina resides in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is 54 years old and a sari-sari store owner. She has been operating this business since last year, earning PHP 1,200 per month. She also sells frozen products such as tocino (bacon) and longganisa (cured, sweet pork sausage). She is asking for a loan to buy chips, soft drinks, bacon, and cured sweet pork sausage locally known as longganisa.

These items sell on a daily basis. By buying in bulk, she can be assured of higher earnings. Marcelina also hopes to eventually increase her income as she will continue to introduce more merchandise into her store in the coming days. Her profit pays for the family's needs for school fees and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy to buy chips, soft drinks, bacon, and cured sweet pork sausage locally known as longganisa.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a wife and a mother of four boys. Three of them are still aged 8, 10 and 17. Three years ago, she started raising hogs and selling dried fish to earn an income.  This is also to help her spouse who is a carpenter.  Jocelyn is asking a loan to buy more dried fish that she can sell to her neighbors as well as piglets that she can raise as early as this time to maximize her profit. Her income will be used to pay the school fees of her children.  Jocelyn is 40 years old from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and piglets to raise

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema, 62, lives a simple life in the province of Iloilo, Philippines. She and her family earn a living by selling dried and fresh fish to the community. Her husband is a fisherman and definitely works hard to support the needs of their family. They have been blessed with two children, who are 22 and 17 years old.

Nema sells fresh fish, which her husband catches. For the future, she wishes for business improvement and sustainability. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy dried fish to sell. We can possibly help this woman through the loans we entrust to her.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
42-year-old Rosario is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. As a mother to eight children, she works hard to provide for them. She sell bananas and raises hogs to earn amliving and provide for their needs. Rosario would like to ensure that her efforts in raising her hogs paid off. She is asking a loan to buy feed for her hogs and more bananas that she can buy and sell.

Rosario always make it a point to save her earnings so she can pay the school fees of her children and pay her loan dues on-time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and more bananas

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandría con 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Alejandría cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Alejandría se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos,pollos,cuyes,ganzos,etc, con una experiencia desde hace más de 10 años en el rubro. Adiiconalmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida de manera interdiaria. Solicita préstamo para la compra de eternit para realizar unos arreglos en su casa. De esta manera le facilitará vivir con seguridad con su cónyuge en casa propia.

Alejandría es socia reactivada para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Alejandría is 54 years old. She is in a common law marriage and she lives with her spouse and their children in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru. Alejandría has very good work and personal references from the residents of the area. Most of them work in agriculture, trade and ranching.

Alejandría raised and sells small animals like ducks, chickens, guinea pigs, geese, etc. She has more than 10 years' experience in the field. In addition, she makes and sells food every other day. She is asking for this loan to buy Eternit cement to do some home repairs. This will make it easier to live safely in her own house with her spouse.

Alejandría is a re-activated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy Eternit cement to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is a 53-year-old woman from Dumanjug, Cebu. She has been in the hog raising business for twelve years now. This is her source of income in addition to her husband who is a farmer. Gregoria is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed and stocks of food for personal consumption. With this she will be able to expand her business and her family can eat a healthy diet. Gregoria dreams of making her business a successful one. She believes that if she is provided with financial support such as this loan, she can finally realize her dream of making her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and stocks of food for personal consumption

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Like the majority of Filipinos, what Antonia dreams of for her family is to experience a more sufficient living condition someday. With positive hope to reach this, Antonia manages her current variety store business with patience and diligence. Recently, she availed herself of a loan that was faithfully paid back. With the given amount of PHP 15,000, she was able to supply her store with more dry goods and grocery items that she sold for additional income. 

To continue the improvement in her current inventory, she would like to request again for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 that she will use to add sacks of rice, beverages, assorted groceries, and load wallet for cellphone load retailing. If granted, this will be a good chance for her to increase her profit and ease her family's expenditures.

For now, she would like to extend her sincerest thanks. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add sacks of rice, beverages, assorted groceries, and load wallet for cellphone load retailing

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is musician who plays the piano and sings. He performs at different restaurant in Alaverdi town, where he lives with his wife and their newborn daughter.

Davit plays with his band, and dreams of expanding his audience. He asks this loan to purchase a car and be able to travel to different regions in Armenia, with his band. Davit loves his work and music very much and hope to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a car to have a concert tour in different regions of Armenia and gather more income for his new born family

loans.name: Ivan Arnoldo

texts.es:
Iván, de 22 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, solo estudio hasta octavo grado y debido a la falta de recursos económicos se creció solo con su madre y tenía que trabajar para ayudarle a su madre; está acompañado desde hace dos años y es padre de un niño de 1 año de edad y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar.

Iván, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y frijoles desde que tenia diez años de edad, hoy en día tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijoles en la comunidad, pero además trabaja en la ciudad desde hace varios años, pues su madre lo llevaba a la panadería donde trabajaba y ahí aprendió a hacer pan y ahora va a la ciudad a trabajar en la panadería también; aparte de eso también puede hacer hamacas de seda y de poli-seda, porque su madre le enseño.

Iván, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pagar mano de obra y alquilar la tierra donde tiene sembrados los cultivos de maíz y frijoles, de esa manera pretende asegurar la alimentación de su familia y generar ingresos para cubrir otros gastos del hogar.
 
Ivan, sueña con hacer su propia casa, donde pueda tener mejores condiciones de vida; pero además de esp también espera seguir trabajando en la agricultura, la panadería y la elaboración de hamacas para obtener ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ivan is 22 years old and is a young entrepreneur. He only studied up to the eighth grade and, due to a lack of economic resources, he was raised alone by his mother and had to work in order to help her. He has been in a relationship for two years and is the father of a 1-year-old son. His wife works taking care of the household duties.

Ivan works in agriculture, specifically harvesting corn and beans. He has done this since he was ten years old. He currently has 3,500 square meters of corn and beans in the community. But, he also works in the city which he has done for a number of years. His mother would bring him to the bakery where she worked and there he learned to make bread. Now he goes to the city to work at the bakery as well. Aside from this, he can also make hammocks from parachute nylon and polyester because his mother taught him.

Ivan needs a loan to purchase fertilizer, pay for labor costs and to rent the land where he has planted his crops of corn and beans. In this way, he hopes to provide food for his family and generate income to cover other household costs.

Ivan dreams of building his own home, where he could have better living conditions. But aside from this, he also hopes to continue working in agriculture, the bakery, and making hammocks to earn an income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor costs and to rent the land where he has planted corn and beans.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 29 años de edad, es una persona que todos los días se esmera para que a su familia no le haga falta nada. Teresa cuenta que gracias a su crédito ella pudo comprar sus fertilizantes y a su cultivo de café logro brindarle su mantenimiento, a Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y le dejo una buena ganancia. Teresa con el afán de brindarle a su familia un mejor hogar ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, arena y piedrín; esto con el fin de remodelar su casa.
Su gran sueño es mejorar su casa antes de finalizar el año, para que sus hijos tengan una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Teresa is 29 years old. She is a person who does her best every day so that her family lacks nothing. Teresa says that thanks to her loan she was able to buy fertilizers and provide maintenance to her coffee crop. Thanks to God she was able to obtain a good harvest and was left with good earnings.

With the desire of providing a better home to her family, Teresa has decided to seek a new loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and gravel, with the end goal of remodeling her house. Her biggest dream is to improve her house before the end of the year, so that her children have a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to remodel her house.

loans.name: Salomi

texts.en:
Salomi is maize farmer from Gidan Yawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Salomi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salomi would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salomi can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Salomi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso was born in 1971 year. She is married and has 4 children. Khayriniso lives and works in South Tajikistan. She has been busy with buying and selling women clothes. Khayriniso buys in a bulk women clothes and sells in a local market. She has her own point of sale.

Khayriniso has a good reputation in the local market. She manages her business alone and has been working in this field for more than 20 years. Khayriniso is going to increase her working capital for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy women's clothes. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 46 years old and relies on her sari-sari store business to provide for her family. She also sells barbecued meat for additional income. She is a married woman with three dependents aged 8, 10 and 18. Life with a sari-sari store business also involves challenges, especially if goods are taken on credit. Maria cannot say no to some people who have been her good customers but it also affects her inventory level. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of canned goods, liquors and soft drinks. She hopes to make the most of her business so she can uplift her family’s living conditions. Her income will be for food, school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy  more stocks of canned goods, liquors and soft drinks

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has three teenage children aged 16, 14 and 11 years old. She earns a living together with her husband through fishing. They have been proficiently doing this business for 16 years. Aside from this, Enriqueta is also engaged in selling dried fish to the community. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing rope, fishing weights and fish trap known as bobo. They need this to help them to enhance their catch. In the future, Enriqueta wishes to be productive and sustainable. She wants for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing rope, fishing weights and fish trap known as bobo.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora needs to improve her small farm in order to provide a livelihood for her six children, aged four to seventeen.

She needs to ensure that she will have a good harvest of eggplants and string beans. However, the harvest is still months away, so it is difficult for her to raise the money to pay for fertilizer and pesticides. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

A loan from CEVI will enable her to better manage her farm. The increased income from a good harvest will go towards her family's day-to-day needs and providing them with a healthy diet. She would also like to save up to her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 41-year-old woman from the town of Alegria, Cebu, is into farming vegetables such as string beans, squash, eggplants and banana. She is also good at cooking snacks. She cooks doughnuts that are sold in the community.

She works hard to provide for her seven children. Her eldest is seventeen and the youngest is two. Lydia spends her time selling her snacks and farming while also taking care of her family.

She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With the additional capital, she will have a chance to cultivate her land and manage her farm better. Her income will be used to provide healthy meals for her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a businesswoman and resident of Dumanjug, Cebu. She is a 57-year-old married woman. Her husband is an OFW (overseas foreign worker).

Edna is a "carenderia" owner. Carenderia is a local term used by people in remote places, instead of saying "restaurant". She sells fried fish, pork stew, fish soup, noodles and sauteed vegetables. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like seasoning, condiments, meat and vegetables, and to pay the tuition fees of her youngest child, aged 17. Her income will be utilized for healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business. Edna only dreams of seeing all of her family having a good life and becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, condiments, meat and vegetables, and to pay the tuition fees of her youngest child.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina con 53 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera, vive junto a sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Justina cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Justina se dedica a brindar los servicios de venta de soya ,contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su misma casa. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mas envases y de su producto de soya en cáscara , ayudará en la implementación de su negocio para así poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. La perspectiva es poco riesgosa por que Justina cuenta con todo sus implementos para su negocio y la competencia es poca ya que el sigue implementándose en su negocio.

Justina es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha tenido crédito por un monto de S/.1000 soles a 12 meses las cuáles las pagó con fechas puntuales y antes de la fecha. .
texts.en:
Justina is 53 years old, single, and lives with her 3 children in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru. She lives in a rural area. Justina has good personal and work references from inhabitants in the area. People in this zone work primarily in agriculture, business, and livestock.

Justina provides services selling soybean, using her own work tools, she has had this business for more than 2 years. Her business is located in her home. She seeks a loan for containers and soybeans. The loan will help her business be able to provide better service to her customers. The loan has little risk as Justina has all her tools for her business and little additional skill is needed for her to continue implementing her business.

Justina is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had a loan for S/1000 for 12 months which she paid punctually and prior to the deadline.

.

loans.use: to buy more containers and soybeans.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La señorita Amelia es de una familia humilde y con escasos recursos, desde el nacimiento de su hija ella tuvo que generar ingresos, en vista de no poder obtener un título de licenciatura, conllevo a tomar cursos técnicos en lo que respecta el área de peluquería ya que desde pequeña tenía el hobbie de peinar y maquillar a sus amigas con las que frecuentaba. Pasaron 4 años del nacimiento de su hija y ella lleva capacitándose desde el año 2007 en el INSTITUTO DE BELLEZA "WUILMAN" donde adquirió el diploma entro los que destacan Peinados de alta Fantasía, Maquillaje Profesional, Peluquería y cosmetología; dado a que tiene escasos recursos procedió a trabajar percibiendo destajos de los ingresos generados en la peluquería hace 5 año y 2 meses aproximadamente; estos destajos le generan un gastos. El préstamo que requiere la señorita es para ayudar a su madre que ya se encuentra de edad avanzada y con debilidades físicas, desea iniciar una actividad económica relacionado con lo que más le gusta hacer, desea implementar su propio salón de belleza, donde pueda ofrecer a su clientela los servicios básicos como ser: Peinados, cortes Tinte completo, Rayitos, Mechones, Manicure y Pedicura; siempre brindando un servicio eficaz con respaldo de conformidad, por la experiencia adquirida.
texts.en:
Señorita Amelia is from a simple family with scarce resources. Since the birth of her daughter, she has had to generate income. In view of not being able to obtain a university degree, she took technical courses in the hairdressing area, because ever since she was little, she had the hobby of styling hair and applying makeup for the friends with whom she visited.

Four years have passed since the birth of her daughter, and she has been getting training since 2007 at the Wulman Beauty Institute, where she acquired a diploma. Among the notable courses were very fancy hairdos, professional makeup, hairdressing, and cosmetology. Given that she has scarce resources, she proceeded to work, earning piece rates from the income generated in the hair salon for approximately 5 years and 2 months. These piece rates generate some expenses for her.

The loan that this young woman needs is to help her mother, since she is of advanced age and has physical weaknesses. She wants to begin an economic activity related to what she most likes to do: she wants to set up her own beauty salon where she can offer her customers basic services such as hairdos, haircuts, complete dyeing, highlights, curls, manicures, and pedicures, always offering efficient service with a guarantee of satisfaction, because of the experience she has acquired.

loans.use: to set up a unisex beauty salon in order to offer better services to her clientele and generate income for her family.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijas de las edades entre 15 y 21 años de edad, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Tomas para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como piloto desde hace 5 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes con el que obtiene un poco más de ingresos.
Tomas es un padre de familia muy generoso, y desde hace algunos días ha pensado en remodelar su casa pero lamentablemente no le ha sido posible por esa razón acude a un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena y piedrín; el espera contar una casa en mejores condiciones.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son, fortalecer su negocio, terminar la remodelación de su casa y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 43 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with three daughters between 15 and 21 year old. This beloved family lives in a community of Santo Tomas La Unión.

In order to obtain income and get his family ahead, Tomas has worked as a pilot for 5 years. But to improve his income, he also has a grocery store with which he earns a little more income.

Tomas is a very generous husband and father and for some time he has planned on remodeling his home, but unfortunately this hasn't been possible. That is why he is turning to a loan to buy cement, sand and gravel. He hopes to have his home in better conditions.

His goals in life are to fortify his business, finish remodeling his house, and paying for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to remodel his house.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! Thanks for being a part of Emelita's journey. With your previous financial support, she has enhanced her animal-raising venture, resulting in a more profitable source of income. With the PHP 10,000 loan, she was able to buy more piglets, chicks, feed, and vitamins, plus additional supplies for her store. You are such a blessing!

Now she wants to continue cultivating her primary business, the variety store. Since her animal-raising venture is stabilizing as of now, she plans to give more attention to improving her store inventory. Again, she would like to ask for your help. She's borrowing a PHP 10,000 loan that she will use to acquire enough quantities of assorted groceries and soft drinks to resell. She prays that you will give your trust and grant her request again. She has proven once that she's faithful in repaying.

Emelita hopes to earn well for her children's education and future security. She's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push toward the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to acquire enough quantities of assorted groceries and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Kumari's Group

texts.en:
Kumari is a 46-year-old lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. This humble and smart lady has a family of four. Kumari is a primary school teacher by profession and works really hard in order to fulfill all the necessities of her family. Her husband has certain serious health issues and is not able to work anymore. So, Kumari is the only breadwinner in her family. She has two daughters. Her elder daughter and her younger daughter are continuing their studies. After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Kumari is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Kumari will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her elder daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter complete her education smoothly and will help her in getting a good job with a pretty good package, which will help her in gaining financial stability.

Kumari is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees of her elder daughter's banking course

loans.name: Malati's Group

texts.en:
Malati, standing in the middle, is a differently abled lady who hails from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is from a low income household and has undergone a lot of hardships in order to sustain her livelihood. She is unable to undertake any work as she is differently abled. The income that is earned by her husband is used to meet the daily expenses of her household. The major problem that Malati faces is that she does not have an appropriate toilet at her home so she has to travel a long distance at odd hours to relieve herself. She does not find this practice feasible as she fears the risk of her privacy getting hampered.

Therefore, Malati along with her other group members is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a safe, clean and hygienic toilet at her home so that she will be able to restore her privacy.

Malati is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a safe, clean and hygienic toilet at her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia makes the most of her home in Matag-ob, Leyte. She is a 63-year-old married woman and a sari-sari (variety) store owner. Her store can be found within her house.

She loves her business, for it keeps her from boredom; it gives her something to do while also earning her an average income of PHP 3000 per month. Virginia is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will allow her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Virginia dreams of making her business bigger.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Good day to you lenders! Alicia extends her warm appreciation to you for your previous assistance worth PHP 15,000. It has been utilized in purchasing more supplies of native baskets and bamboo products that she sold and consequently it gave additional income to her family.

Now she still longs to continue improving her business. That is why she appeals for a PHP 10,000 loan this time. Again, she will buy additional woven baskets that she will sell house-to-house. She will also help supply the needs of their farm through seedlings and fertilizer.

She has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she’s determined to maintain her integrity. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional woven baskets and help supply the seedlings and fertilizer for their farm.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Four years ago, Lilibeth and her husband raised their family through fishing. They work hard together to support and provide the needs of their children. They have two children; ages 13 and 10 years old. Their only hope is to improve their livelihood to give their children a better life. They want them to finish their studies. To do this, they are requesting an amount to buy squid.  They will definitely go into the business of buying and selling to help them enhance their livelihood. With the help of our fund, we can probably help this woman and her husband reach their goal.

loans.use: to buy squid

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
"Where there is a will, there is a way - this adage is evident in the life of Melenia in Alegria, Cebu. In spite of raising six children aged five to eighteen, she manages to engage in hog raising as well.

Her barn is not concrete, but she managed to keep her hogs housed in the small space. In addition to raising hogs, she also grow vegetables.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed to sustain their growth. Melenia has high hopes that the loan will positively impact her business. She aims to make her business bigger so she can put her children through school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ana Matea

texts.es:
Ana, de 45 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja vendiendo gas, tienen 3 hijos mayores, dos de ellos ya no viven con ella y solo un hijo vive con ella.

Ana, tiene una tortilleria desde hace 10 años, ella contrata personal para que le ayude con el trabajo; la tortilleria la tiene en su casa y el horario de venta es de 5:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m.

El préstamos que está solicitando es para comprar pollos de engorde, pues ella criá para venderlos en navidad y así poder obtener algunos ingresos extras, además de la tortillería. 

Su sueño, es comprar un carro para poder transportar su maíz para la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 45 years old, is a housewife. She went to school through third grade. She is married. Her partner works selling gas. They have three adult children. Two of them no longer live with her. Only one son lives with her.

Ana has had a tortilla business for 10 years. She hires people to help her with the work. She has the tortilla business in her house, and the hours for sales are from 5:00 am to 7:00 pm.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy chickens to raise, since she raises them to sell at Christmas to thus be able to obtain some extra income, in addition to the tortilla business.

Her dream is to buy a car to be able to transport her corn for the tortilla sales.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Uma's Group

texts.en:
Uma is a 49-year-old lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. This humble lady has a big joint family. Uma works as a tailor. She provides quality services to her customers and earns her livelihood from the same. She has two daughters and a son in her care. Her elder daughter got married two years back and her younger daughter and son are continuing their studies. After meeting the daily household expenses, Uma is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Uma will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son complete his education smoothly and will help him become tech savvy and get a good job with a handsome package.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course.

loans.name: Gouri's Group

texts.en:
Gouri, the lady standing in a red saree on the extreme left in the photograph, is a mother of two daughters. She, her husband, and her children reside in Koraput district in Odisha, India. Gouri and her husband have a very limited monthly income. Every month she is forced to fork out around 300 INR towards her family’s medical expenses as a result of the sanitation crisis they face. Like many Indians, Gouri and her family still do not have access to modern sanitation, and are forced to defecate in the open. Open defecation is disastrous as it is impossible to keep human feces away from crops, wells, food, and children. According to studies, hundreds of children die every year due to preventable sanitary-related diseases. Lack of sanitation facilities also means trekking at-least a kilometer to relieve themselves. And women like Gouri bear the brunt, as they are mostly attacked and assaulted when they step out early in the morning or late in the evening.

In order to improve their sanitation facilities, Gouri along with her other group members, have approached Kiva's partner Peoples Forum, seeking a loan of 45,000 INR. She intends to use the loan towards construction of a toilet at home. Your loan will help Gouri and her family to improve the quality of their lives. Gouri is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to construct a hygienic toilet at her home

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 42 years old and runs a small business operating a sari-sari store, selling canned goods, noodles, soda, soap, toiletries, coffee and sugar. She lives in the southern part of Cebu in the town of Moalboal. She has sold goods in this area for ten years.

Nida and her husband have 2 children who are currently studying in school.

Nida has requested a loan from CEVI to expand her business. With the loan, she would like to purchase more goods to sell such as canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor. Her profit will be primarily used for food and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, comenta que con el crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente se ha visto muy beneficiada  ya que ha podido fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su grupo familiar; algo que hasta sus clientes se han visto beneficiados porque ha podido mejorar la calidad y el servicio que les ofrece en el comedor.
Ella nuevamente solicita un crédito ya que quiere comprar una cocina industrial que le permitirá obtener otros ingresos por medio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas, además quiere abastecerse de arroz, aceite, frijoles entre otros para continuar con la venta de comida, está nueva inversión le permitirá continuar trabajando y atendiendo las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria would like to note that with the loan she was previously granted she was able to strengthen her business and has seen many benefits. With the earnings she made, she was able to improve living conditions for herself and her family. Her clients have also benefitted because she has improved the quality and service in her dining room.

She is asking for a new loan to buy an industrial stove that will allow her to earn more income by making and selling tortillas. She also wants to stock up on rice, oil and beans, among other things, so she can continue selling food. This new loan will allow her to keep working and meeting the demands of her clients.

loans.use: buy an industrial stove that will allow her to earn more income by making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a married woman with eight children, She lives in Matag-ob, Leyte with her family. She is known in their place for her sari-sari store (convenience store) business. Recently, she requested a loan to restock her store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, hair conditioner and condiments. It is her dream to see her children have a chance to live a comfortable life through their education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, hair conditioner and condiments

loans.name: Manjula's Group

texts.en:
Manjula, standing on the right hand side in the photograph, is enthusiastic to start her own enterprise. She has observed a rising demand for poultry and thus has decided to begin with getting hens and eggs. She plans to make omelettes and other egg delicacies and sell it. Earlier, she was engaged in only taking care of her poultry[ this is her idea of work expansion. Manjula's family includes her husband and their two children. They live in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha, India. Her husband and elder son work as daily wage labourers and her younger son is enrolled in school.

To execute her plans, she needs capital and thus she, along with her group member, have approached Kiva's partner Peoples Forum for a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more baby chickens in order to expand and grow her business to a different level. We respect the zest of the lady to continuously progress in life.

Manjula is awaiting your kind hearts to help her run her business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more baby chickens

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. She is 33-year old married woman with two children. Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she raises hogs as supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store and piglets. These are vital and could serve as fuel to improve the economy of her house. She could also maintain the stocks of her store and manage her finances. She could now raise more hogs to become more productive.

In the future, Marites is looking forward to continue managing her sources properly to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store and piglets.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina raises hogs for her family’s needs. A livelihood that she has maintained for two years now, Rizalina is determined to expand her business. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. A loan will be of great help for Rizalina, for it gives her the opportunity to improve her business as well as her income. Her earnings will benefit her three children aged 12, 14 and 15.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is a 28-year-old married mother of two children ages six and three. She resides in Matag-ob, Leyte.  She is engaged in cooking and selling snack foods to the people in her community. She also raises hogs for supplemental income.  Marife is requesting a loan to buy another piglet and stocks of feed for her pigs. This is the start of her planned expansion so that her family will be able to live in a comfortable house and her kids can study in school. Marife dreams of a bigger future for her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and stocks of feed.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn like most mothers, wants the best for her children. She works hard for her six school-aged children. She cooks meal food that she can sell at a profit. She also runs a sari-sari store business.
She would like to expand her business and offer some more dishes and different merchandise to her customers but due to limited funding, she needs the loan to do so. The loan will be used to buy bottled water, soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, seasoning, noodles, cooking oil and biscuits.

Her income will be for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy bottled water, soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, seasoning, noodles, cooking oil and biscuits

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is a wife and a mother from Ormoc, Leyte. With five children aged 1 to 16, she is engaged in raising farm animals to provide for them. She has goats, ducks and chickens that she usually sells in the market to earn a living.  She would like to have more of these animals to increase her profits. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy goats and chicks so that she can add to her chicken coop and have more goats to raise. Any income generated will be for school fees and her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy goats and chicks

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 55 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y trabaja con su pareja, solo uno de sus hijos vive con ella. 

Ana, es empleada en la alcaldía de su municipio y sus funciones son darle mantenimiento y mantener aseado, pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la agricultura, pues fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres y también tienen ingresos extras por la venta de gasolina.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 2 terneros, el préstamo le ayudara a aumentar su negocio de ganado y le ayudará a ahorrar y cubrir sus gastos de salud. 

Su sueño es, tener una gran ganadería y construir una mejor casa, porque en la que hoy vive es de bahareque y es muy pequeña y está en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
55-year-old Ana is a housewife. She studied until the 6th grade, is married, and works with her partner. Only one of her children lives with her.

Ana is employed by her municipal mayor's office and her role is to maintain and clean it. But apart from this, she earns a living in agriculture, as this was the profession that her parents taught her. In addition, she has extra income from gasoline sales.

The loan she is requesting is to buy two calves. The loan will help her grow her cattle business and will help her save and cover her health expenses.

Her dream is to have a large ranch and to build a better house, because the one she lives in today is made of mud, very small, and in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
Pan, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is worried about her children's future. Though they are still in school, it is time she thought about their life. With the family income at present, they are barely able to make ends meet. When they grow up, she wants to send them to college. For years she has harbored a dream to send her children to one of the numerous colleges in Jeypore that she has been watching teeming with students from all over the state. But for that, there needs to be additional income for the family. Pan decided to do something about it instead of just worrying about it. After much consideration, she decided to start a goat-rearing business. It is something that she can run out of her house itself and can give sufficient time to her children. The investment is also low compared to other businesses and the returns high. She can sell meat and milk from goats for a profit.

Therefore, she along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more goat kids. She can also sell young goats born in her herd. Can you help erase the worry-line from her face?

loans.use: to purchase more goat kids

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza spends her days cooking to earn a living. She cooks vegetables, noodles, soup and rice. This business of hers provides an income for her family, especially her four-year-old son.

She is asking for a loan to buy condiments, seasoning, vegetables, meat, soy sauce and cooking oil. She hopes to start a sari-sari (variety) store business someday to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy condiments, seasoning, vegetables, meat, soy sauce and cooking oil

loans.name: Jelfa

texts.en: Jelfa was excited to show us her fridge full of frozen products. In it, she has spring rolls, spanish sausage (chorizo),  and hot dogs.  This has been her business for one year now. She works hard to help her husband who is a driver in providing for their two children ages 10 and 6. She aims to have business expansion in the days to come and will use her loan to buy more chorizo, hot dogs and spring rolls.  She is 27 years old and lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy more chorizo, hot dogs and spring rolls

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
For the last three years, Niza has operated her small business in Moalboal, Cebu. She sells Natasha products such as clothes, belts, perfume, lotion, lipstick and plastic wares to the people in her community.

Niza is 37 years old and the mother of four children, aged one to nine. Niza is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy shirts, perfume, lotion, lipstick and bags. She also hopes to expand her business to pay for the school fees of her children.

It is her dream to grow her business and have a big stall.

loans.use: to  buy shirts, perfume, lotion, lipstick and bags

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una gran mujer de 39 años de edad, es soltera y con grandes aspiraciones en la vida. Juana cuenta que gracias a su crédito ella pudo realizar la inversión en su negocio de elaboración de pulseras típicas, afortunadamente a muchos clientes logro abastecer con su producto, y sus ingresos mejoraron.
Juana con el afán de seguir prosperando con su negocio ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos con el crédito ella comprara; hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina. Con esta inversión ella espera satisfacer mejor a sus clientes y con sus ganancias comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
